project.name: The Pearlescent Tarot, Charms & Quest
project.description: A symbol-focused tarot deck, a playable quest and tactile charms, where meaning shifts with light, choice, and time.

creator.name: WonderStruck
creator.biography:
Wonderstruck Studio is a small, independent creative studio made up of just three of us. We come from different walks of life, shaped by different trades, experiences, and perspectives, but we found one another through a shared love for symbolism, art, and the quiet magic of tarot.

We didn’t begin with a grand plan. What started as conversations, sketches, and late-night ideas slowly grew into something real. Each of our decks is born from life itself, moments we’ve lived through, things we’ve observed, emotions we couldn’t quite put into words. Every deck carries its own meaning and stories, shaped by personal experiences and the world around us.

Along the way, we’ve faced many hiccups and uncertainties, creative doubts, production challenges, and times when we weren’t sure if we were on the right path. Being an indie studio means learning as we go, often through trial and error.

Kickstarter changed everything for us. The encouragement, patience, and sweet appreciation from our backers truly overwhelmed us. Your kind messages and belief in our work gave us the courage and energy to keep moving forward, even when things felt difficult.

We create tarot decks with care, intention, and deep respect for symbolism. We’re still growing, still learning, but we’re incredibly grateful to be on this journey together and even more grateful to share it with such a supportive community.

Thank you for believing in small creators and for helping us continue, one card at a time.

titre: Deeper Play : Let the Journey Unfold
texte: To truly understand this deck & charms, you must understand its soul: 螺鈿 (Luódiàn), the ancient Chinese art of mother-of-pearl inlay.
The art of Luódiàn, the luminous inlay of mother-of-pearl, Its origins are recorded as early as 1500 BC, in the twilight of the Xia Dynasty and dawn of the Shang.

For over 3,500 years, Chinese artisans have performed this alchemy. They took luminous shell, believed to be “frozen moonlight”, the very essence of intuitive yin energy, and inlaid it into objects of sacred power. This was never mere decoration; it was a spiritual philosophy: the art of breaking a whole to create a new, more radiant whole.
Over this vast timeline, the craft reached its zenith of refinement over 1,200 years ago in the Tang Dynasty, becoming a treasure of the imperial court.
Now, for the first time, this ancient light, a legacy spanning three and a half millennia, meets the tarot.

What we love most about mother-of-pearl is how it’s made. It forms slowly, layer by layer, inside a shell, often as a response to irritation or pressure. Over time, what could have stayed rough or hidden turns into something luminous. And even then, it never looks the same twice. It changes depending on the light, the angle, the moment.
That felt instantly familiar to us, because tarot works in a very similar way.

Tarot doesn’t give everything away at once. You grow into it. You revisit the same cards years later and see something completely different. Not because the card changed, but because you did. Meaning layers itself over time, shaped by experience, intuition, and reflection.
That’s why mother-of-pearl belongs at the heart of Pearlescent Tarot.

The pearlescent effect in this deck isn’t just there to look beautiful (though we won’t pretend that doesn’t matter). It’s there to remind you that meaning shifts. That nothing is fixed. That how you hold the card, and where you are in your own life, changes what you see.

For collectors, this deck isn’t just something to own, it’s something to live with. Something that feels different in your hands over time. A deck that holds light, story, and intention quietly, without needing to announce itself.
And honestly, that’s exactly what we wanted it to be.

A shift in light, a change in sight.
Pearlescent Tarot is a symbol-focused deck designed for slow, intuitive reading. As the cards catch the light, their meaning shifts—inviting you to see each symbol differently depending on the moment, the question, and where you are in your journey.

The Major Arcana in Pearlescent Tarot is a mirror rather than a map, offering timeless archetypal energy without prescribing a single path—allowing each reader to discover their own journey within the symbols.

The Suit of Cups speaks in quiet emotional language. Through symbolic forms rather than scenes, these cards explore feelings, intuition, relationships, and the inner world, without fixing them into a single story.

The Suit of Pentacles speaks to the tangible side of life—work, stability, growth, and the rhythms of the physical world. Expressed through symbols rather than scenes, these cards focus on what is built slowly through care, effort, and time.

The Suit of Swords explores the realm of thought, truth, and clarity. Through symbolic forms rather than scenes, these cards reflect the mind—its questions, conflicts, insights, and moments of sharp understanding.

The Suit of Wands carries the spark of movement, intention, and inner fire. Expressed through symbols rather than scenes, these cards speak to inspiration, direction, creativity, and the energy that sets things in motion.

Mother-of-pearl is all about patience, gentleness, and layers formed over time. It doesn’t rush, and it doesn’t try to shine all at once. Pandas are kind of the same. They move slowly, deliberately, and without urgency. They’re strong, but soft about it. Calm, but resilient.

The way the pandas cling to the branches, sometimes upright, sometimes upside down, mirrors how mother-of-pearl catches light differently depending on how you look at it. A small shift in angle changes everything. There’s no single “correct” view, just different moments revealing different sides.

Together, the panda and the pearlescent idea remind us that tarot doesn’t need force or intensity to be meaningful. Wisdom can be gentle. Growth can be quiet. And sometimes, the most beautiful insights appear when you slow down enough to notice the shimmer.
The Pearlescent Tarot comes housed in a top and bottom lid box designed to feel just as special as what’s inside.

When closed, it’s quiet and elegant, dark and protective. When opened, the box reveals an inner world of colour, pattern, and symbolism, almost like opening a small treasure chest made just for the deck. We wanted the box to feel intentional, not just functional. Something sturdy, satisfying to open and close, and beautiful enough to keep on your shelf or table.

To us, a box It’s not just about packaging.
It’s the first moment of the experience and the place the journey returns to when you’re done.
Pearlescent Tarot doesn’t stop at reading.

As we worked with the deck, we kept wondering what happens when tarot isn’t something you simply interpret, but something you move through? When symbols don’t just sit on the table, but guide you from one moment to the next?
That question led us somewhere unexpected.
And it’s where the journey truly begins : The Pearlescent Tarot Quest

The Pearlescent Tarot Quest came from a simple question we kept asking ourselves:
What if tarot wasn’t something you just read… but something you could step into?
There’s no pressure to “get it right,” no winning or losing, and no rush. Some sessions might feel playful and light, others quiet and thoughtful. Both are exactly as they should be.

You can play the Quest on your own, as a small ritual or moment of reset, or share it with others and let conversations unfold naturally. You don’t need tarot knowledge or gaming experience, just a willingness to follow curiosity and see where it leads.
What's Included in the Quest Set:
We wanted the Quest to feel tactile and grounding, so every piece was chosen with care.

Velvet Quest Cloth (500x500mm)
Soft and grounding, this cloth creates a small space just for the journey, something that signals it’s time to slow down.

4 Copper Tokens
Used to mark progress, choices, or moments along the path. Simple, weighty, and satisfying to hold.

Tiger’s Eye Crystal Dice
A stone long associated with focus and protection, adding a gentle element of chance and direction.

Tiger’s Eye Crystal Dice (approx. 220x200mm)
A stone long associated with focus and protection, adding a gentle element of chance and direction.

The Quest doesn’t replace Pearlescent Tarot, it complements it.
The deck and the charms speak the same symbolic language: one on paper, the other in your hands. Together, they offer two ways to explore the same 78 archetypes.
If you’ve ever wished tarot could be something you step into, this is it.
The charms are the part we didn’t expect to fall in love with as much as we did.
They’re small. Simple. Easy to overlook at first. But once you start using them, they stay with you.

Each of the 78 Pearlescent Tarot Charms carries the energy of a tarot archetype, but instead of living on a card, it lives in your hand. Some charms mark progress in the Quest. Some represent choices. And some just seeking you to detour. They sit beside you throughout the session, or end up back in the pouch with a little extra meaning attached to them.

Over time, they start to hold memories.
“This one came up when I was stuck.”
“This one always seems to find me even if I returned it.”
That’s where the magic happens.

78 Charms (Acrylic, 28 × 20 mm)
These charms correspond to the full tarot archetypes and are designed for use in the Pearlescent Tarot Quest, ritual work, or collecting.
You don’t need to prepare. You don’t need to know tarot. You don’t even need a plan.
To begin the Quest:
Let intuition guide your choices rather than overthinking
That’s it.

The Quest unfolds naturally as you play. Each charm you draw becomes a moment, sometimes playful, sometimes reflective, sometimes unexpected. There’s no “right” way to experience it. You simply move forward, one step at a time.
If you can draw a charm and roll a die, you can play.
Once you’re comfortable, the Quest opens up into something richer.
As you play more intentionally, you’ll begin to notice:
You can add layers by:

Deeper Play isn’t about complexity, it’s about attention. The more you bring to the Quest, the more it reflects back. Whether you stop after a light, playful session or dive into a longer, story-driven journey, the Quest meets you exactly where you are.
This might be for you if…
Whether you come for the deck, the Quest, the charms, or simply the feeling behind them. Pearlescent Tarot invites you to explore at your own pace, in your own way.

Our estimated delivery is set for July/August, and we’re doing everything we can to ship earlier if possible. We’ll keep you updated every step of the way, so you’ll always know exactly where things stand as Pearlescent Tarot makes its way to you.

Most importantly, we want you to know this: all backer orders will be fully shipped before we begin any wholesale or retail distribution. Your support is what makes this project possible, and we’re committed to honouring that trust.
As always, we’ll stay transparent, communicate openly, and share progress updates as they happen.

We are committed to making sure your rewards arrive safely and smoothly, no matter where you are in the world. Shipping costs will be calculated and collected after the campaign ends via our pledge manager. This allows us to charge you accurately based on your location and the rewards you choose.

Cost Estimation
Shipping costs vary depending on destination, package weight, and contents. Adding extra items may increase shipping fees, and remote or hard-to-reach areas may incur additional charges.

Customs, Taxes, and Duties
Shipping prices do not include local taxes, duties, or VAT. These are determined by your country’s regulations and are the responsibility of the backer. If a package is returned due to unpaid fees, incorrect address, or refusal, re-shipping costs will be borne by the backer.

Flexibility
You may update your shipping address or modify your order until final shipping costs are collected. Please note: if you do not confirm your pledge within a week after our notification email, we will consider our obligations fulfilled. However, if you reach out after this period, we may, at our discretion, process a refund or proceed with shipping your pledge.

Tracking and Delivery
Every shipment will include a tracking number. It is the recipient’s responsibility to track and receive the package. If undeliverables and returned, re-shipping costs will apply.

Our Commitment
We take every step to ensure your rewards are packed with care and delivered in the best condition possible. If you have questions or concerns, we’re always here to help.

Wonderstruck Studio started the simplest way possible: three buddies, a shared love for tarot, art, and making things with meaning. We’re a small indie studio, just the three of us working closely, slowly, and very intentionally. We don’t rush projects, and we don’t create things just to look good (though we do care a lot about that too). Every deck we make begins with a feeling, a story, or a question we can’t stop thinking about.
Now let us properly introduce ourselves.

Thank you, truly.
We’re incredibly grateful for the support you’ve shown Pearlescent Tarot. Whether you’ve just discovered this project, or you’ve been quietly supporting our work over the years, please know that it means more to us than we can easily say.

Every pledge, share, kind message, and moment of encouragement has helped carry this project forward. We don’t take that lightly. Because of you, this deck has the chance to exist and that’s something we’re deeply thankful for.

The journey is still ongoing, and if you feel like sharing the campaign, telling a friend, or simply keeping us in your thoughts, it truly helps more than you might realise. Even the smallest support makes a difference.
We’ll continue to share updates and behind-the-scenes moments as we go, and we’re just really glad to have you here with us, walking this part of the path together.

project.name: Cherry Dreamwoven - Lenormand
project.description: A delightfully intuitive Lenormand, bursting with color and whimsical charm designed to offer clear, grounded guidance for everyday.

creator.name: The Wheel Of Fortune Tarot
creator.biography: Hello, we are tarot printing specialists and creative designers of unique tarot decks. With extensive experience in the tarot industry, we focus on high-quality printing and production for both our own designs and clients' projects. Our verified sister account is [WOF Tarot]. Check there for more upcoming 2026-2027 projects.

titre: Important Notes (Please Read) The card meanings and sample interpretations in this project are artistic and beginner-friendly interpretations based on traditional Lenormand symbolism. This deck is not a strictly academic or traditional Lenormand set for instructional purposes; instead, it prioritizes an experience focused on storytelling association, daily observation, and intuitive inspiration.
This is the original creative manuscript of the fairy-tale Lenormand deck.
texte: Have you ever envied those who seem to read the clues of life?
Do you find the Tarot system complex and its symbols abstruse, yet still crave a more straightforward, life-closer way to guide your questions?

Then welcome to the world of Lenormand—a divination system centered on life scenarios and clear symbols, helping you observe the present and possible future paths. This time, we’ve prepared a special gift for you: a Lenormand deck specially designed for beginners and fairy-tale souls.
Why is this "Your First" Lenormand?

Designed for Beginners
Includes a concise beginner’s guide (in Chinese/English) with basic card meanings and common introductory spreads (1-card ✔, 3-card ✔✔, modern 5-card cross ✔), helping you complete your first basic experiential reading in a short time.

Focused on Life, Not Abstract Mysticism
Lenormand excels at responding to concrete and practical questions, such as:

Should I accept this job offer?
How will this relationship develop next?
Will this matter move forward?
It is more like a visual language for observing clues in life.
Both Artwork and Practical Tool
How does this deck "tell stories"?
The examples below are only meant to illustrate ways of associating with the cards and do not represent fixed or exclusive meanings.

Drawing the "Fox" reminds you to stay alert and strategic today.
The appearance of "Garden" may hint at a public occasion or social interaction.
When "Anchor" and "Heart" appear together, they might point to an issue related to emotional stability.
Through combinations and associations, your daily life gradually weaves into a story of your own.

A colorful window opening onto fairy-tale imagery and clues to life.
We believe divination need not be obscure, solemn, or alienating.
It can also be gentle, vividly visual, and as approachable as a fairy tale.
This fairy-tale themed Lenormand deck is based on the traditional 36 Lenormand symbols — (45 cards in this set).

From Rider to Key, from Garden to Star —
each symbol is reimagined into artistic illustrations brimming with fairy-tale forests, magical creatures, and a retro aesthetic. Every card retains its original symbolism while becoming a "readable" little story of its own.

Because the artist of Cherry Dreamwoven Lenormand used a wealth of precious metallic pigments in the original illustrations, we have chosen to print the Collector's Edition on premium laser (holographic) paper. This ensures that the stunning metallic texture and shimmering depth of the original artwork are captured as faithfully as possible.

Why Support Us via Crowdfunding?
You are not just purchasing a deck of cards,
but also taking part in a Lenormand creation project centered on fairy tales, imagery, and life observations.

And one last thing we’d like to say to you:💜
Life itself is a series of pictures yet to be fully understood.
If you are willing to pause, observe, combine, and listen—
this Fairy-tale Lenormand deck may accompany you to slowly see the clues hidden within.
The genuine evaluation of the customer!（Thank you so much~ ❤️）

project.name: Nolands - Glimpses of otherworldly, extradimensional realm
project.description: An artbook that lets you experience an unknown world full of monuments, strange architecture and symbols not known to any human being.

creator.name: Wydawnictwo Diablaq
creator.biography: We publish niche comics by Polish artists and actively support the growth of Poland’s underground comics scene. We sponsor festivals and projects, championing bold voices and independent storytelling.

texte: An endless desert. Architecture defying logic. Afterimages of writings in unknown tongues. Symbols from no earthly system. An over whelming silence. And finally, above all, those monuments. Strange, abstract monuments. Each one different. Each one inducing changes in the minds of those who observe them. Some claimed they moved. Being near them evoked feelings of unease, sometimes even fear. Yet also wonder and an eerie longing.

Such is the description told by those who claim to have visited that otherworldly (perhaps even extradimensional) realm. Lacking better words, it was simply called:
Nolands. Over the years many ventured there. Some even returned to tell what they saw.

So what are the Nolands? A cancerous land feeding on our reality?
A sophisticated psionic weapon from a parallel universe? A neo-demiurgic experiment that got out of hand? The idea of a world that never came true? A shared nightmare dreamed under the influence of extraterrestrial drugs? A project made by unknown powers?
YES.
Text above by: Jerzy Łanuszewski
100 pages with more than 50 artworks depicting the cold and unknown Nolands. Unique design of the book allows you to experience art in three different languages (English, Polish and Japanese).
Each artwork is presented in two separate formats:
That way you can experience Nolands from different perspective and appreciate the masterful work of Przemysław Wideł and his one of a kind vision.
Technical details:

Born in 1992 in Nowy Sącz, Poland.
Draftsman, illustrator, comic artist, muralist, creator of objects and video works.

He holds a PhD in Fine Arts in the discipline of visual arts and art conservation. He is an Assistant Professor in the 5th Drawing Studio at the Faculty of Painting of the Jan Matejko Academy of Fine Arts in Kraków. He also works as an artistic project coordinator at the ACADEMICA Foundation of Students and Graduates of the AGH University of Science and Technology in Kraków.

Wideł is a curator and exhibition designer, having worked on numerous exhibitions, including Stany Splątane, Taniec duszy, Turboprorok and Confluence at the Manggha Museum of Japanese Art and Technology; Młoda Akademia at the Nowa Huta Cultural Centre; and the SYNESTEZJE. Music. Visual Arts. Word Festival at Klub Studio AGH.

After several smaller gallery presentations, he made his solo exhibition debut with THE PLAY at Galeria Messier 42 in 2016. His works have since been exhibited at Galeria Pryzmat, Bunkier Sztuki, the Manggha Museum of Japanese Art and Technology, Galeria OFF-FRAME, the Zamek Cultural Centre in Poznań, the Doctor’s House in Zakopane, Galeria Labirynt in Lublin, Klub Studio in Kraków, and The Sumida Hokusai Museum in Tokyo.

He creates short comic forms published in collective anthologies such as Zeszyty Komiksowe, Warchlaki and Warchlaki na dyskotece. His portfolio also includes numerous commercial projects, including album covers, book design, and poster work. He has collaborated with the fashion brand MEDICINE, creating original clothing prints, and actively works with online creators from the fields of games, film, literature, and fantasy (Bez/Schematu, Czerw Fantastyczny).

project.name: Love and Deepspace Enamel Pins
project.description: Introducing Love and Deepspace enamel pins by RistArt!

creator.name: Kuromitsu Kitsune
creator.biography:
Hello! We are an art circle that loves creating art and enamel pins.
Please check out our linked websites for more information~

texte: Hi, welcome back! We are Kuromitsu Kitsune, an art circle passionate about anime and game fan merchandise. Thanks to your support, we’ve already brought several enamel pin collections to life. Now we’re back with Love and Deepspace enamel pins, featuring new designs, early backer bonuses, and Kickstarter exclusives!
Our initial goal is S$1000 to unlock the first design (both colours). Every extra S$1000 unlocks another character pin (both colours), and more support means more designs gets revealed and produced!

• Material: Zinc alloy with gold finish plating
• Size: ~2 inches / 5 cm tall
• Backing: Dual pin posts with rubber clutches
• Accents: Screen-printing details & glow-in-the-dark effects
Glow-in-the-Dark Note: The glow areas charge best under UV light, sunlight, or a strong flashlight. Once charged, they glow brightly for about 30–60 seconds, then fade. This is a normal effect for enamel pins and adds a fun extra detail for collectors.
By following these guidelines, we can ensure a smooth and enjoyable experience for all backers. Thank you for supporting our campaign and helping us succeed!
Dates are estimates and may shift slightly due to production or shipping. We’ll keep backers updated every step of the way.
Standard shipping will be calculated and collected in the pledge manager after the campaign. Please see the table below for the estimated shipping fees.

This isn’t our first journey! We’ve successfully delivered Honkai Star Rail Enamel Pin Vol 1, Vol 2, Vol3, along with other series like Sleepyhead and ZZZ pins through Kickstarter. You can also find our work on Etsy or Official shop Ristation.id. This campaign may be a limited run, once sold out, they may not return!

project.name: Luke Skywalker Bronze for Portmagee, Co Kerry, Ireland
project.description: A sculpture cast in Bronze to be located in Portmagee, Kerry to cement the legacy of the filming of the Star Wars movies in Ireland.

creator.name: David O'Brien
creator.biography:
Managing Director of Bronze Art Fine Art Foundry.
Education in Modelmaking and SFX for Film 
Been involved in the creative arts in Ireland and abroad since 1999

texte: My name is David O’Brien , I am a massive Star Wars Fan and I want to put my passion into reality!
IF YOU BUILD IT THEY WILL COME!
Mark Hamill Bust - bronzeart.ie
I am also a huge Mark Hamill Fan and I had previously met him in Ireland in March 2018 when he was The Grand Marshal for the St Patricks day parade here in Dublin.

During his time here he had a talk in the American Ambassadors Residence and I was lucky enough to have met him briefly and presented him with a Bronze Bust which ultimately was shipped to him in the US and is in his possession through Disney Ireland.
My mission is t make a Bronze Life Size Sculpture of Mark as Luke Skywalker to be made and unveiled in Portmagee ,Co Kerry Ireland where we filmed Star Wars The Last Jedi .
https://goo.gl/maps/DgBEAuHqs32e6UA38
I have sculpted although not quiet completely finished the sculpt.
I still have the cloak to sculpt out as well as some finer details. But I feel the likeness is really good of Mark himself as Luke in the Last Jedi.

It is in Clay and ultimately it will be put through the lost wax process and cast in Bronze to make it a full-size bronze statue that would be on the harbour quays in Portmagee where the boats go out to the Island that featured in the movie.
Before we do this there are a few steps we need to take.
For us the goal is to keep Portmagee on the tourist map after all the buzz from the Star Wars Movies being shot here in Ireland.
I feel the statue would be a really amazing attraction for worldwide visitors to see  other  than the beautiful natural landscapes that Mark experienced while he was here.
Ideally it is to be unveiled on the 4th of May 2027 this  would be amazing as there are ongoing to be Star Wars events like Celebration on that could do a live unveiling here from Ireland.

gone.name: Invitation to the Unveiling
gone.desc: Backers will get an invitation to the unveiling.

project.name: Project Puppet; Let's Bring Art To The Streets
project.description: Larger than life puppets

creator.name: Sofia Hernandez Crade
creator.biography: Sofia Hernandez Crade grew up in the rural town of Divide, Colorado, a place still teeming with untamed beauty where the sound of mountain lion calls and coyote howls often sing louder than the rumble of passing cars. She attended Beloit College in Wisconsin, where she obtained a degree in Fine Art. There she received several awards for her work, including Best Thesis for her sculpture installation. She also had the privilege of working as an advocate, teaching Art Therapy to survivors of sexual assault for three years. While doing so, she was recognized with the honor of Volunteer of the Year in the city of Beloit.  She worked as the Art Director at the Squash Blossom Gallery and later at the Broadmoor Galleries, where she enjoyed representing a wide range of artists and their work for several years. She enjoys working in a variety of different mediums including sculpture, oil, watercolor, and pastel. Recently she has gravitated towards multimedia projects.  This mixing of materials allows her pieces to develop in unexpected ways. For Sofi, there is no better feeling than allowing oneself space to play and experiment. She enjoys working in a variety of different mediums including sculpture, oil, watercolor, and pastel. Recently she has gravitated towards multimedia projects.  This mixing of materials allows her pieces to develop in unexpected ways. For Sofi, there is no better feeling than allowing oneself space to play and experiment. Sofi is proud to now be a full time studio artist since 2019 and enjoys living and creating art in the picturesque Downtown of Colorado Springs. While doing so, she has also been teaching multidisciplinary art classes to the youth of the springs, in hopes to foster creativity in the minds of the next generation. Currently she is focused on large scale public work projects such as her most recent 24 foot puppet commemorating a beloved local artist and legend Charles Rocky, featured in the town Marti Grau parade.

texte: How It Began

It’s impossible to tell the story of my journey into creating giant puppets without acknowledging the tremendous losses they were born from. After the tragic death of my 19 year old brother Demitri , I felt compelled to live life fiercely, to lean into experiences that challenged and inspired me, but most importantly to orient myself towards the healing power of community. So when the prospect of making a puppet for a parade was presented, I dug my teeth into the endeavor hoping to bring art to the streets and celebrate life. Little did I know that the act of creating work that invigorated me would truly breathe life back into me, and thus the puppets were born! Last year we suffered another unthinkable loss, the death of our sweet Thomas, who led the 2024 parade with his unforgettable smile. This time, I felt the need to retreat, to lick my many wounds, to heal.
This year the theme of the Manitou Springs parade is Love is All You Need.

I have thought about the many flavors of love a lot in these past few years, sickly sweet love, laugh until you cry love, profound toe curling, teeth chattering love. Then there is the difficult love, the confounding love, the painful love, the void of heartbreak that is left when grief takes hold and love is all that is left behind. Love is comfort, love is pain, love is growth, love is renewal.
Love is Wild!
THE WOLVES

For me, no animal encapsulates the immense, dynamic polarizing power of love quite like the wolf. This keystone species wields the ability to change worlds, shifting rivers, creating wetlands, and building habitats for multitudes of other life, wherever they roam. Mating for life, they show deep devotion and loyalty to their pack, helping to raise young and take care of their elders. They understand the tremendous strength in community. Yet even the bravest among us would have to concede that the site of a pack of wolves would send shivers down their spine. This apex predator both creates life and abundance, while simultaneously taking it. In our modern world we attempt to drive out adversity, persecuting predators in hopes of creating frictionless spaces, forgetting the essential balance nature requires. What does it mean to truly love? Can we ever truly love without risk, without tensions?
How can one claim to love the wilderness yet denounce the wild?
THE DREAM

The intent is to have these larger-than-life puppets enchant the crowds with their presence, creating a surreal and magical atmosphere, transporting us back to when we were children and everything seemed possible. This summer I hope to bring this show on the road, traveling all over Colorado. I have also been asked to partner with the Southern Ute tribe, as well as Ute Pass Elementary. My hope with these whimsical happenings is to help create community through shared memory. Now more than ever, the world needs art to unite us and remind us of our common humanity, to celebrate and allow ourselves safe spaces to embrace joy.
THIS YEAR'S PROJECT

This year I have been working on a pair of of wolves. These wolf puppets will stand roughly 12 feet high and be around 17 feet long. All of their joints will be fully articulating. I have also been working on rebuilding the 24 foot Charles Rockey puppet, in preparation to bring him back to his beloved hometown.
CALL TO ACTION
Undertaking this project marks my biggest challenge yet as an artist.

While the task ahead may seem daunting, I am filled with enthusiasm to bring this dream to fruition. Together, we can transform an artistic vision into a captivating reality, bringing art to the people and making it accessible, helping to foster an atmosphere of otherworldly whimsy and imagination. These enormous community projects are quite costly and require dedicated, knowledgeable blacksmiths, carpenters and transportation and storage fees, not to mention the enormous material expenses. The Charles Rockey puppet cost me $4,000 in materials alone and thousands more for storage. We were able to raise $3,000 with the help of generous donors, for whom I am most grateful, however I have yet to break even , let alone pay a penny towards my efforts. everything helps and is very much appreciated. I promise that any donations will be put to good use and help fill our streets with art!

project.name: Transformation Central
project.description: A hub to share transformation-related content, including digital art, comics, stories, and much more!

creator.name: Dory
creator.biography: Just a silly cat with murderous intent :3

texte: Around a year ago, a friend showed me a strange, if old, Discord bot. It was quite the thing. A bot similar in nature to what TupperBox, if you knowwhat that is, does, but specific to the transformation community. It was a then abandoned and rusty bot, but packed with a lot of features and old love. Stemming from a joke of "I could do it better", I whipped out in a week TransforMate. Originally a bot only ever used for two servers, my inability to advertise it led to it dying out and catching dust, with its only real merit being reviving the development of its predecessor.

The story could very well have ended there, but, due to a series of events, that involved me bumping the server late in the night, and some very passionate people joining the server, that the bot got bigger than I ever expected it to. I had to verify it with Discord, and in less than three months it was in over 500 servers, and the server for it had grown into a cozy and vibrant community.

It was inside this community, whilst going on a wild rant, complaining about the existing ways of sharing our passion for art, and how all of our once safe places had become plagued, either by people who shunned our existence and shouted bad-mouthed words at us, or the craze of AI drowning out the real art that has always stayed so close to this community. I said, as a comment, that I should make a better platform. One where the use of AI was moderated, where hate had zero tolerance, and where we can all search for, comment on, create, and rate quality content. Because enjoyment was always the point.

So, with that little story, I want to talk to you about The Transformation Central, or TF Central for short. A hub for literature, digital and traditional art all about this marvelous community, that has brought me such joy over the years. With sorting, user ratings, and an intuitive search, and zero ads, I want to keep the site clean and intuitive. Somewhere where searching for stuff you like, and getting it recommended, is easy, and does not require you to get a masters on "what should I sort by now". We will also sort out AI and dangerous content, manually reviewing it carefully, and working with creators to provide a safe and enjoyable experience for everyone, where we can enjoy real art, made by real people.

I also want to approach this from the values that TransforMate has always represented for me. Values of freedom, ease of use, and free access. The only time when you'll be asked to pay for anything, is when you want to help creators you love, and get stuff they've made to cater to their audience. I will only take a 10% fixed fee over their earnings, which is the only way in which I will be earning money from this, which is necessary to upkeep both the physical infrastructure, as well as a moderation team, and my own ability to update the platform and fix errors with the utmost haste.

Ideally, all of the code behind the platform will be shared as fully open source, for everyone to read, modify, or use, as long as it isn't in a commercial manner. The goal of this is both maintaining the same policy of openness as TransforMate, as well as allowing for people to help out, add features they want, or, if the project ever failed, be able to pick it back up from where I left.

I have a lot of ideas to put into practice, but, this isn't a small goal. It's ambitious and risky. I need money to buy the hardware for the servers on which to host this platform, as well as to justify the enormous amounts of time and effort I would need to put to achieve this goal. I do hope I can see my dream through, and have your help in my way there. Guess I'll see you all at the end of the lengthy road. <3

gone.name: "I just wanna help out"
gone.desc: For those who just want to help out a little bit with the development of this corner of the internet. You will have helped bring a big dream for a big community a tiny step forward.

gone.name: Helping hand
gone.desc: For those who want to help out a little bit more. Your name will be writing in a slightly larger font in the credits, and, once the TF Central is out, you will get a small badge in your profile, announcing to the world that you were there since the start. Thank you <3

gone.name: Hardware provider
gone.desc: Well this is quite a bunch of money. Your generous pledge will probably be put almost exclusively towards the hardware the TF Central will be hosted on. After all, we want to have a reliable, trusted, and reliable way of keeping all of the beautiful art the community provides safe, sound, and forever available. As a reward, you will get access to the beta, so you can test and give us diret feedback on the earliest iterations of the platform.

gone.name: The Creator Special
gone.desc: So, you're a TF-related content creator huh? And you like the thought of this new platform I'm putting together? And you want to pay an even lesser percentage of your earnings to me? Seems fair and reasonable to me! You will not only get reduced fees (3% to 8%, compared to the normal 10% fixed fee), but you will also be allowed to start using both the subscription and art sale services available as part of the creator shop, before they are available for public sign-up.

items.name: Early access to the creator shop

gone.name: I Am Rich
gone.desc: This tier is for the people who have too much money laying around. It will not give you the Creator Special benefits, but it will put your name, in big, bold golden letters at the top of the "Thank You" section, and give you an "I Am Rich" badge in your profile. Enjoy.

comments.text: Cette personne a annulé son engagement.

replies.text: Most likely the community values. The technical side is easy to run, once you have the stuff running, it's pretty much just maintenance and sometimes updates. But the community values, including the low fees, will make it hard to upkeep them. But, as my previous projects have proven, I will stand by them even if it loses me money.
Cette personne a annulé son engagement.

project.name: La Antigua Lotería. // The Ancient Mexican Bingo.
project.description: Grabados originales para la Antígua Lotería. // Original linocuts for the Ancient Mexican Bingo

creator.name: Jahir Albor
creator.biography:
Jahir Albor es un artista nacido el 31 de agosto de 1980 en la Ciudad de México. De madre potosina y padre michoacano, inicia desde niño con su experimentación a través de diversas técnicas de dibujo y acuarela. Es al inicio de su etapa universitaria, cuando se propone iniciar una exploración más intensa del color y la composición dentro de la pintura, así como la creación de imágenes personales cuya inspiración la encuentra en la vida cotidiana de su entorno inmediato. En 2014 logra el primer proyecto artístico en el fondeo colectivo de Latinoamérica, creando una versión contemporánea de la antigua lotería tradicional mexicana. En 2015 funda el Taller de la Gráfica Independiente de México e inicia la realización de un fanzine en el mismo taller. En 2017 crea para la Universidad Cuauhtémoc un Árbol Cósmico en la serie de seis murales llamado "La Herencia de la Noche". En 2023 inicia con la dirección de la serie de retratos audiovisuales ElarteHabla, donde comienza a documentar conversaciones con los artistas vivos de nuestro tiempo. Por más de dos décadas ha trabajado por medio del performance, música, literatura, arte urbano, grabado, publicaciones editoriales, artesanía, video, pintura figurativa y abstracta.

Actualmente está volcado en las vanguardias que ofrecen la filosofía, la estética y la convergencia de las cosmogonías ancestrales latinoamericanas dentro del universo contemporáneo.

texte: En la lotería mexicana la muerte convive con la piña, el diablo y el corazón. Pareciera que la naturaleza física y metafísica de sus elementos se contradice, pero no es así: son partes de la realidad de nuestro mundo.
Esta obra que presentamos es una serie artística basada en la antigua lotería tradicional mexicana entendida como un juego, pero ante todo como un lenguaje simbólico vivo.

La obra se compone de 53 grabados originales en linóleo realizados a mano, a partir de los cuales se producirán ediciones limitadas y una versión de lotería industrial pensada para su distribución comercial.
No es nostalgia. No es reproducción decorativa.
Es una obra basada en la tradición, hecha para el presente.

Emerge desde México, pero no habla de identidad como bandera, sino de territorio, cuerpo, humanidad y memoria. Es nuestra antigua manera de entender el mundo donde lo espiritual y lo material no están separados.

En 2014 Jahir Albor creó una serie de 52 obras originales al óleo, por medio de las cuales ilustró un juego de lotería basado en las temáticas más populares de la antigua lotería de México. Hoy publicamos la segunda parte de este proyecto.
Se generará una nueva serie de obras artísticas, ahora por medio de grabados originales basados en la misma colección. Puedes ver los detalles de la temática completa en http://www.instagram.com/antigualoteria

Abordando la misma temática propuesta  en 2014, el maestro Jahir Albor realizará la representación de cada elemento mediante grabado en linóleo. Para ello, cada imagen se refleja primero en espejo y de esta manera se trabaja en negativo. Con una navaja, el artista retira de la superficie del linóleo aquellas áreas que no desea imprimir. El resultado es una placa terminada, una matriz original que funciona como un sello a partir del cual se producirán las estampas.
Cada imagen surge de un proceso en el que no todo está decidido de antemano. El grabado exige tiempo, paciencia, presencia y riesgo. El error no se corrige: se incorpora. Aquí el artista no controla completamente el sentido; lo hospeda.
Las placas originales funcionan como un origen, como un gesto fundacional del que todo lo demás se desprende. Antes de cualquier reproducción, la imagen pasa por la mano y el cuerpo. La producción industrial no la sustituye: la prolonga.

A partir de estas imágenes, el juego de lotería deja de ser un objeto lúdico para convertirse en un dispositivo performativo. En cada partida, las imágenes se activan en tiempo real mediante la voz, la espera y la atención compartida. Lo que ocurre no es solo un juego, sino un acto ceremonial. Este performance funciona de manera análoga a la vida misma: no todo está bajo control, el azar interviene, las decisiones se toman en el presente y el sentido se construye mientras ocurre. Cada jugada es única, irrepetible, y su significado depende tanto de la imagen como de su organización y posición dentro del juego, como de quien la nombra y quien la recibe.

Al apoyar este proyecto haces posible que realicemos obras hechas con tiempo y oficio, a través de un lenguaje simbólico antiguo que dialoga con el presente. No financias solo una producción: participas en la continuidad de algo esencial.

La serie está pensada con ediciones claras, procesos gráficos perdurables, coherencia conceptual y proyección a largo plazo.
Este proyecto no busca imponer un significado, sino invitar a recordar algo muy simple: Somos cuerpo, somos tierra y todos somos parte de un mismo espíritu.
Algunos detalles del proyecto artístico compartidos en una conversación para el Taller de Gráfica Independiente por el maestro Jahir Albor:

COLECCIÓN ESTÁNDAR
30 COLECCIONES COMPLETAS
Cada colección incluye:
CARACTERÍSTICAS:

IMPRESIONES EN PAPEL ESPECIAL
HASTA 10 COLECCIONES COMPLETAS

OBRAS REALZADAS (P/R)
HASTA 10 COLECCIONES COMPLETAS

LIBROS DE ARTISTA
PRIMERA EDICIÓN ARTESANAL
CATÁLOGOS
CARTELES
POSTALES
Se crearán 30 colecciones completas con 54 grabados impresos sobre papel de primera calidad.

Esta imagen muestra las invitaciones que se generaron para la inauguración de la primera serie. Aquí las presentamos sólo para ejemplificar los grabados que se crearán para la inauguración del proyecto, que en esta ocasión será en julio de 2027. A todos los fondeadores que obtengan piezas artísticas originales se les harán llegar uno o varios ejemplares.
Se producirán seis colecciones certificadas de grabados intervenidos con acuarela manualmente por el artista.
Se crearán seis colecciones certificadas con 54 grabados impresos sobre papel italiano 100% algodón de primerísima calidad.
Estas imágenes son una representación muy aproximada de la portada y los interiores de los tres libros de 40x55cm que se producirán con la colección completa de grabados originales certificados.

Los juegos de lotería estarán impresos en cartulina marfilada de primera calidad. Todos los ejemplares distribuidos en este proceso de fondeo estarán autografiados en el respaldo de la primera tabla del juego.
Edición especial de 200 catálogos de la colección completa impresos sobre papel cultural ahuesado.
Se publicarán los avances del trabajo a más tardar el primer día de cada mes en la página AntiguaLoteria.com y en las redes sociales de @AntiguaLoteria. El plan de fechas tentativas es el siguiente:
2026
2027

Estamos gestionando para hacer la exposición inaugural en la Ciudad de México y luego configurar una exposición itinerante en varios estados del interior de la República Mexicana. Realizaremos las conexiones necesarias para poder exponer el proyecto en Europa, Estados Unidos y en el mayor número de locaciones posibles en Centro y Sudamérica.

project.name: LOOK UP Times Square Open-Air Gallery to the Venice Biennale
project.description: A global creative-experiential movement uniting art, technology, storytelling & human connection ingite shared moments of inspiration.

creator.name: Rachel D. Vancelette
creator.biography:
Rachel Vancelette is a curator, art advisor, creative technologist, and founder whose career has been defined by one central mission: connecting people, ideas, and culture in ways that create lasting impact. With more than two decades of experience across the global art, fashion, and media worlds, she has built a reputation for bridging creative disciplines while championing artists, designers, and cultural leaders on an international stage.
Her career began in the heart of the contemporary art world, with senior roles at leading galleries including Yvon Lambert Gallery and Gladstone Gallery, where she worked closely with some of the most influential artists of her generation. Since 2010, Rachel has also contributed regularly to Vogue Italia, writing on the intersection of art, fashion, technology, and culture long before cross-disciplinary collaboration became a cultural norm.
Rachel is the founder of Vancelette Global Art Acquisitions, where she advises private collectors, institutions, and foundations on major acquisitions, exhibitions, and cultural strategy, as well as INTROXPERT, a creative-leader marketplace connecting vetted experts across art, fashion, media, and technology. Her work consistently centers on access, visibility, and empowerment, helping creative voices reach audiences that might otherwise never encounter them.
LOOK UP was born from this same ethos. Conceived as a public art and media initiative rooted in optimism, reflection, and human connection, LOOK UP transforms one of the world’s most commercialized spaces, Times Square, into a platform for meaning, creativity, and shared experience. For Rachel, LOOK UP is both a call to action and a reminder to pause, to notice, and to re-engage with the world around us, together.
Through LOOK UP, Rachel invites audiences worldwide to experience art as a shared moment of presence, curiosity, and hope, proving that even in the busiest places, creativity can still unite, inspire, and gently shift perspective for everyone everywhere.

titre: LOOK UP: From Times Square to the Venice Biennale
A Global Creative-Experiential Movement Uniting Art, Technology, Storytelling & Human Connection
texte: 🌍 What Is LOOK UP?
LOOK UP transforms iconic public spaces into open-air galleries of inspiration using large-scale digital billboards, art, movement, music, and storytelling to reach millions of people every day.
LOOK UP 🌎 Whether it’s a mantra, a message of hope, or a moment of reflection, your words can move millions
It is a question.
What does LOOK UP mean to you?

Through public art, storytelling, and interactive technology, LOOK UP invites people to pause, reflect, and share their own meaning creating a collective conversation that moves across cities, cultures, and voices.
✨ Why LOOK UP Exists
LOOK UP was born during a moment of global crisis, when the world felt heavy, fractured, and overwhelming. During that time, strangers repeatedly offered the same simple words:
“Look up.”

At first, it felt like comfort.
Then perspective.
Eventually, it became a question.

Look up from what?
Look up toward what?
And why?
That question became the foundation of LOOK UP—a movement designed not to provide answers, but to create space for reflection, expression, and human connection in public space.
🏙️ Why Times Square?
Times Square is one of the most powerful visual stages on Earth, with 200,000–330,000 pedestrians passing through daily, and millions more engaging through global live streams.

In collaboration with the Times Square Alliance, LOOK UP officially debuted on Thanksgiving Day, a moment rooted in gratitude, reflection, and shared humanity. What began as one billboard grew to three, offered by media partners who recognized the cultural intention and value of the project.

LOOK UP turned architecture into a canvas and technology into a connector inviting hundreds of thousands of people in a single day to reflect on what inspiration, hope, and perspective mean to them personally.
🦃 Thanksgiving Day: The LOOK UP Debut
On Thanksgiving Day, LOOK UP presented nearly 40 creative luminaries across 40 creative disciplines including artists, dancers, musicians, writers, and cultural leaders.
Each contributor responded to one question:
What does LOOK UP mean to you?
Rather than delivering a single message, LOOK UP became a collective chorus of voices transforming Times Square into a living, breathing open-air gallery.
The activation reached hundreds of thousands in real time and millions more via Times Square’s live-stream cameras, bringing public art directly into people’s homes.

A GLOBAL GATHERING OF LIGHT Each participant contributed a one-minute video of WHAT LOOK UP MEANS TO THEM was broadcast to millions throughout the day across the three Time Square Billboards rotating twice an hour. Vieweres scanned QR codes embedded on the screens connecting audiences directly to the full videos and biographies, transforming Times Square into an interactive gallery of global creativity.
With more than 1.5 million viewers daily, LOOK UP merges art, film, and technology into a shared meditation on connection and possibility.

The living audio videos are now being archived in the LOOK UP Video Library at
www.lookuptimesquare.com, forming a permanent and growing digital gallery that will continue to travel the work.  Key contributors list is included on the website, highlights include:
📱 A First-of-Its-Kind Interactive Billboard Experience
LOOK UP introduced a new interactive billboard experience to Times Square.
For the first time, digital billboards displayed QR codes allowing passersby to connect instantly from the street to individual creator videos on their phones.

Using a 3D billboard experience, the INTROXPERT mascot reached out into Times Square holding an iPhone and scrolling creator videos in real time helping bridge public creative creations and personal storytelling.
🎨 The Creative Voices
LOOK UP honors diversity of thought, background, and expression.

There was no script.
No directive.
No single interpretation.
Each participating creative defined LOOK UP in their own way creating a mosaic of perspectives reflecting the richness of the global creative community.
LOOK UP exists to support creative voices, compensate artists fairly, and demonstrate how art and storytelling can thrive in public, technology-driven spaces.

LOOK UP unites an extraordinary global community of artists, visionaries, and cultural and creative industry leaders, including legendary photographer Michel Haddi; renowned portrait artist Andy Gotts, MBE, presenting a rare dedication featuring Sir John Hurt speaking the words of John Lennon; The Lost Warhols creator Karen Bystedt; choreographer Jacqulyn Buglisi and artist Rossella Vasta of The Table of Silence Project; environmental leaders from The Perfect World Foundation; abstract Peruvian painter Nathan Brujis; French-American artist Diane Detalle; philosopher and Oprah SuperSoul 100 teacher Gordana Biernat; motivational speaker Helene Beck, host of the Coming From the Heart Podcast; Studio 54 icon Nikki Haskell; monumental sculptor Juan Garaizabal; photographer Karin Ebbesson / The House of AnnaLisa; NYC downtown artist Matthew “Matt” Enger; beauty pioneer Laura Geller; conceptual artist Lisa Dawn Gold; Greg Miller and Dance Parade NYC, celebrating movement as a universal language; multimedia artist Lindsey Nobel; Chinese visual designer Yanze Xiong (MIAOHUA 妙華); curator and wellness guide Payal Arts; music industry veteran Jeff Rogers; artist and spiritual teacher Ash Ruiz; multimedia artist August Quinn; and iconic Warhol Factory figure Robert Dupont and many more together transformed Times Square into an open-air gallery of art, movement, voice, and shared humanity. 

Find the full list of LOOK UP luminaries at our website: www.lookuptimesquare.com and our instagram @introxpert9

In the Venice exhibition there will be a curated selection of new and former voices in the LOOK UP project presented with a video screen immersion having multiple voices continue to carry the message. The exhibition will also include artworks on display by a select curated group on contemporary artist participates.
🌍 Why Venice. Why Now.
LOOK UP has been invited by the European Cultural Centre – Italy to participate in the 8th edition of Personal Structures, presented alongside the 2026 Venice Biennale.

The Venice Biennale 2026 is one of the world’s most influential contemporary art events, taking place in Venice, Italy, as part of the legendary La Biennale di Venezia, founded in 1895. Held every two years, the Art Biennale brings together a major international curated exhibition and national pavilions where countries present bold new artistic visions. In 2026, Venice once again becomes a global meeting point for artists, curators, and audiences shaping the future of contemporary art.
Participation in Personal Structures is by invitation and sponsorship, a standard model within the Venice Biennale ecosystem.
The exhibition will take place from May 9 to November 22, 2026, across:
Palazzo Mora
Palazzo Bembo
Marinaressa Gardens

With over 500,000 international visitors expected, the exhibition unfolds around the theme Confluences—the meeting and interweaving of people, stories, cultures, and disciplines. It explores how diverse cultures and individual narrative merge addressing sustainability, society and the collective fabric of human experience. A collborative ways to thinking about the present and future.
LOOK UP has been invited into this dialogue as a public-facing, cross-disciplinary platform that bridges contemporary digital culture and shared human experience.
⏳ Why Timing Matters
LOOK UP is currently on the clock.
To be fully included in the official Personal Structures exhibition and its printed catalogue, sponsorship funding must be secured by the catalogue submission deadline in the end of February.

Meeting this deadline ensures: Official catalogue inclusion, Full curatorial integration within the exhibition. Long-term archival visibility beyond the Venice Biennale. This campaign is designed to help meet that critical timeline and bring LOOK UP to Venice at its full potential.
🎨 What We Are Creating in Venice

LOOK UP Venice will be a site-responsive installation with the videos from Times Square LOOK UP traveling and including more voices, along side site specific artworks from creatives within the LOOK UP community.
Translates public digital culture into historic Venetian contexts and support local communities for their voice in the traveling archive of authentic voices.
Brings together creative industry members, artists and thinkers across disciplines
Invites moments of pause, reflection, and shared humanity
This is not a temporary pop-up. It is a long-form cultural presence.
🤝 Why Sponsorship Matters
While LOOK UP has been formally invited by the European Cultural Centre, securing sponsorship and production funding is essential to realize the project in Venice.
Support raised through this campaign directly enables:
Exhibition production and installation
Official participation and catalogue inclusion
Fair compensation for artists and collaborators
Public programming and archival documentation

Funds raised will cover our required sponsorship payment to ECC for exhibition, support artwork production and installation, professional shipping and logistics, digital storytelling and documentation, marketing and outreach, and Kickstarter platform fees ensuring the project is responsibly produced and shared with a global audience. This Kickstarter allows LOOK UP to move forward independently, transparently, and on schedule. ECC funds continue to support continued restoration of each Palazzo and garden following the exhibition in Venice: Palazzo Mora  |  Palazzo Bembo  | Marinaressa Gardens
🛍️ The LOOK UP Kickstarter Rewards

The LOOK UP Kickstarter Rewards are an extension of the movement. Every reward is designed not as merchandise, but as a participatory artifact- a way to carry the question forward and help expand LOOK UP to new cities. Contemporary artists' contribute original artworks, limited special editions, special access events online and IRL, VIP tickets to exclusive invitations including press conference /pre-opening ceremony, Vernissage VIP opening, closing parties, speaker panels, curatorial private tours and more.
🌐 From Times Square to the World

Times Square was the beginning not the destination. This Kickstarter helps bring LOOK UP to the Venice Biennale 2026 one of the largest public displays of artwork and events in the world. Beyond building a living archive of global creative voices and proving that public space can still inspire, connect, and uplift. The digital open air gallery presents authentic voices meant to inspire audiences within their daily lives. During this art and video exhibition, LOOK UP will have a billboard in Times Square to create a unified bridge for the project for everyone who is unable to travel to Venice can also see the exhibition on our open-air gallery in Times Square.
💛 Why Your Support Matters
LOOK UP exists in public space and public space requires care, intention, and support.
Backing this project helps ensure:
LOOK UP remains non-commercial and accessible
Artists/Creative Industry Member are elevated with respect and compensated
Technology deepens connection rather than distraction bring our worlds to have humanity LOOK UP.
Cities become places of shared meaning again and IRL experiences

This is not advertising.
This is a shared question seen by millions to help millions.
🌟 Join the Movement
LOOK UP is not something you simply watch.

project.name: Moving Gibbons Glass Studio
project.description: Help us move Gibbons Glass Studio to a new, better location! Your support will fund moving costs & essential safety infrastructure.

creator.name: John Gibbons
creator.biography: John Gibbons grew up making art in Northern California, encouraged by his father who is a painter and glass collector. He officially began his study of glass in 2003 at Shasta College and went on to earn a BFA in glass from California State University, Chico. After graduating, John moved to Cambria on California's beautiful central coast to work at Harmony Glass Works. In 2011, he moved to San Diego, CA to work as a resident artist at Cirello Gallery in North Park. In 2014, he opened his hot glass shop in San Diego, CA. He moved his hot shop to Northern California two years later. John continues to create his beautiful glass sculptures in Eureka, California.

texte: Help Bring The Art of Glass to Old Town Eureka!
About

Hello! I'm John Gibbons, and for as long as I can remember, I've been fascinated by the beauty of molten glass. That spark ignited when I was just a boy in Redding, California. My dad took me to antique bottle shows and pointed out bottles with rough, hand-finished bottoms. My 5-year-old imagination was hooked—I was compelled to learn how to work with glass and make it myself.

That fascination became a lifelong pursuit. I started blowing glass at Shasta College in 2003 and earned my BFA in Glass from Chico State in 2009. 2013 was a huge year: I turned 30, built my first studio, got married, and welcomed our first child! Now, living in Eureka and blowing glass full-time, my family has grown to include two daughters and twin boys.
Why

For years, I've been creating in a secluded space, relying on only a few visitors a week. Now, I have an incredible opportunity to move my studio into the vibrant arts district of Old Town Eureka. This isn't just a move for me—it's a chance to build a vibrant community anchor that will bring inspiration, artistry, and hands-on education right into the heart of downtown.
This Kickstarter will directly support the creation of a retail-focused glass studio that will:
* Increase Visibility and Sales: Moving into a prime retail/tourist location means moving from a few customers a week to several customers a day, significantly supporting the growth of my business.
* Inspire the Community: The new space will feature a showroom gallery showcasing glass art and a working studio that provides a public window into the incredible process of glassblowing.
* Education: I will be able to offer glassblowing lessons and demonstrations, allowing locals and tourists alike to experience this beautiful craft firsthand.
What

Moving a glassblowing studio is a massive undertaking. It involves large, heavy, and extremely fragile equipment—furnaces, glory holes, annealers, and pipes—all of which require careful handling and precise installation.
Your support will fund the critical initial phases of this project.
How
| Phase 1: Foundation & Infrastructure |

Demolishing interior walls and laying out all the new electrical infrastructure required for the specialized equipment. Glass blowing operates at high temperatures and require significant power and safety infrastructure.
| Phase 2: The Big Move |
Hiring professionals to carefully transport and install the large, heavy, and fragile glassblowing equipment. The move must be done with extreme care to prevent damage to expensive machinery.
| Phase 3: The Showroom |
The final build-out of the public facing gallery and retail area. This space connects the art to the customer and allows for community engagement.

I've spent a lifetime mastering this craft, and now I'm ready to take the next crucial step of making glass art accessible to everyone in Eureka. By backing this campaign, you aren't just supporting an artist, you're investing in the vibrancy and creativity of the Old Town Eureka arts community.
Join the Journey!

In each eyespot there is a clear glass lens that magnifies the pattern of this perfectly symmetrical vase.

project.name: Hospice: Tunnel of Love - A Haunted Horror Comic
project.description: Take a ride (if you dare) on this 24-paged comic book for fans of The Twilight Zone and The Outer Limits!

creator.name: Jonathan Hedrick
creator.biography: I'm an American comic book writer living in Italy! Some of my titles include The Recount, Dream Master, Caffeinated Hearts, and Brackish. I'm happily married to my wife, Francesca Fantini. Check out our first comic book together, Can I Scream?, from Keenspot!

texte: *This campaign is to raise funding to produce a 24-page part color/part black & white comic book. It will be printed with an 80 lb. cardstock cover with 60 lb. interior pages.

Hospice is an ambitious shared universe horror project that started in 2023 for the first season's trade, created by a powerhouse team of creators: Travis Gibb, Frank Martin, Jamie Primack, Russell Nohelty, David Byrne, and Michael Watson. Together, they delivered a chilling, interconnected world that pushes the boundaries of horror storytelling, blending their unique voices into a haunting experience unlike anything you've seen before. Each story is standalone and has the unique style and flair of their respective creators.
Welcome to Season 2 of Hospice! A shared universe comic. This is 1 of 6 books that you can get by some of the top creators in indie comics!

Synopsis: Young Dick and Margaret are on their first date at the local Harvest County Fair in 1955. After finally mustering up the courage, Dick asks Margaret to go on the "Tunnel of Love" ride with him. She happily agrees, but quickly wishes she hadn't. What horrors lie on the other side of this dark and evil attraction?!

After everything goes dark on the terrifying ride, Dick wakes up 70 years older with no recollection of the prior decades of his life. He's surrounded by people claiming to be his family and is trapped inside an assisted living facility called "Rising Suns Hospice."
*Some adjustments might be made prior to finalizing digital and print files.
Add on a digital copy of Sean Wood's 20-page story, "The Scaled Key #1" to any pledge! But this is not required reading to understand "Tunnel of Love."

Jonathan Hedrick is a multi-published independent comic book writer originally from Florida and currently based out of Italy. His creator-owned titles include The Recount (Scout Comics), Space Cadet (Scoot!), Hyper/Aware (Source Point Press), Caffeinated Hearts (Source Point Press), and Freakshow Knight (Second Sight Publishing), just to name a few. He has also contributed to several anthologies including Lower Your Sights (Mad Cave Studios), which raised support for children impacted by the war in Ukraine. He currently writes Dream Master for BlackBox Comics. His latest titles, Can I Scream?, Spillblood, (Keenspot) and Quicksand (Scout Comics), can be found at your local comic shop. He's happily married to fellow comic book creator and artist, Francesca Fantini.
Click here for Jonathan's LinkTree.

Gabriel is an illustrator, teacher and father from Santiago, Chile. Over the years he has worked on a variety of comics, text books, and indie publications. He started in comics in 2017 with indie publications, he has been a part of many teams and worked on titles like The Recount (Scout Comics), Juan Valiente, Sacred Six (Dynamite), Caos en Haití, and others. He was part of the team who worked on the adaptation of Call of Duty as a board game (Arcane Wonders). He lives in Santiago, drawing a lot, teaching and drinking coffee.
Click here to follow Gabriel on Instagram.

Leo McGovern lives in New Orleans, LA with Michelle and their three dogs, Ripley, Toff and Pen. His favorite comics include Lazarus, Concrete, and anything by Brubaker & Phillips. From retailing at Crescent City Comics to appearing in the graphic novel A.D.: New Orleans After the Deluge, comics are life for Leo, and taking part in creating comics is living a dream. Since 2023, Leo’s lettering credits include the one-shots Can I Scream? and Spillblood, the mini-series Deadly Trails and Rysk, and many short stories.
Click here for Leo's Instagram page.  Click here for his website.

Sean Wood - Sean lives with his wife and two kids in the Hampton Roads area of Virginia. He has been a lifelong comic reader and collector. Now after attending Scott Snyder and Brian Michael Bendis's classes on writing, he has tackled his first comic series in hopes of doing more. Click here to visit Sean's Hospice campaign page.

Neil Moherman has been writing comics since 2018. When Neil is not writing comics, he is a Quality Assurance director, reptile photographer, washed up beard celebrity, husband, father, napper, dungeon master, gardener, and bird watcher. Click here to visit Neil's Hospice campaign page.

John Ward is a Vancouver-based writer, filmmaker, and podcaster. His recent comic book credits include Scratcher, Acausal, and Offbeats, and his short fiction has been published by Black Hare Press and Printed Words. He’s a contributing writer for Sequential magazine, and also the creator of the 49 Degrees North Writers Podcast. Previously, he was a theoretical physicist and guitarist in numerous punk/thrash bands. Click here to visit John's Hospice campaign page.
Austin Allen Hamblin has written a bunch of comics! For: Band of Bards, Image, Cosmic Lion Productions, Orange Cone Productions, and Candle Light Press.

Adam Barnhardt writes all the time. By day, he's a marketer and by night, he's playing with the superheroes of the RiotVerse. He's written stories such as SH*TSHOW, Keepers of the Cosmos, and Nock and has short stories in Orange Cone Productions' widely-acclaimed Holiday Spirits Vol. 2 and Cthulhu Invades Fairy Tales 2. Click here to visit Adam's Hospice campaign page.
Throughout the campaign: We intend to continue working on the remaining pages in order to fulfill your pledges as soon as possible.
First week after campaign ends: Kickstarter will notify and remind any backers with payment processing errors to fix their payment before their pledges are dropped.
One week after campaign ends: Kickstarter will drop any pending errored pledges and those backers will not receive their rewards.
Two weeks after campaign ends: Kickstarter will release funds.
May 2026: This is our goal to wrap up interior pages to send files to the printer and prepare a digital reader.
June 2026: Digital rewards sent.
July 2026: Physical rewards sent.

Digital rewards will be sent via email, either to your Kickstarter account or an email address that you must provide in the post-campaign survey. You will receive a Dropbox link to access your rewards. We encourage you to save these files to your own Dropbox account (it's free to set up), another cloud storage service, and/or, download to your preferred device. We cannot guarantee how long these links will work after fulfillment.

Physical rewards* will be fulfilled by the printer (approx. July 2026), Comix Wellspring, which will help to expedite the fulfillment process. Why ship the book twice, right?! Your comic books will be bagged and boarded by the staff at Comix Wellspring and shipped in a rigged cardboard container, similar to a Gemini mailer.
*Hospice Season One softcovers and hardcovers (see add-on rewards) will be shipped separately as they are already printed. This is why there is an additional charge for shipping these items.

We know the price for shipping could create a challenge for you to financially support our campaign. To help relieve any burden, we pledge to you that if the cost of shipping turns out to be less than what you were charged, then we will refund you the difference. We will provide proof of the shipping cost upon request. If it happens to be more than what you paid, we will cover it ourselves. Thank you for understanding!

If you've read this far, I want to personally thank you for taking the time to review this project page. I appreciate your time and hope you can help support our campaign. Please let me know if you have any questions.

In the end, he will have to make the most difficult decision of his life in order to save everyone else. But will his sacrifice be enough to rescue the entire world?" For mature readers.
