project.name: The Firelight Isle: Complete Trilogy
project.description: The sweeping cultural fantasy concludes as Sen & Anlil's secretive nocturnal civilisation begins to unravel around them.

creator.name: Paul Duffield
creator.biography:
I’m a comic creator, illustrator, animator and designer currently working out of Northamptonshire UK.

Art and story are my passions, and the places they meet are the places I love most: comics, animation, video games, board games and all other forms of visual storytelling.

I’m currently working on a project that’s very close to my heart: my webcomic, The Firelight Isle.

My previous projects include Freakangels (soon to be an animated series from Crunchyroll Originals) and The Tempest.

I’ve worked with a huge range of companies including Marvel, Dark Horse, NASA and the BBC, and my work has received two Eagle Awards for Freakangels, first place in Tokyopop’s first Rising Stars of Manga UK, and the International Manga and Anime Festival grand prize.

texte: The Firelight Isle is a tale of cultural discovery and coming-of-age in a nocturnal civilisation watched over by mysterious masked priests, set on a solitary island surrounded by a dark and endless sea...

This Kickstarter is to raise the printing costs to collect the third and final volume of this story in a lavish 128-page hardback book, and to reprint Volume 1 with an upgraded stitched spine. Volume 2 will also be available again!

Sen and Anlil are childhood friends about to be parted as Sen starts down the path of priesthood, and Anlil creates a sacred offering that could save her household's reputation. As the unseen consequences of their choices unfold, Sen is drawn deeper, towards the intrigues at the heart of the priests' palace, whilst Anlil is pushed outwards, towards the boundaries of society.
Both risk their souls, and perhaps even their lives, as they uncover the secrets beyond the dark shores of the island that feels like their whole world.

The first two volumes of The Firelight Isle are available to read on my site, on Tapas and on Webtoon Canvas. The 3rd volume is exclusive to my Patreon and this Kickstarter. Volume 1 contains episodes 1-18, and was printed thanks to a Kickstarter in 2018. Volume 2 contained episodes 19-47, and was printed thanks to a second Kickstarter in 2020. Volume 3 will conclude the story, and contain episodes 48-59, all of which are completed and ready to print.
Reader feedback for the series has been wonderful, and The Firelight Isle: Volume 1 has a 4.34/5 rating on Goodreads, and Volume 2 has a 4.61/5 rating.
In order to preserve the original web format, I printed Volumes 1 and 2 in portrait, with the spine on the short edge of the book, reading from top-to-bottom.
For Volume 3, I'll continue this trend so that all three books are a matching set.

The reprint of Volume 1 will also feature the same stitched spine as Volume 2, instead of the original glued one, allowing the pages to open further, and providing for a more natural reading experience.
All three books will include the bookmark ribbon, Spot UV and the foil which were all unlocked as stretch goals for Volume 1, and are available as standard in this campaign.

This campaign will include the option to purchase a special edition slipcase to store all three volumes in, so that they can look good on a shelf in the same orientation as other books. (A frequent request from readers with short shelves!) It is available as an add-on to any reward tier, as well as being included in the top reward tier.
If you'd like signatures from me and Kate, along with an original pencil sketch by me in each of the books in your reward, you can pick this add-on!
This hard enamel pin features a design based on the cover for Volume 2, made with glittery enamel to simulate the starry sky. It is available as an add-on to any reward tier.
This hard enamel pin features the symbol of The Somin, made in the exact colour of the closely guarded Heavenly Blue ink that features in the story. It is available as an add-on to any reward tier.

I'm Paul Duffield, the creator of The Firelight Isle. I've had a long career writing, drawing, editing, designing and talking about comics, and I'm currently working as an Art Director and in-house writer for the brilliant weekly children's comic, The Phoenix. For The Firelight Isle, I'm joined by my long-time collaborator, and life-partner...

Kate has contributed a massive amount to the project. Since the beginning of Volume 2, we've been working extremely closely, and sharing the load on every stage of the art, from the thumbnails to the finished page. This book in many ways is hers, as she did the majority of the heavy lifting on art and layouts, and a part of the proceeds from the campaign will go straight to her.

She just does this part time, though! Her own stories, including the phenomenal Faith Says You and Fish + Chocolate, are profound, inspiring and disturbing by turns, and are full of the kind of creativity that makes me excited about comics.

This time round, the books and slipcases will be printed by QinPrinting, who have an excellent reputation for quality and customer service. Full quotes have been obtained, and the initial goal and cost of products has been carefully considered to scale well.

You'll be charged for postage and packaging once the books are ready to ship, through Kickstarter's pledge manager, which will calculate the costs of import duty for your country and add that to the cost of shipping so you don't get any surprise fees when your reward arrives!
The cost of shipping to destinations outside the UK may be high, but I'll be working with a shipping company to attempt to reduce these fees as much as possible before you're charged.

I've now run or been involved in 5 crowdfunding campaigns, so know the process intimately. The backers themselves can attest how well the previous campaigns have gone, and it's been wonderful to see books with readers across the world...
This project has been written, drawn, produced and presented without any use of generative AI.

When we create, we don't just make products to be consumed, we engage with the world, we learn, and we grow. When we read a story, we indirectly experience the journey that the author has been through, like a ghost in the art.
Making this project has changed me profoundly, and all its flaws and qualities come entirely from that process.

project.name: I FEEL DOOMED! Volume 1
project.description: An anthology of illustrated stories exploring how we break, rebuild, and keep going.

creator.name: Joe Karg
creator.biography: Joseph Karg is an Atlanta based artist who has worked on FX's "Archer" and Marvel Snap! He's also an Associate Professor of Illustration at Kennesaw State University.

texte: Remember hope? Yeah… same. It’s time to face reality—with a little dark humor.

Enter I FEEL DOOMED, a new comics anthology that turns generational dread into creative release. Tackling everything from student loans and housing stress to climate anxiety and political exhaustion, the book captures what it feels like to live in a constant state of low-grade apocalypse—through the voices of artists who’ve traded doomscrolling for drawing.

The project is curated by Joseph Karg (Archer, Marvel Snap!, Dear Bernadette) and published through his imprint Soup Drunk Princess, bringing together students and seasoned professionals in a shared creative space. The result is something that feels equal parts anthology, emotional outlet, and late-night group chat about the end of the world—where art becomes a way to keep going when everything feels like it’s falling apart.

Across more than thirty stories, I Feel Doomed dives straight into the collective unease of a generation shaped by chaos. Themes range from creeping authoritarianism and climate fear to isolation, burnout, and the exhausting act of pretending everything’s fine. Each piece reshapes that anxiety into something strange, funny, unsettling, and deeply relatable—a snapshot of a generation coping with collapse through nervous laughter and too much caffeine.

The anthology features an impressive lineup of creators, including Miki Montlló (Wonder Woman/Harley Quinn), Thierry Martin (Le Roman de Renart), Claudio Acciari (The Prince of Egypt, The Road to El Dorado), Jonathan Edwards (Mufasa, Warner Bros.), Rustam Hasanov (Game of Thrones, House of the Dragon), Chris Bivins (Marvel Snap!, Stargirl), Danielle Corsetto (Girls With Slingshots), Dustin Harbin (Koyama Press, Dinos That Drive), June Brigman (Power Pack), Adam Ford (Rick and Morty, Star Trek: Lower Decks), Jake Reeves (Titmouse, Royal Crackers), and Claire Seckler, an emerging CalArts storyteller.

“We all process our feelings in profoundly different ways. Some of us laugh in the face of despair, others draw, write, build, or hide. But no one escapes the need to make sense of a world that feels like it’s slipping apart. This project is a collection of short stories and images that don’t deny that feeling; they hold it up to the light. I hope that, as readers move through these vignettes of doom, they’ll recognize parts of themselves in the hopeful, absurd, or darkly funny moments that surface between the cracks. Doom itself is universal, but how we all respond to it is deeply personal—

A little less than a century ago, 70 million people died across Europe, Russia, and Asia. Faced with unimaginable grief, humanity turned to the only tool that could hold that weight: Art. We painted, wrote novels and poems, drew comics, made movies, and even animated cartoons about silly rabbits fighting the same wars we were. Art is how we process the unprocessable. It helps us turn chaos into story, pain into meaning. I Feel Doomed is part of that same impulse—to face what’s breaking in the world and, through creativity, remind ourselves that beauty and resilience still exist.”

If Black Mirror started a group chat with Love, Death + Robots—and invited a therapist who’d completely given up—it might look a lot like I Feel Doomed. Perfect for fans of The Silver Coin, Flight, or any anthology that feels like peeking into the shared subconscious of 2025, this is a book that admits what we’re all thinking: we’re just trying to survive a slow-motion apocalypse.
I FEEL DOOMED INSTAGRAM - features a ton of behind the scenes content including process videos, interviews, developmental images, sneak previes and more!

What makes I Feel Doomed different from most anthologies is that it refuses to treat comics as the only valid language. While the book is filled with powerful sequential stories, it also makes space for work that lives somewhere adjacent to comics—illustration galleries, visual essays, and pages that sit between image and thought.

Artists like Akira Beard (featured above) Martin Campos, Rustam Hasanov (featured below), Bill Cleveland, Benji Williams, and Dustin Harbin contribute galleries of images paired with written reflections on doom itself. These pieces don’t tell stories in a traditional panel-to-panel sense. Instead, they invite you to linger. To read an image, then read a thought, then sit in the space between the two. The result feels less like consuming a narrative and more like overhearing someone articulate a fear you didn’t yet have words for.

By including this kind of work alongside more conventional comics, I Feel Doomed becomes something closer to a conversation than a collection. It acknowledges that doom isn’t always experienced as a story with a beginning, middle, and end—sometimes it’s a mood, a realization, or a question that arrives fully formed and refuses to leave. This book makes room for all of that.

That same philosophy extends beyond the page. Animators from Lucky Draw Productions have contributed ten pages of concept and production art from Doomscrolling, the animated short film created to open the I Feel Doomed Kickstarter video. These pages pull back the curtain on the animation process itself—storyboards, visual development, and moments of experimentation—offering another way into the project’s central themes.
There are only three original art pages available at the $500 tier.
Before pledging, please email me directly so you can let me know which page you’d like. I’ll confirm availability and guarantee your choice before you complete your pledge. josephkarg@gmail.com
Once confirmed, you’re free to submit your pledge knowing that the page you want is secured.
Here's a better look at the Double Splash page. Since this is 1 of 1, there is no need to contact me if you want it.
The cover of I Feel Doomed is a one-of-a-kind mixed media painting, created through a rare collaborative process.

The piece began as a traditional painting by Joseph Karg, then moved into the digital realm where it was embellished and refined by Rustam Hasanov. From there, the image returned to the physical world and was fully repainted by Karg on 18 × 24 Hot Press Arches paper using acrylic and pastels.

This final artwork is not a print, reproduction, or study—it is the finished, physical cover painting that defines the visual identity of the book. The layered process mirrors the spirit of I Feel Doomed itself: traditional craft, contemporary tools, and multiple artistic voices working in conversation.
Signed, unique, and irreplaceable.
Shipping will be collected after the campaign, when surveys go out in June. We’ll be using BackerKit to handle addresses, sizing, add-ons, and shipping costs.

This means you will not be charged shipping during the Kickstarter campaign. Instead, shipping will be calculated later based on your location and the items you selected, helping us keep those costs as fair and accurate as possible.

Please expect shipping to be a separate charge from your February pledge. Using BackerKit allows us to avoid guessing on shipping costs now and helps ensure your rewards arrive safely and efficiently.
US Estimates are $13-20 depending on your zone and bundle

International can be wildly different. I recommend looking up your rate for a 6lbs package for your country from the US. Most countries at the time I'm writing this are around $80 while Australia is $130.

project.name: Ben Dunn's NINJA HIGH SCHOOL Colorized part 2
project.description: Help support to colorize the complete NINJA HIGH SCHOOL series.

creator.name: AlphaNerd
creator.biography: Welcome to AlphaNerd, the apparel branch of Antarctic Press!  You may know us from our great comics like Gold Digger, Ninja High School and Twilight X, but we also produce some great T-shirts! Please check out our line of shirts and help us get them out to you.  With our line of creative, entertaining, genre-based designs, you too can be an Alpha Nerd!

texte: NINJA HIGH SCHOOL is a manga series created by BEN DUNN in 1987. It is a story about an ordinary high school student, JEREMY FEEPLE, in a small town whose life is turned upside down when a kunoichi (female ninja) named ITCHY KOO and an alien Princess name ASRIAL suddenly entered his life!
Help us colorize the original Black and White NINJA HIGH SCHOOL series by creator BEN DUNN.

If you're not familiar with us, my name is Ben Dunn, and I created Antarctic Press, a small, independent comic company started in 1985. I have personally collected comics of almost every type and genre since 1974, and I can say that during the past 40 years, we have published some of the greatest and best independent comics out there. Our publishing history includes titles like Ninja High School and Gold Digger. The comic industry has changed over the years, so we have started this Kickstarter program to help introduce new projects from our talented group of creators. You may have  seen some of our other successful and fulfilled campaigns.

Over the years, we have published a number of series. Prominent among these is my long running series NINJA HIGH SCHOOL which recently celebrated its 200th issue. NINJA HIGH SCHOOL is a manga comedy set in the fictional small town of Quagmire where it is occupied by ninjas, aliens, monsters, mad scientists, furries, cyborgs, superheroes and all manner of weirdness as part of everyday life.

One of our most frequently received fan requests over the years is, "When can I see the original black-and-white series of NINJA HIGH SCHOOL in color?" Getting a book colored is not an easy proposition due to the cost and time involved, and both of those commodities are scarce in the independent publishing world. But with Kickstarter, it is now possible to achieve that goal.
Thanks to you I was able to color issue no.1 and no.2! Now I hope to continue coloring the rest of the series starting with issue 3.
Here is a small sample of what was done. Below are original and colored pages from NINJA HIGH SCHOOL #3.

The money collected in this campaign will go to paying the colorists to perform the task of coloring. And for each $1000 we collect beyond the initial $1000, we will color the next issue. For instance, if we hit our goal, we will color Ninja High School #1.  If we collect a total of $2000 with this campaign, we will then proceed to the next issue which is Ninja High School #2, and so forth and so on.  Supporters will receive the PDFs of each completed issue that is colored, and those in the upper pledge tiers will also get the issues that have already been colorized.
How I budget the money...  $1000 Goal
$100 Kickstarter Fees (Kickstarter takes 10% for various fees)
$250 Administration and Royalties...to manage and send the PDF's to all the supporters
$650 To pay our esteemed colorists and others who have helped (we may re-letter some of the books)
IF WE HIT THESE GOALS...ALL SUPPORTERS WILL RECEIVE THE PDF's OF EACH GOAL.

project.name: Zealot
project.description: Zealot is the debut manga series from BluRaven, a newly formed manga publishing company focused on bold storytelling.

creator.name: Jv Hooks
creator.biography: Consulting and Management firm working for its clients, managing their companies.

texte: ZEALOT — A New Manga Series from BluRaven
A dark, original manga series exploring power, belief, and survival in a fractured world.
The Story Begins
The world you know is gone.
What remains is ruled by belief, violence, and those willing to become something more—or something monstrous—to survive.

Zealot is the debut manga series from BluRaven, a newly formed manga publishing company focused on bold storytelling, rich worldbuilding, and legacy-quality art. This campaign funds Volume 1, the foundation of an original universe we intend to build for years to come.
This is not a side project.
This is the beginning.
What Is Zealot?
Zealot is a dark, character-driven manga set in an unpredictable new world shaped by ideology, fractured power systems, and moral ambiguity.
It blends:
Psychological tension
High-stakes action
Political and spiritual undertones
A gritty, grounded art style inspired by classic and modern manga
At its core, Zealot asks one question:
What happens when belief becomes a weapon?
Why This Series Matters
Most stories tell you who to root for.
Zealot challenges you to decide for yourself.
There are no clean heroes.
No guaranteed victories.
Only choices—and consequences.
If you enjoy manga that respects your intelligence, rewards close reading, and isn’t afraid to go dark, Zealot was made for you.
About BluRaven
BluRaven is a new manga publishing company built with a long-term vision:
to create original series with depth, consistency, and artistic integrity.
We are not chasing trends.
We are building worlds.
Zealot is our first release—and the standard for everything that follows.
Backing this project means backing a publisher at the ground floor.
What Your Support Funds
Your backing directly supports the creation and delivery of Zealot – Volume 1, including:
Manga illustration & page production
Story development & editing
Printing and physical production
Packaging and fulfillment
Distribution
Kickstarter and platform fees
Every dollar moves this project from concept to a finished, tangible book in your hands.
Timeline
Campaign Ends: Feb 17th, 2026
Production Begins: Currently Running
Printing & Distribution: March 17th, 2026
Estimated Delivery: March 17th, 2026
We believe in transparency and will provide regular updates throughout production.
Risks & Challenges
Publishing is complex—but manageable.
We have accounted for:
Production timelines
Printing lead times
Shipping delays
This campaign is scoped specifically for Volume 1, ensuring focus, quality, and delivery without overextension.
Why Back This Project?
Because stories like this don’t exist without people willing to support them early.
Because you want to say:
“I was there from the beginning.”
Because Zealot isn’t just another manga—it’s the foundation of something bigger.
Final Word
This is our soft launch.
Our first step.
Our opening chapter.
If Zealot speaks to you, back the project, share it, and help us bring this world to life.
Welcome to BluRaven.
Welcome to Zealot.

project.name: MOTUS
project.description: MOTUS is a self-published Manga Series. Now it's time to be printed! Help me create the Physical Volume of MOTUS!

creator.name: Key Lager
creator.biography: Mangaka of MOTUS

texte: Hello! My name is Key Lager. I aspire to become a successful self-publishing mangaka.
The purpose of this fundraiser is to collect funds to create prints of MOTUS's first volume. You may ask, "What is MOTUS?"

MOTUS is a dream of mine. Ever since I was 16, I have fantasized about characters, human emotions, and the "what if" scenario: What if these emotions were characters we had to face daily? What would humanity's accumulated emotional state look like in the real world? I finished school, and years went by. Until now, I have worked to create this exciting psychological battle shonen manga based on this thrilling "what if" scenario. There are thrilling and intense action scenes, of course, but also touching human stories. They are not just characters that fulfill a trope. I want to depict humanity in all its beauty and horror.
MOTUS and humans live in the same world, but in different dimensions. Gwyn Heartstone, an adolescent high school student, is the only connector between the two realms. By entering a state of transcendence called "Soul Form," he can step into an undiscovered space and fight the mighty Motus that disturb the peace of humanity. The mystery of what these creatures are lingers in the human-inhabited world.

Prepare to experience the real horror of what MOTUS are capable of. You will feel thrilled and get goosebumps while watching Gwyn struggle to protect humanity from their own demons. This unorthodox narrative will make you second-guess your assumptions about this genre.
I can fulfill the technical aspects of this manga series in many ways, but I lack the financial support to make my dream a reality.
I will be transparent about where I intend to use the funds:
That would total an estimated 1,500€, including 40 regular books and 10 limited-edition deluxe books.
With your support, you will earn a spot in the final print of the manga, marking your presence in real time.
With your support, MOTUS can take its first real step into the world of Manga!

project.name: Angel Protected
project.description: A Magical Girl, Dark Fantasy Adventure Story

creator.name: Tara Hands
creator.biography: American Manga Creator

texte: When I first started writing Angel Protected, I was 16 years old. I really loved Sailor Moon and other Japanese manga like Berserk and Gunsmith Cats. But as much as I love Sailor Moon, there wasn’t much that I could relate too culturally. School wasn’t the same in America as it is in Japan, teen life in general is so much different too. And there weren’t any black girls as leads in any of the Japanese Manga a that time, or even today really. So, I set out to write my own Magical Girl story, one that would reflect the life of Americas. It would be centered around the lives of me and my bestest friends. But as I got older I started asking myself more in-depth questions about the world a Magical Girl lives in, then I had an epiphany! I would first write a Magical Girl Origin Story! So basically I asked myself, “what if Naoko Takeuchi told the story of Usagi before she and the sailor scouts where reborn on Earth?” And “what if the main character was a young black princess living in a dark fantasy world?” And thus became the story of Angel Protected.

In Angel Protected you will meet our Magical Girl, Princess Tiara Aira Earthian. The youngest daughter of the Guardian of the Earth, Queen Elaine. Tiara lives in the world of Agartha that is located at the center of the Earth. in our story Princess Tiara is unexpectedly chosen to be the next Guardian of the world and now has to take the place of her Mother. But the path to Guardianship isn’t like when her mother first started, now there is a dark force threatening to cast the world into darkness and end the cycle of Earths Guardians. Tiara must travel across Agartha to the seven temples to unlock her Guardian abilities and power the Rainbow Barrier, a powerful shield that protects Earth. With it, it will banish the dark demons from the Earth.

Angel Protected is a unique hero’s journey, magical girl origin story, and a dark fantasy rolled up in one, and presented to you with a magical bow. With little representation of black female lead characters in Comic Books and Manga, Angel Protected brings a fresh perspective on black culture and entertainment coming into the anime/ manga industry.
Digital Soul
Reward:
Digital PDF of Angel Protected Book one.

Get the digital soul reward to get Angel Protected from anywhere in the world. Get the full 174-page digital version of Book 1 with full color cover art, optimized for screen reading and ideal for digital readers, international fans, or anyone on a budget.

Your copy of Book One will be signed by the creator, T.M. Hands and shipped with an exclusive 3 5x7 mini art print featuring Tiara: The Guardian of the Earth, her Protector Elgor, and the main villain Desolate with a pearl finish. Ideal for Collectors and fans who want something special.

In this bundle you will receive a signed special collector’s edition hardcover copy with full color cover pages, shipped with 3 exclusive 5x7 mini art print featuring Tiara: The Guardian of the Earth, her Protector Elgor, and the main villain Desolate with a pearl finish. Ideal for Collectors and fans who want something to remember and hold on too.

Get the full Angel Protected experience with both Book one and Book two in print and digital formats. Over 328 pages of magical girl goodness. Ideal for Readers ready to dive deep into Tiara’s journey.
Soulmates Edition Deluxe bundle
Reward: black and white soft cover Book one 174 pages 5.5x8.5 + Book two 154 pages 5.5x8.5 print copies & fully colored cover art Digital copies

Get the full Angel Protected experience with both Book one and Book two in print and digital formats. Over 328 pages of magical girl goodness. Signed by the creator T.M. Hands, + 3 5x7 character prints with a pearl finish. Ideal for Readers ready to dive deep into Tiara’s journey.
Twin Flame bundle
Reward:
Hardcover Physical copy of Book one Book two 328 pages B&W interior with full colored cover art + both Digital PDF

In this bundle you will receive the special collector’s edition hardcover copy with full color cover pages+ the digital copies. Ideal for Collectors and fans who want something to remember and hold on too and take the adventure anywhere On mobile devices.
Forged Hearts bundle
Reward:
Hardcover Physical copy of Book one Book two 328 pages B&W interior with full colored cover art + both Digital PDF

In this bundle you will receive the special collector’s edition hardcover copy with full color cover pages+ the digital copies, Signed by the creator T.M. Hands, + 3 5x7 character prints with a pearl finish. Ideal for Collectors and fans who want something to remember and hold on too and take the adventure anywhere On mobile devices.
Bound By God bundle
Reward:
Hardcover edition of book one and two + Name in the Thank-You pages of the book + The Agartha Codex (Art Book, Physical)

Become part of the Angel Protected legacy by getting Your Name printed in the thank-you section of Book 1 and Book 2. You’ll also receive The Agartha Codex an exclusive art book featuring original character illustrations, creator commentary, and early design explorations. + 3 character 5x7 prints with pearl finish.
Ideal for any mega fans, collectors, and anyone who wants to be immortalized in the printed version of Angel Protected.

While Angel Protected was completely created by T.M. Hands alone. The writing, the art, and editing and publishing. There are a few honorable mentions of people that kept this project going over the span of over 25 years.

I am T.M. Hands, the creator of Angel Protected. I started this journey in 2001 when I was 16. It has been an up and down adventure of me struggling to realize how much I really just wanted to be a Manga creator. When I thought it would never be, and got too hard, I opted for being a veterinary assistant for 7 years and being an Amazon delivery driver for 5 years. In 2019 I made the crazy decision to finally finish and publish book one of Angel Protected, followed by working on and publishing book two. but even then I still doubted myself. I now have the right delusional that I can finally do this for reals!
I started creating Angel Protected long before become a mom, but I never gave up on my work. My kids are both adults now but played a huge role in the motivation of my completing my books.
My best friend in the world. My dog! He is in charge of keeping me grounded and forcing me to leave the house every day.
My mom also needs a huge mention. she has funded me, fed me, housed me, and encouraged me all throughout this journey.

To ensure fairness and flexibility, shipping costs for rewards can change after the campaign ends. This approach allows us to calculate the most accurate rates based on your location, current carrier prices, and any changes in tariffs or regulations at the time of fulfillment. Our goal is to provide you with the best possible shipping value while avoiding overcharging or unexpected shortfalls. We’ll communicate final shipping fees well in advance of fulfillment so you can plan accordingly.
US Backers: $8-$12, based on weight
Canadian Backers: $25-$50, based on weight
Other International Backers: $30-$70, based on weight
If your comic does arrive damaged in any way, contact me and I'll ship you a replacement as soon as possible.

I am not hiring campaign managers, paid promoters, or outreach services. Any messages offering paid promotion will not receive a response. thank you to all genuine backers for your support, it truly means the world to me.

project.name: Creator CODE "LIVE": Humans Share Their Creative Processes
project.description: New York Sequential Artists Stream and Personal V-log as They Work from a Residency in Brooklyn & Reignite Your Creative Spark

creator.name: Dare2Draw
creator.biography: Dare2Draw is a vibrant mentoring and networking community built on the belief that creators are stronger together. D2D WAS forged in the heart of New York's comic book legacy. Our story connects to the soul of Manhattan’s creative culture, inspired by the original 1980s scene around Backdate Magazine at the iconic Chelsea Hotel. From that foundation grew our "Seven Cards" philosophy and the progenitor Big City Drink and Draw. We exist to forge real connections and put the heart and craft back into sequential art through high-energy gatherings filled with challenges and collaboration. ✊ - Today, we connect artists through dynamic events and partnerships with iconic institutions like the revolutionary Art Students League, the historic Society of Illustrators, and the influential Art Directors Club. Our mission, under the direction of founder Charles "Sincero" Chenet, is to honor this creative legacy while building the future. ❤️‍ -Don’t just wait. Create. — The Dare2Draw Team

titre: One-month "ARt" dĭ-bô′chə-rē project  based in a studio in Gowanus, Brooklyn.
📺 Not our first rodeo folks! Please check out our Dare2Draw "Pilot"
texte: Creator CODE "LIVE" brings together seven of New York’s working sequential artists for a month of creativity live-streamed & V-Log from our studio in Gowanus, Brooklyn. Creator CODE "LIVE" has a mission to showcase these artists and to help their fans and all sequential artists by sharing unparalleled livestreaming access into their inspirations and techniques.

The entire journey will be documented for a mini-documentary honoring Will Eisner Week 2026 (March 1-7). Eisner Week celebrates the legacy of Brooklyn-born Will Eisner and promotes graphic novel literacy, free speech, and the sequential arts.

Intrepid Cartoonists at Work, Sharing Their Journeys
During the month of February, Creator CODE "LIVE" resident artists will create original sequential comic stories. Periodic livestreams and V-logs of the artist at their work, and frank, informative interviews will bring the ideas, talents and processes of these striving cartoonists to the world.
The artists’ brand new works will be published in a printed anthology & represented in our mini-documentary.

Creator CODE "LIVE" Inaugural Residents 
You can learn all about our seven artists through their bios and beautiful photos below. But if you're a comic fan you may already know them and their amazing work.
📺 Resident Artists 2026
Hilary Fitzgerald Campbell | Led Bradshaw | Joaquín Esteban J.
Emily Flake | Michael “EMT MIKE” Greear
Allison Conway | Alexandra “Alex” Bowman
CAUTION  & WARNING very 1980's Public-access television (SO, SHUT-UP!) with love, respect and gratitude to C.M. Griffin (Griffin Kwanjang).
"Honoring the Past, Embracing the Future"

At Dare2Draw, our DNA is woven from the rich tapestry of Manhattan’s comic history. Inspired by the pioneering days of Backdate Magazine and the creative legacy of the "7 Cards" forged at the Chelsea Hotel, we’ve been uniting cartoonists and comic enthusiasts for over a decade. Now, as the world reawakens to post-pandemic, apocalyptic and dystopian world, we’re excited to launch a new project that will:
Why the  [“Fifty-Eight Shades of Grey”]?

The pandemic changed how we create and connect. With social distancing and virtual interactions becoming the norm, live events have been sorely missed. Studies and community voices alike tell us that in-person gatherings foster not only creativity but also emotional well-being and professional growth. Our series is designed to provide that safe, vibrant space where art, conversation, and inspiration flourish once again.

Creator Code "Live" is a limited documentary pilot and a live-event residency launching a, live-streamed crowdfunding campaign for visual artists using the Eisner ETHOS. Based in a raw studio at 540 President Street in Gowanus, Brooklyn, we document the entire creative process to provide what the digital art world desperately needs: an unforgeable, unique fingerprint of human creation.

HAND TO GOD! Long-term Goal: To protect and fund human artistry by creating a transparent platform that provides an unforgeable unique fingerprint and provenance for every piece of art, establishing verifiable ownership and identity here with Dare2Draw at 540 President street! EASY COMPANY

Core Objectives:
Launch a live-stream crowdfunding "engine" studio incubator space with built-in provenance by broadcasting all featured creators live on a rotating schedule!
Produce a documentary series showcasing the value of authenticated human creativity.
Fund 4-9 artists-in-residence, providing them a safe place to work free with equipment and snacks.

The Documentary Series (The Human Proof)
The footage is the evidence. It captures the artist's identity, their subconscious techniques, decision-making, and the organic evolution of the work—elements impossible for AI to fabricate authentically.

The Live-Stream Platform (The Digital Fingerprint)
The Process as the Product: We don't just sell a finished image; we sell the verified journey of its creation.
Temporal Stamp: This narrative arc is the artwork's unique DNA.
Creator support & supplies: Direct support for the resident artists, covering materials and resources essential for their creative work. "Together We're Stronger"
About Hilary Fitzgerald Campbell -
CARTOONS BY HILARY

I am a cartoonist and illustrator. My cartoons have appeared in The New Yorker, The New York Times, Alta, Catapult, and more. My debut graphic memoir, Murder Book (Andrews McMeel 2021), was called “fun and freewheeling” by Publisher’s Weekly and was shortlisted for Best Nonfiction of the Year at Bouchercon. In 2023 my journal, What Did I Do Today?, was released, and I am currently working on my second graphic nonfiction, The Joy of Snacking. I have an Etsy shop and am available for custom-made orders and freelance illustration. Past clients include The White House Correspondents Dinner, Law & Order, Forensic Files, PlutoTV, NBC’s The Good Place, Basecamp, Elvie, JOKR, Dinnerly, RxR Realty, The Gates Foundation, La Prenda Wines, and more.
FILMS BY HILARY

I make documentary films. My first film, This Is Not The End, is a short documentary vignette about my family shot on B&W 16mm. It was awarded top prizes at No Budget Film Fest and SF IndieFest before becoming a Vimeo Staff Pick. My second film, Small Talk, premiered at the Slamdance Digital Bolex Fearless Filmmaking Showcase, where it was awarded the Grand Prize. It has gone on to play at Rooftop Films, Nantucket & Traverse City Film Festival, and many others. I am currently in post-production on my third film, Uncle Jim, for which I was awarded the Rooftop Films Short Filmmakers Grant to complete.

Emily Flake is a cartoonist, writer, performer, illustrator, and teacher living in Brooklyn, New York. Her work appears regularly in The New Yorker, McSweeney’s and many other publications. Her most recent book is Joke in a Box: How to Write and Draw Jokes. She was nominated for a WGA award for her work on Command-Z, a web series directed by Steven Soderbergh, in 2023. Her drawings appeared on Broadway in 2024 as backdrops for All In: Stories About Love, based on the work of Simon Rich, and through March 8th 2025 in its sequel, All Out: Stories About Ambition. She co-hosts a regular comedy show called FDK with fellow comedian Hollie Harper, and performs all over New York and beyond. She is the founder and proprietor of St. Nell’s, a residency program for women and non-binary creators working in any creative discipline, based in Williamsport, PA. She was a Yaddo fellow in 2025. She makes excellent pies and will do so if you even hint you might want one.

Alexandra Bowman is a Director of the Association of American Editorial Cartoonists as well as a nationally syndicated editorial cartoonist with Cagle Cartoons, America's largest syndicate for editorial cartoons. Politico has called her "one of the nation's top political cartoonists." Alex has had her work published by BBC News, The Week, Politico, Puffin Books, Penguin Random House UK, the National Wildlife Federation, and more. Alex has an M.A. in English as well as a B.A. in English and Art from Georgetown University. In addition to her illustration work, Alex is also a private educator in the humanities, theater critic, and an award-winning costumer. She lives in NYC.

Allison Conway grew up in the woods of Lake Geneva, WI and has always had a passion for animals and living organisms of all sizes. Her illustrations are inspired by swamps and delve into worlds hidden within worlds, like wildlife concealed in grass or microorganisms that are impossible to see. She graduated from the Savannah College of Art and Design with a BFA in Illustration in 2016. Her first graphic novel, The Lab, was published by Top Shelf Productions in March of 2020. Her second published work is The Island, published by Fieldmouse Press in September of 2023, and her third and latest published work is A Pillbug Story. A Pillbug Story features the character, Millie from her Vice comics and is published with Black Panel Press and was released in June of 2024. Allison Conway Illustration

Jetpulse Studios is a creative learning platform focused on art therapy for kids, creative writing for children, and parenting tips for autism. Our mission is to inspire acts of kindness and emotional growth through storytelling, art, and self-expression.

Led Bradshaw is an award-winning comic book artist and illustrator, renowned as the creator of "The Adventures of Jake Jetpulse" comic series. He is the founder of Jetpulse Studios, based in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn.

His work is distinguished by its deeply personal origin and mission. The "Jake Jetpulse" series is a collaborative project with his son, Jake, who is on the autism spectrum. The character and stories emerged from their shared drawing sessions, which began as a form of art therapy and later evolved into an educational tool to help Jake with his vocabulary and social skills.

Bradshaw's project has grown into a significant advocacy platform for autism awareness and acceptance. He positions his comics not only as entertainment but as a means to educate the public, foster a sense of community for parents, and champion the message that a diagnosis of autism does not limit a person's potential. The creative process remains a true partnership, with his son Jake contributing directly to character designs and storylines and providing final approval on all artwork.

A multidisciplinary visual artist and designer specializing in motion graphics, animation, and visual storytelling. Partnering with global brands, cultural institutions, and change-makers, I bring visions to life through innovative design and impactful narratives.
MIKE GREEAR BIO

Mike "ER" Greear is an RN/ER and cartoonist who has been self-publishing comics in New York since 2013. His influences include Will Eisner, Jack Kirby, Todd McFarlane, Joe Madureira, Shotaro Ishinomori, Osamu Tezuka, and Steve Ditko. His unique style emphasizes the kinetic energy of handmade cartooning. He specializes in silent, sepia-toned, satirical slapstick set in space.

Michael's previous projects, including "Mollie and The Spacediver" and "The Adventures of Mark Question," can be found at 7BrainComics.com. His current series, "Simon in Space," is currently being updated with new chapters every month on his Patreon page.
Come hang with a guest creator at 540! Head down to the basement. Your code to join: YOU.
... what Could Go Wrong?
🔥 Donated original art for the creatorCODE cause ❤️‍🔥

With any amount raised above the $13,187 goal. Once those rates are paid, any remaining surplus will be distributed as agreed bonus rates, with final residual funds allocated to building the Creator Code platform." Critically, the Creators will retain 100% ownership of their intellectual property.
DMYTRO EZIO "Dezi"SIENTY
I use my 20+ years of experience in the publishing world to translate the client’s ideas and goals into a physical brand, publication or graphic.

Whether it’s a comic book, graphic novel, a logo, postcard, banner, packaging or special project, I walk the client through the beginning to the end of the process to make sure they are satisfied and have a quality design or product that pushes their unique vision into reality.
In my spare time I enjoy attending open mics, drawing caricatures, visiting museums and exploring what the great outdoors has to offer.

Rafer Roberts is the writer and co-creator of The Rock Gods of Jackson, Tennessee and Grumble (both with Mike Norton), Modern Fantasy (with Kristen Gudsnuk), and the upcoming Babylon Cove (with Joe Eisma). He’s written young-adult comics for Minecraft anthologies, mature-reader comics for heavy metal anthologies, and the occasional Rick & Morty comic for everyone. Rafer has worked for Image, Oni, Valiant, Dark Horse, and a few dozen others. Rafer’s artwork appeared in the Eisner- and Harvey-winning anthology Little Nemo: Dream Another Dream, and he was founding editor of the Washington, D.C. comics newspaper, Magic Bullet. His self-published works include Plastic Farm and Nightmare the Rat, both recently concluded. Rafer lives in Baltimore as far as you know.
Rafer Roberts  / / President - Plastic Farm Press / P.F.Prep
Mini Documentary co- director/producers team Nicole Fernadez & Tyler Cino

Tyler Cino Maradiaga (they/he) is a nicaraguan American filmmaker based in Brooklyn, NY. rooted in a deep commitment to social justice that began during their undergraduate studies at UC Berkeley, Tyler brings nearly a decade of experience in diversity, equity, and inclusion to their artistic practice. they earned an m.a. in film directing from the feirstein graduate school of cinema at Brooklyn college, where they honed an exciting cinematic voice that blends drama, comedy, and the fantastical. through this lens, Tyler crafts stories that delve into identity, community, and the complexities of social change.
Tyler loves working on narrative, music video, and videography projects, and is adept at directing, producing, and as a DP. their works have screened at festivals across the united states.
Co- Director Producer:  Nicole Fernández

Nicole Fernández is a Documentarian and Producer, with interests ranging from experimenting with images to constructing avant-garde narratives. She engages in projects that advocate for social issues and explore the intricacies of human interaction. She holds an MFA in Producing from the Feirstein Graduate School of Cinema, affiliated with Brooklyn College.
She is capable of overseeing all aspects of production, guiding production teams effectively during the filmmaking process with a strong sense of leadership, creativity, and responsibility.
She has directed two documentaries: Chingaza is Coming, a mockumentary proposal supported by and inspired by the development of kitsch style, and The Chacharo, the result of a research process on a musical instrument lost in time.
Production by Charles Sincero/Director and Founder of Dare2Draw

gone.name: Creator Code "Live" Mini-Doc (digital)
gone.desc:
A 30-Day Creative Sprint for Will Eisner Week 2026
Seven New York City comic artists. One tight deadline. Their mission: to create the inaugural Creator CODE anthology.

Balancing day jobs, families, and city life, these seven creators will document their journey through personal vlogs. Each will dedicate 10–20 intense hours to craft an original 8-to-12-page sequential art narrative.

This documentary, directed by Tyler Cino Maradiaga and Nicole Fernández, captures the entire sprint—from concept to final page. Through intimate vlogs, behind-the-scenes footage, and candid mentoring sessions, witness the raw challenges and breakthroughs of creation.

Support this project to complete a compelling 10–15 minute film that reveals the heart of NYC's comic scene and celebrates a new generation of storytellers.

project.name: Rubellite Plushie
project.description: Who doesn’t want a Gembaby to hug and care for? Well now’s the time! Get yourself a Rubellite plushie, bring a Gembaby home!

creator.name: Therealwerespike
creator.biography: Name is Spike! Ans the Creator of Rubellite’s comics Roads To Nothing!

texte:
Start of April in 2025, I’ve decided to take a chance. And make a fanmade Gemchild for Ruby and Sapphire.. a Gembaby as you will. And so.. Rubellite was created! (Or born haha) 

She’s the daughter of Ruby and sapphire (and Garnet) I wanted them to have a biological child, especially the being my favorite characters. yes, I know Gems can’t have children. But what if they can?? So I took that risk, and around in June to July I posted the start of her comic series “Roads To Nothing” Rubellite’s story. I posted it on TikTok first, not expecting much support and more backlash. Well.. not long after it blew up. 105k views on TikTok, and almost 3-5K likes. Each pages close to 100’s of likes and now 5K followers. All the support to a Gemchild of mine 
I hardly see people make Gemchildren, only in stories you see, but not in comic form, or hardly many with lore. SU brought me joy and I know brought joy to others around the globe. But this comic has inspired, brought joy, and made people take chances on creating new things that are not “possible” or just don’t happen. 

Thank you all so much for making this happen! I’m honored you love this Gembaby just like I do! And hope you bring her home! 

Just feed her cookie cats or she’ll eat yours

gone.name: Rubellite Plushie
gone.desc: Support The Rubellite plushie and get that Gembaby!

gone.name: Rubellite Plushie + Drawstring backpack!
gone.desc: Rubellite plushie AND baggie to carry her in?! You’ll have a back buddy, and a Gem to defend you

project.name: HEATHER: Graphic Novel of Online Dating Gone Horribly Wrong (Canceled)
project.description: She ghosted him. Now he's coming after her.

creator.name: Riker Books
creator.biography:
Father/Son biz.

Trained in Japan's oldest combat-oriented martial art, Rico Lamoureux combines his expertise in self-defense with his passion for storytelling, the result being the gritty Crime Thriller world of the Riker series.

An author for over thirty years, he's now bringing his fast-paced, WTF-style of storytelling to the world of graphic novels. 

Whether it's a physical copy or on your cellphone, grab onto it tightly, because things are about to cut so deep you'll feel it sawing through your bones.

titre: Take a Look at the Rewards
texte: Ever been ghosted on an online dating app?
Studies show well over half of online daters have experienced such betrayal, and I'm one of 'em.
So what does a crime thriller author do when he's virtually chewed up and spit out?
I create.
The result being this 50-page standalone graphic novel. Although it does include a pivotal appearance by our main character, Riker, from our crime thriller book series.
So yeah, Heather is my love letter to the online dating world.
So what kind of vibes does this book give?
It's like if the Netflix show, YOU, had a baby.
Or if the film, FATAL ATTRACTION, had a grandbaby.
With the 'you need to learn your lesson', theme of the thriller, UNHINGED.
Obsession taken to an insane level, with the pertinent question being, how long can he continue this psychotic game of cat-and-mouse?
We love storytelling.
Rico and Journey Teller Lamoureux are the founders of Riker Books and Rico is the author of Heather.
Rico has been writing for over three decades, and is excited to share this graphic novel, which explores a darker side of online dating.
Let’s create captivating visuals together!

Ryhan Kierra is a comic artist and illustrator who loves bringing stories to life with detailed expressive artwork. She specializes in manga and graphic novel iillustration, and is passionate about turning ideas into pages that feel alive. You can find her work at fiverr.com/rhyankierra
We specialize in helping brands grow.

Najmah Donnie Dirangarun is a skilled video editor and digital marketing professional, with expertise in creating engaging content for brands and entrepreneurs. She is the CEO and founder of Nomad Vision Marketing LLC, a company dedicated to helping businesses grow globally through digital design, branding, social media, and content creation. With a strong background in video editing, Najmah brings stories to life by combining creativity and strategy, ensuring that every project connects with its target audience. 

nomadvisionmarketing.com
Founder of Riker Books, victim of Heather, Rico has always said he'll get a tattoo of whichever one of his books becomes a bestseller first.
If this happens to be Heather, so be it. He'll have the name of the woman who ghosted him forever etched on his forearm.
Let's make it happen!
They'll even be a video documenting the ink session!

Check out our reward section for some unique and great items, including a personally signed copy of HEATHER, that also comes with a digital deluxe copy of the book, content of which is EXCLUSIVE to Kickstarter!

project.name: ScreenHuggers – First Edition
project.description: 3D-printed monsters that hug your screen

creator.name: Fredrik Rosado
creator.biography:
Hi all!
My name is Fredrik and I'm a 3D artist and graphic designer that has loves everything that has to do with fantasy and sci-fi.

titre: What creators are saying / See it in action
Put Words in Its Mouth.
Light, Safe & Custom-Built for Your Screen
texte: Meet ScreenHuggers™ (Patent Pending): the perfect blend of fantasy flair and geek pride for your monitor. Elevate your gaming setup with original 3D Printable designs that make a statement. This Kickstarter is packed with over 10 ready-to-print designs, and we’re just getting started.
Expect epic stretch goals, jaw-dropping creatures, and new drops that’ll take your screen from “meh” to monstrous.
My name is Fred, and I have successfully completed and delivered 14+ Kickstarters. ScreenHuggers is built on that same proven process — clear planning, realistic timelines, and reliable fulfillment.
Let's have a look at these 10 crazy designs! They are included in the Kickstarter, and if we reach our stretch goals, we can get more than 20 designs.

KONG — King of the Screens.
The ultimate desk flex. Coworkers will stare. Spreadsheets will tremble. Productivity may or may not improve — but dominance is guaranteed.

MIMIC — Nothing on your desk is safe.
Hiding in plain sight, this sneaky monster eats anything within reach — cables, snacks, and yes… your mouse. If it’s on your desk, it’s fair game.
Desk Encounter: Mimic gains Advantage on surprise attacks. Player drops mouse.

DRAGON — Your desk just became a fire hazard.
Once this dragon claims your screen, everything else is collateral. Cables melt. Coffee trembles. Productivity burns. This is not decoration — it’s a warning.
Desk Encounter: Dex save failed. Desk takes fire damage.

ORC — Your desk picked a fight.
Subtlety was never an option. This orc solves problems the fast way — by smashing first and asking nothing later. If your desk was acting up, it won’t be anymore.
Desk Encounter: STR check failed. Desk takes bludgeoning damage.

IRON FIST — Order has entered the workspace.
When Iron Fist grips your screen, chaos ends immediately. Rules are enforced. Discipline is restored.
Desk Encounter: No save. Compliance is mandatory.

RIPCLAW — Workplace safety was optional.
HR looked away. OSHA stopped replying.
Desk Encounter: Liability increased.

RAVENBLADE — You didn’t see this coming.
Silent, precise, and already behind you, Ravenblade turns your screen into a vantage point. No chaos. No mess. Just clean work and a quiet exit.
Desk Encounter: Perception check failed. Surprise round.

We go live during the campaign to show real prints, real tests, and real work in the studio.
No edits. No stock footage. Just the process.

Your ScreenHuggers can whisper “Let’s roll” or scream “AFK, MORTAL!”
With swappable speech bubbles and letters, your desk becomes a stage for inside jokes, slang, or battle cries. You’re not stuck with one quote, you can create a library of laughs.
Engineered by a Product Designer to make these Huggers attach to almost any monitor safely, no damage, just instant awesomeness.
Epic Grip! Like an orc gripping his battle axe, this mount won’t let go. Your ScreenHugger stays locked in, even during the most intense boss fights or Monday meetings. (Patent Pending)
Solid like a Mountain. Crafted with a patent-pending mount, engineered to be ultra-stable but feather-light, because your monitor deserves both strength and style. (Patent Pending)
Add attitude, humor, or full-blown battle cries with custom speech bubbles and epic text!
Whether it’s “FOR THE HORDE!” or “Don’t touch my snacks,” your ScreenHugger now talks back.
ScreenHuggers are simple to mount and assemble. The only thing you might need for extra safety is two zip ties per ScreenHugger.
Below is a video showing how I mount the ScreenHuggers to my monitor.
While ScreenHuggers (patent pending) themselves can be printed light, our specially engineered screen bracket can support over 15.5 lbs (7 kg) — far more than you’ll ever need.

We’ve stress-tested the design using PLA filament (though PETG is recommended for even better strength) to ensure a perfect fit and maximum stability. So even if your character is carrying a greatsword, a spellbook, or a full pot of coffee, it’s not going anywhere.

ScreenHuggers are eye-catching, practical, and instantly understood.
People see them once and ask, “Where do I get that?”

👉 Affiliate
Share your link. Earn a commission on every backer.
No printing. No packing. No support.
Get your free link here: https://screenhuggers.kickbooster.me/boost/screenhuggers

👉 Merchant License
3D print ScreenHuggers and sell them painted or unpainted.
Set your own prices. Keep the margins.

✔ Optimized for FDM printers
✔ Minimal supports, beginner-friendly
✔ Scales from hobby printer to print farm
If you already have an audience or a 3D printer, this is an easy way to monetize.

I got the idea after creating dice towers for tabletop games. They were on the larger side, and I really liked how they looked standing on my desk. That’s when I thought, “Why can’t this type of thing go on my screen?”
After that, I sat down and created my first sketch. It wasn’t much, but my kids loved it, and that’s when I thought this could be something for others too.
After getting some great help from Bruno Santeches, modeling my Orc, I test printed sections of it to see if it works. And I loved it!!

I had to figure out a way to paint the ScreenHuggers in a fast and easy way that anyone can do. I had tried some dry brushing before on smaller miniatures, and it had been super fun and easy. Printing the ScreenHuggers in black saves a lot of paint and time, as it works as a base coat that’s already done.

With that, I started to dry brush the ScreenHuggers with colours, and it worked a treat. I used the dry brushing method for about 95% of the model, and when it was all done, I went back in to create highlights and wear and tear with my $2 bargain brush.
So no expensive gear is needed for these guys, and they came out great!

All measurements are shown in both millimeters (mm) and inches (in) for reference. ScreenHuggers vary in size between designs, and some measurements may change slightly as we finalize the models. We’ll always do our best to keep everything as accurate as possible.

Shipping is not included in the pledge price and will be charged separately after the Kickstarter campaign has finished. This allows us to calculate accurate shipping costs based on your location and selected rewards.

To keep everything transparent, we’ve put together a detailed shipping estimate spreadsheet that shows estimated shipping costs by country, with Australia broken down by individual states. The spreadsheet includes separate tabs so you can easily find the estimate that applies to you.
Final shipping costs will be collected after the campaign using a pledge manager.
Please note: all shipping prices shown in the spreadsheet are estimates and may vary slightly based on final packaging size, weight, and destination.
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1coNNPJMm3NSAcX43SY0Ffdfg6JtW6py5nuPoUaKJsOI/edit?usp=sharing
Note: Shipping costs and any required sales tax or VAT are not included in the pledge amount. These will be calculated and collected through the pledge manager after the campaign ends.
Add instant personality with ScreenHuggers, essential mascots for gamers, streamers, and anyone wanting to make a statement.

The physical ScreenHuggers are 3D printed using a 0.4 mm nozzle, not injection-molded. This means you may see light layer lines, subtle surface texture, or small seam/cut lines where parts are assembled. These are normal characteristics of high-quality FDM 3D printing and do not affect strength, fit, or function.

Each ScreenHugger is hand-painted (not sanded), so slight variations in paint tones, shading, and details will occur, making every piece a little different. All units are printed, cleaned, painted, and inspected before shipping, and we never send failed or structurally compromised prints.
This gruesome 3D-printed stand doesn’t just look epic on your desk, it’s built to hold your headphones or even your gaming controller in its bony grasp.
Forged in a digital dungeon in Brisbane Australia by a small band of creators, Beast Miniatures brings monsters to life with 3D sculpts worthy of any campaign or collector’s shelf.

Taxes & VAT:
We are using Kickstarter’s Pledge Manager. Any applicable sales tax or value-added tax (VAT) will be calculated and collected when you complete your pledge manager survey after the campaign ends. This ensures you are only charged the exact tax amount required based on your country of residence and the reward(s) you select.
Please note: customs duties or import fees may still apply depending on your country and are the responsibility of the backer.

More info here:
https://help.kickstarter.com/hc/en-us/articles/39649540800923-How-to-set-tax-expectations-with-your-backers?utm_source=chatgpt.com

Will I be charged sales tax or VAT?
Yes. If you are in the EU, UK, US, or Canada, applicable sales tax/VAT will be collected in the pledge manager based on your shipping address and the items you select. Kickstarter handles this collection and remittance on behalf of us and remits it to the appropriate authorities.

Important: This information is provided for transparency with our backers and does not constitute tax advice. Please consult a qualified tax professional if you have questions about your obligations in your country. Kickstarter’s tools help with collection and reporting, but ultimate compliance remains a legal responsibility.
By backing ScreenHuggers, you agree to the following terms regarding the content provided by Beast Miniatures:
1. Digital Files (STLs) The STL files provided are for the exclusive use of the individual backer. You may not sell, share, distribute, or upload the digital files to any server or file-sharing site.
2. Physical Prints & Resale
Standard Backers: You may print the files for personal use only. The sale of physical prints is strictly prohibited.
Merchant Tier Backers: You have the license to sell physical 3D prints of the models for as long as you hold an active Merchant License (or as specified in the reward tier description).
3. No Mass Production or Molding You may not create casts, molds, or engage in mass production (e.g., injection molding).
Note for Merchants: Your license covers 3D printed sales only. You may not cast these models in resin or other materials for mass sale. This protects the integrity of the limited collector's series.
4. Modification You are free to resize or mirror the files to fit your printer. You may not create derivative works (remixes) for digital distribution.
5. Content Creation Please feel free to take photos, stream, or make videos with your printed ScreenHuggers! We love seeing them in the wild. Credit to Beast Miniatures is appreciated.
6. Copyright All designs and copyrights remain the exclusive property of Beast Miniatures. No IP rights are transferred to the backer.

project.name: MagHub Quad Max- The 18.5" Portable Triple-Screen Display
project.description: Turn your laptop into a four-screen workstation Anywhere, 3X18.5" FHD displays 1080P, One-cable setup, 360° rotation, macOS & Windows

creator.name: INVZI
creator.biography:
INVZI designs portable productivity tools for modern work.
We’ve launched and delivered multiple hardware projects worldwide, focusing on thoughtful design, reliable engineering, and responsible fulfillment.

titre: Dual USB-C Ports for Power and Connection
Easy to Pack and Carry with Your Laptop
As Seen on CES 2026 at Las Vegas
texte: Meet MagHub Quad Max, the world’s first 18.5-inch portable triple display designed to transform your laptop into a true multi-screen workstation anywhere you go. With three expansive displays unfolding from a single, sleek unit, Quad Max gives creators, professionals, and power users the screen space they’ve always wanted.

MagHub Quad Max connects to your laptop using a single USB-C cable (10Gbps or up), keeping setup simple and the workspace clean. Once connected, the screens are ready to use without complicated configurations.
MagHub Quad Max isn’t about adding screens and it’s about how you actually work.

MagHub Quad Max features three 18.5-inch displays, prioritizing usable workspace over compactness alone. Instead of shrinking content to fit smaller panels, Quad Max allows information to stay at natural, comfortable sizes. This reduces the need for constant zooming, scrolling, or window resizing and creating a workflow that feels more intuitive and less constrained.

MagHub Quad Max gives traders and analysts the screen space needed to monitor markets in real time. With three large 16:9 displays, charts, order books, news feeds, and dashboards remain visible at the same time, allowing decisions to be made faster without constant window switching or lost context.

MagHub Quad Max supports modern development workflows by allowing developers to dedicate separate screens to their code editor, terminal, documentation, and live previews. With tools kept organized and always in view, context switching is reduced, focus is easier to maintain, and long working sessions become more efficient.

MagHub Quad Max enables a true multi-display editing setup, allowing timelines, assets, tools, and previews to be placed across separate screens. This supports faster edits, greater precision, and a more natural creative workflow, wherever you work.

MagHub Quad Max supports face-to-face presentations by allowing the top display to be flipped toward your client. Slides, data, and visuals can be shared clearly, while you maintain full control from your laptop screen, creating a more natural and professional presentation experience.

In group settings, MagHub Quad Max becomes a shared visual workspace. A triangle-style display layout keeps key information visible from multiple angles, allowing everyone at the table to follow along naturally. Side screens can be used for notes, references, and supporting materials, helping discussions move more smoothly and decisions come together faster.

MagHub Quad Max uses 18.5-inch Full HD (1080P) displays with a 16:9 aspect ratio, delivering a familiar and efficient workspace for everyday professional applications. Text remains sharp and easy to read, while charts, timelines, and interfaces appear at comfortable, natural sizes without excessive scaling.

With 18.5-inch screens, content stays at natural sizes, windows fit side by side, and important information remains visible without constant zooming or scrolling. Compared to typical portable displays, the difference in screen space is immediately noticeable, making long work sessions more comfortable and more efficient. This extra screen area allows you to see more, switch less, and stay focused on the work that matters. Each screen is built on IPS panel technology, ensuring consistent colors and wide viewing angles. This allows content to remain clear and accurate even when the displays are viewed from the side or shared across a table and ideal for collaboration, presentations, and multi-angle setups.

To support long working sessions, the displays incorporate Low Blue Light technology, helping reduce eye strain without introducing harsh color shifts. Combined with a brightness level of 300 nits, the screens stay clear and comfortable in typical office and indoor environments, balancing visibility with visual comfort.

MagHub Quad Max is equipped with two USB-C ports, designed for maximum flexibility. Either port can be used to connect to your laptop and another to the 45W USB-C PD power adapter, and there is no fixed “power-only” or “laptop-only” port. This interchangeable design allows you to set up MagHub Quad Max in the way that best fits your workspace, without worrying about which side to plug in first. Once connected, the system automatically manages power and data to ensure stable multi-display performance.

MagHub Quad Max includes physical brightness buttons that allow you to adjust screen brightness quickly and directly on the device. With simple button presses, you can adapt the displays to different lighting conditions, whether you are working in a bright office or a dimmer environment.

MagHub Quad Max features a precision-crafted aluminum stand designed to provide stable support for multiple large displays. The rigid metal structure minimizes flex and wobble, keeping the screens firmly positioned during typing, interaction, and long working sessions.

MagHub Quad Max uses a reinforced aluminum hinge system designed to securely support large displays while allowing smooth, controlled movement. The hinges provide the right balance of stability and flexibility, keeping screens firmly in place once positioned. Built for repeated folding and unfolding, the hinge design ensures reliable performance over time, so MagHub Quad Max stays stable whether you’re set up at a desk or on the move

Despite its expanded screen space, MagHub Quad Max is built with portability in mind. Its foldable structure allows the displays to collapse neatly when not in use, making it easy to pack, carry, and store between workspaces.

When folded, MagHub Quad Max fits neatly alongside your laptop in a single portable bag. The slim, collapsible design allows both devices to be carried together, making multi-screen productivity practical even when you’re moving between locations. Whether you’re commuting, traveling, or working from different spaces, Quad Max is designed to go where your laptop goes without requiring a separate case or bulky transport solution.

MagHub Quad Max is designed to work with modern laptops across the most common platforms. It supports Windows systems and macOS with a one-time driver installation to enable extended multi-display modes. Both Intel-based and Apple Silicon Macs are supported, allowing users to build a flexible multi-screen setup across different devices. The physical design accommodates most laptops ranging from 12” to 18”, making Quad Max suitable for a wide variety of workflows and hardware configurations.
Getting started with MagHub Quad Max is quick and straightforward.
Once connected, your screens will light up automatically. Your laptop is now transformed into a four-screen workspace, ready for focused, efficient work anywhere.

MagHub Quad Max uses a professional multi-display driver to enable stable, extended screen output across different operating systems. The setup process is straightforward and only needs to be completed once.

MagHub Quad Max can also be powered by a power bank that provides 45W output or higher. This allows you to use the full multi screen setup even when a wall outlet is not available. With a compatible high power power bank, MagHub Quad Max becomes a truly mobile workstation, making it easy to work during travel, at shared spaces, or in temporary setups where fixed power is limited.

We are delighted to offer worldwide Free shipping for all MagHub Quad Max backers. To ensure a smooth and hassle-free delivery experience, we have carefully implemented the following shipping and duty policies:

MagHub Quad Max was developed with a focus on expanding the laptop workspace while maintaining portability and structural stability. The design centers around three large 18.5-inch displays integrated into a foldable system that opens smoothly and locks securely in place. Special attention was given to screen alignment, hinge strength, and overall balance to ensure a stable multi-screen setup during use.

Throughout development, we refined the folding mechanism to allow the system to transition easily between an expanded workspace and a compact, travel-ready form. The hinge structure was engineered to support repeated folding while maintaining precise positioning. On the display side, we selected IPS panels with Full HD resolution to ensure consistent color, clarity, and viewing angles across all screens. This consistency is especially important in a multi-display environment where visual alignment directly affects comfort and usability.

The system is designed to operate through a single USB-C connection, reducing cable clutter and simplifying setup. Internal layout and cable routing were optimized to support clean operation and long-term reliability. As development progressed, prototypes were tested and refined to validate durability, folding performance, and multi-screen functionality. Feedback from hands-on demonstrations and early showcases helped guide final adjustments before moving into the verification and production phases. MagHub Quad Max represents a balance of industrial design, mechanical precision, and practical usability — built to deliver a full workspace experience in a portable form.

INVZI is a product-focused hardware brand dedicated to designing tools that improve how people work with technology. Since launching our first product in 2020, we have successfully delivered multiple hardware projects to customers worldwide, including 14 crowdfunding campaigns. Each project has helped us refine our approach to design, manufacturing, and global fulfillment.

Our team has extensive experience working with complex consumer electronics, from power and charging solutions to portable work accessories. Over the years, we’ve built strong partnerships across supply chains, manufacturing, and logistics, allowing us to move efficiently from concept to mass production.

With MagHub Quad Max, we are applying everything we’ve learned to a new category expanding the laptop workspace through thoughtful industrial design, mechanical precision, and practical usability. We believe great hardware should feel intuitive, reliable, and purposeful. MagHub Quad Max reflects that philosophy by combining large-scale displays with a foldable, portable form, built to support focused and efficient work. We’re excited to bring MagHub Quad Max to life with the support of the Kickstarter community and look forward to sharing each step of the journey with our backers.
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 3,500+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $1B raised between them.
