project.name: chernozem: Real Output Over White-Collar Noise
project.description: A limited clothing drop for people who value real output over digital noise.

creator.name: Stan
creator.biography:
19 years old. Born in Ukraine, living in Cambridge UK. 
Entrepreneur

texte: INTRODUCTION
Limited Edition Hoodie.
250 pieces. No reprints.
This project exists to produce one finished garment — without overproduction and without excess inventory.
Each hoodie is made only after the campaign ends, based on confirmed backer demand.
THE CONCEPT
Most clothing is produced first and sold later.
This often leads to waste and unnecessary stock.
This project follows a different approach.
One design.
One production run.
Once the 250 pieces are allocated, the design is permanently retired.
THE PRODUCT
Limited Edition Hoodie
• Timeless silhouette
• Durable construction
• Designed for long-term wear
• One design, one batch
This is not fast fashion.
It’s a single, finished object.
WHY KICKSTARTER
Kickstarter allows production to be aligned directly with real demand.
Funds raised through the campaign are used to:
• Manufacture the hoodies
• Cover logistics and fulfillment
• Deliver orders to backers
The project is intentionally limited to ensure quality and control.
HOW IT WORKS
You back the project
After the campaign ends, size and shipping details are collected
Production begins
Hoodies are manufactured and shipped
Shipping is paid separately after the campaign, based on destination.
USE OF AI
AI tools are used in two limited contexts within this project.
First, AI may be used during early visual exploration and concept development (such as mood references and non-final visuals).
Second, AI-generated imagery and video may be used for social media and promotional content related to the project.
This content is created as creative, conceptual material and does not claim to represent real people, real events, or real-world documentation.
All final product designs, garments, prints, and production-ready assets are created, selected, and approved by the project creator and are not AI-generated.
No copyrighted artworks, living artists’ styles, or protected visual assets are used.
RISKS & CHALLENGES
Production and shipping timelines may be affected by external factors.
To reduce risk:
• Production is limited to a single batch
• Quantities are based on confirmed demand
• Backers will receive clear updates if changes occur
ENVIRONMENTAL APPROACH
The project prioritizes longevity over volume.
• Long-lasting design
• Minimal, reusable or recyclable packaging
• No excess inventory
FINAL NOTE
This project represents a single, limited release.
There are no reprints and no guaranteed future drops.

project.name: Found in the Underground
project.description: Community-inspired streetwear for the rave and underground culture.

creator.name: GABRIEL PEREZ
creator.biography: Founder of Found in the Underground, inspired by rave and underground culture, and focused on building community through intentional design.

texte: Found in the Underground was born on dancefloors where everything else fell away.
In rooms where the bass was loud enough to quiet your thoughts, where movement became language, and where strangers felt like mirrors instead of threats.

It wasn’t just music. It was the feeling of being fully present — safe, free, held, and anonymous all at once. A place where you didn’t have to explain yourself to belong, because everyone there already understood.
For many of us, those spaces weren’t an escape from life. They were the place we finally felt inside it.

What made those spaces feel like home wasn’t perfection or performance.
It was the absence of judgment.
No one was there to watch you. No one was there to measure you. Everyone was simply along for the ride together — moving, feeling, letting go at the same pace.
In those moments, identity softened. Differences didn’t disappear, but they didn’t divide. You were allowed to be exactly who you were, without explanation, without defense.

Found in the Underground exists to honor that feeling — not as nostalgia, but as something worth carrying forward into the everyday. A reminder that community doesn’t have to be loud to be powerful, and belonging doesn’t have to be earned.

Found in the Underground isn’t about recreating a moment in time.
It’s about protecting a feeling that shaped us — and finding ways to recognize each other beyond the dancefloor.

This first collection reflects that shared experience. Pieces designed for comfort, movement, and everyday life, made with intention and care. Not to stand out, but to feel at home — wherever you are.
If you’ve ever felt that quiet sense of belonging in the music, if you’ve ever locked eyes with a stranger and known you were part of the same moment, this project is for you.

You’re not just supporting a brand.
You’re helping carry something forward — together.

project.name: VORONA: The Design Surgery. LAUNCHING: Tuesday, Feb 3rd.
project.description: Giving dead garments a second life through avant-garde reconstruction and post-apocalyptic soul. One-of-a-kind, handcrafted Scarves. ✂️

creator.name: Yulia Sakovich
creator.biography:
My name is Yulia. 
I am the creator of the brand VORONA.
I bring my Eastern European roots and craftsmanship to the creative heart of Sacramento, California

Giving dead garments a second life through avant-garde reconstruction and post-apocalyptic soul. One-of-a-kind, handcrafted Scarves. ✂️

titre: Wearable Art Born from Design Surgery.
How to Get Your Unique VORONA Scarf
Special Category: The Bespoke Vision – Custom Commission 🎨
The Heirloom Connection: Breathing New Life into Your Memories 🧵
The Grey Anatomy Surprise: A Mystery Surgery 🩶
How It Works: Selecting Your Unique Scarf
Important Note on Production & Delivery Times
Why Kickstarter? Help Me Scale the Art.
VORONA Collection is launching on Kickstarter.  Ready to ship!
texte: I rescue premium vintage textiles and perform "Design Surgery" to create avant-garde, one-of-a-kind scarves. More than just an accessory, it's a second life for forgotten fashion, reimagined for the rebels and the dreamers.

My mission is to rescue exceptional fabrics from being forgotten. By blending the structured elegance of an old jacket with the rugged soul of distressed denim, I create something entirely new: a wearable art object. It’s no surprise that my scarves often find their home at festivals like Burning Man, where individuality and survivalist style meet.
My name is Yuliya and for the past two years, I’ve been breathing new life into forgotten clothes through "Design Surgery."

My journey into fashion didn't start at a sewing machine, but at an easel. With a background in fine arts, I see fabrics not just as material, but as a palette of textures and colors. To me, creating a VORONA scarf is a form of "Design Surgery."
• Proven Experience: I run a successful shop on Etsy with a 100% track record of positive reviews and on-time shipping.
• California Crafted: You can find me at local street fairs across California, where my scarves have found a community of loyal fans and happy owners.
• Reliable Delivery: Whether shipping across the U.S. or internationally, I take pride in my professional approach every order I've ever taken has been sent on schedule without a single delay.

For me, this process is a meditation. I don’t just "make" scarves I paint with textiles. Each stitch is a brushstroke, and each metal rivet is a highlight. I am giving these materials a second, more daring life, and I am honored to share this vision with you.
I’m here on Kickstarter to take VORONA from a passion project to a professional studio. Thank you for supporting independent, sustainable art!
Every scarf is a meticulous "operation" that transforms forgotten garments into avant-garde art pieces.
1. Selection & The Hidden Potential
It all begins with the hunt for materials. I personally curate vintage items, focusing on premium quality: silk and wool blazers, raw denim, and textured jackets.
• The Master’s Secret: I look for the beauty in interior seams. In my signature "exposed seam" technique, these hidden structures become the primary avant-garde ornament.
2. Deconstruction
Each found piece undergoes professional cleaning. Then, the "surgery" begins:
• I completely disassemble the garment, removing linings and unnecessary elements.
• The clothing is then precision-cut into numerous small fragments, which serve as the "palette" for the future masterpiece.
Beauty is more than skin deep. I use 100% new cotton, linen, and wool for the lining so that while the exterior looks rugged and 'distressed', the part touching your skin feels like a soft embrace.

Each VORONA scarf is a unique, handcrafted piece, but they all follow a similar size profile. Triangle scarf. On average, the scarves are approximately 55-59 inches (140-150 cm) long and 18-20 inches (45-50 cm) wide. This size is perfect for versatile styling while maintaining that bold, avant-garde look.
3. Reconstruction & Layering
Using a triangular canvas as a guide, I lay out a mosaic of the prepared fabric pieces.
• Craftsmanship: Every scrap is carefully pressed and positioned. Some parts are decorated individually before the final assembly.
• The fragments are then multi-layered and stitched together, creating a complex, durable, and unique texture.
4. Final Touches: Hardware & Soul
Once the base is reconstructed, I breathe character into the piece:
• Embellishments: Leather inserts, metal studs, rivets, and hand-painted graphics or inscriptions.
• Functionality: The signature lobster clasp is added, finalizing the silhouette.
Through this Design Surgery, old garments lose their former shape and gain a new soul. It is no longer just a piece of clothing it is a unique work of art reborn for a new life.

Select your reward: Early Bird, Signature Scarf, The Twin Set, The Grey Anatomy Surprise, The Bespoke Vision or Heirloom Scarf. Don’t worry about the specific design yet  at this stage, you are simply securing your place in the queue.
Once the campaign ends, I will send a Digital Catalog to all backers.
• Backer #1 gets the first pick from the entire collection.
• Backer #2 picks next, and so on.
You will simply reply with the ID number of your favorite scarf, and I’ll ship it directly to you!
Don't worry, I have 80-100 unique designs, so everyone will find their perfect match.
The Twins Set is a unique concept of "biological" connection between two pieces of wearable art. These are two similar scarves handcrafted and reconstructed from the exact same original garment.
What makes them special?
• Shared DNA: Since both scarves are born from one item, they share the same textures, color shades, and history.
• Individual Souls: While they are twins, they are not identical. Each has its own unique "surgical" scars, fringe patterns, and hardware placement. They belong together yet stand alone.
How to get your "Double Vision: The Twins Set":
1. Twin Order: If you fall in love with a single design from the catalog or my Instagram you can request a Twin Reconstruction.
2. The Process: I will find a similar base garment and perform a "double surgery" to create two harmonious scarves for you.
This is the ultimate VORONA experience. While standard rewards focus on my existing library, The Bespoke Vision puts you in the co-author’s seat of the "Design Surgery.
⚡ Priority Production: Your order skips the general queue and goes straight to the top of my crafting list.
🎨 Total Creative Freedom: You define the soul of the piece. We will collaborate on the specific materials, color palette, and intricate styling.
🧩 The "Composite" Approach: Love the fringe from one of my past Instagram works but prefer the metal hardware of another? We’ll merge those elements into your perfect piece.
🤝 Personal Consultation: We will discuss your vision in detail to ensure the final result is exactly what you imagined or better.

We all have those garments tucked away in the back of a closet a grandfather’s sweater, a mother’s favorite jacket, or a piece of clothing from someone dear to our hearts. These items are priceless vessels of memory, yet they often go unworn because they are out of style or no longer fit.
I want to help you take those memories out of the shadows and turn them into something you can wear every day.
Step 1: Send Your History 📦 You provide the sentimental garment, and I perform a "design surgery" to transform it. We’ll have a consultation first to ensure the fabric is suitable for reconstruction.

Step 2: Preserving the DNA 🧬 The soul and fabric of your original piece remain the centerpiece. I then integrate modern elements, hand-distressed textures, and high-end hardware to give it a contemporary, avant-garde edge.

Step 3: Inspired by You ✨ You can browse the VORONA Library or my Instagram and point out a style that resonates with you. I will then craft a unique scarf that mirrors that aesthetic while using your meaningful material.
The Result: This is more than a scarf; it’s a way to carry your history with you, reimagined for the modern world.
Note: Backers are responsible for the cost of shipping their original garment to my studio in Sacramento. Return shipping of the completed "Heirloom" scarf is already included in your pledge.

I know many of you love the thrill of the unexpected the excitement of unboxing a mystery. That’s why I created 'Surprise Surgery'. You trust my hands and my aesthetic, and in return, I create a piece that is a total surprise for you.
The Concept: Moody, surgical, and monochromatic.
The Twist: You don’t pick the specific design; I curate it for you using my finest grey denims, textured jackets, and signature hardware accents.
The Result: A one-of-a-kind VORONA scarf that is exclusively yours unveiled only when you open the box.
Note on Timing: To ensure every mystery piece receives the surgical precision it deserves, this series will be handcrafted and shipped in May 2026.
Check out the preview photos below. It’s moody, it’s surgical, it’s the ultimate expression of upcycled noir.
Are you ready for a surprise?
Since every VORONA piece is a one-of-a-kind creation, the selection process is designed to be fair, exciting, and transparent. Here is how we will get your wearable art from my studio to your hands:
Step 1: Access the Digital Gallery

Once the campaign successfully concludes, every backer will receive a link to the "VORONA Library" a comprehensive digital catalog featuring over 80-100 unique scarves, including the 40 exclusive pieces showcased during the campaign.
Step 2: The Priority Selection (First Come, First Served)
To honor our earliest supporters, the selection process follows a queue:
• The Order Matters: Scarves will be chosen based on the time you backed the project. The earlier you joined us, the higher your spot in the selection queue.
• Instant Match: You will browse the catalog and provide the ID number of your preferred ready-made scarf.
• Ready to Ship: If your choice is available, it will be reserved immediately and prepared for shipping within days of the survey completion.
I want to be transparent about how your scarf will be crafted and shipped. Because every piece involves complex "design surgery," my production schedule is divided into priority tiers:
Priority 1: Ready-to-Ship Items
If you select an existing scarf from the VORONA Library catalog, your order will be processed and shipped almost immediately after the survey is completed.
Priority 2: Premium Rewards

Orders for "The Bespoke Vision" and the "Custom Heirloom Scarf" (where I work with your personal garments) are my top production priorities. These backers have invested in a more complex experience, and their pieces will be crafted first.
Priority 3: Custom "Category" Orders
If you cannot find a scarf in the catalog that speaks to you and choose to order a Custom Category Scarf (e.g., "Grey Style" or "Distressed Blue Denim"):
• Extended Waiting Period: Please be prepared for a longer wait time.
• The Reason: These orders are processed after the Premium Tiers are completed. Finding the right vintage materials and crafting a new piece from scratch takes time.

• The Reward: You still get a custom-made, one-of-a-kind VORONA piece for the price of a standard reward. Your patience allows me to maintain the highest artistic standards without rushing the "surgery. If we reach a design agreement quickly, your one-of-a-kind piece could be shipped as early as late April or May. The sooner we finalize the details, the sooner your wearable art will be on its way!
• The Archive Choice: You can point out any model from the catalog or even from my Instagram archives (past sold works).

• A Unique Soul: Because I use authentic upcycling and hand-reconstruction, no two pieces can be 100% identical. Your scarf will carry the same spirit, color palette, and character as the original, but it will be uniquely yours.
Each scarf weighs approximately 1 lb (0.45 kg). We ship worldwide, and tracking numbers will be provided for all orders so you can follow your scarf’s journey from my studio to your door.
Note: Shipping costs will be calculated based on your location and added to your pledge
Please note: International backers are responsible for any customs duties or VAT applied by their country.
Until now, VORONA has been a one-woman surgical room. Each piece is handcrafted by me, but to turn this passion into a sustainable global brand, I need your help.
Your support will go towards:
• Production Space: Moving from a home studio to a dedicated workshop.
• Sourcing: Establishing a steady supply of high-end vintage materials for upcycling.
• Global Outreach: Launching a marketing campaign to bring "Design Surgery" to avant-garde lovers worldwide.
By backing this project, you aren’t just buying a scarf you are becoming a patron of sustainable, radical art. Let’s prove that fashion can be recycled, rebellious, and refined all at once.
Exclusive designs available only there!
Ready to wear a piece of history?
Pick your reward and join the Design Surgery!

gone.desc:

Own a definitive piece of wearable art. Each signature scarf is a complex collage of history and style, meticulously crafted for those who value individuality and sustainable luxury.

Your scarf is born from the careful deconstruction of pre-loved garments. I breathe new life into blazers, jackets, jeans, and reclaimed leather. By blending contrasting textures - like the toughness of a denim seam with the softness of a knit sweater - I create a rich, multi-dimensional aesthetic.
To ensure maximum comfort against your skin, these reclaimed elements are artistically appliquéd onto a brand-new, base of linen, cotton, wool, or viscose. It’s the perfect balance of rugged exterior and luxurious interior.

The Bespoke Process:

gone.desc:
We all have those garments tucked away in the back of a closet a grandfather’s sweater, a mother’s favorite jacket, or a piece of clothing from someone dear to our hearts. These items are priceless vessels of memory, yet they often go unworn because they are out of style.
How it works:
1. Consultation: Before sending anything, you will provide photos of 2-3 items you’d like to repurpose. As a "design surgeon," I will evaluate the fabric and construction to ensure it’s suitable for transformation.

project.name: House of ROTH - Haute Couture - RTW Runway
project.description: Creating a futurist-inspired, Fashion- Ready-To-Wear, Haute couture collection. Using fabrics and methods of multi-dimensional clothing

creator.name: Terrence Revah
creator.biography: Visual Display Designer, Designer, Photographer, writer. Underdog - "A man can be destroyed but not defeated" Hemingway

texte: It all started on a street I used to live on called Rothschild. At the time i was a visual display designer VDD and CEO at LINDBERGH/PWT WAGNER USA. Essentially my job description was creating a wardrobe-on-a-rack; Creating color coded collections where all garment types were interchangeable for creating outfits. I excelled, but it wasn't what I wanted to do as far as fashion goes. I was a designer at heart, but I was never given the opportunity at the company to create collections or make my own pieces. I was always too busy to actually manage doing the things I loved. I was complacent, and satisfied with my life and salary. But the idea of creating an RTW runway collection was always in the back of my mind, and I constantly told myself that one day, I would get to doing it. But like many things that day never came, until everything came crashing down, until my world fell apart. 2 years ago I was let go from what I thought was my forever job, the love of my life, or so I thought, had left me, and I entered into a quiet depression, and became a recluse in my own home. In my seclusion, I started to unveil my life, and the time I had left to actually do the things that made me happy, more importantly, the things I loved. I had nothing to lose, because well, I had already lost everything, and thats the way I saw it. This leave of absence from my past day-to-day life gave me perspective, and allowed me to do things I never imagined I would do. If I had nothing to lose, then well I had everything to gain, I thought. And for the first time in my life, I took a risk. I found the courage to put my fears to rest, I found the will to go out there and try to make something happen. Sitting at cafe downstairs my building, I started to draw the logo, and the accompanying designs. It hit me! House of Rothschild. Ready-to-wear functional lingerie. I dove into the remainder of my savings, bought sowing equipment and mannequins, and brought on two veteran creative partners to help me build a collection. Larry Tobis and Katya Moore. We didn't know what we were making or what we were doing in the beginning, all we knew is that we were becoming, becoming real designers. Fate is funny, we had all just been reeling from recent simultaneous misfortunes in our lives, and somehow found each other, as friends first, and then as partners. And just like that, it clicked, overnight. We had similar styles, thoughts, ideas, and understanding of what we wanted to make, even though it still wasn't clear to any of us. We were draping and patterning, sewing, and then the next thing we knew, we went from making singular one-pieces to full blown dresses, gowns, skirts, pants, underwear, anything that inspired or came to mind. As the collection developed it took on a life of its own. Pieces started to mirror each other, harmony between the assemblage of items started to sync in unimaginable and interchangeable ways. The collection was essentially steering us, without hashing-out branding details over large pieces of white board. It took on a life of its own, it had a heartbeat, no longer on life support. It became edgy and mysterious. Dark and ominous, yet vibrant and delicate. It didn't borrow from anything we knew, because we refused to borrow ideas and methods. It didn't seek to to replicate market successes either, because I wanted to make what I wanted. It was purely a passion project, something I loved that turned into something I could have never imagined. It went from HOUSE OF ROTHSCHILD to HOUSE of ROTH. It became dystopian, a-symmetrical, black & white - harnesses, buckles, stainless inserts, zippers utilitarian functionality. Again nothing I could have imagined. It borrows from nothing but our founding passions and ideas. Bold usage of neoprenes, leathers, nets and sheers. It tests the limits of whats acceptable. It pushes the frontier forward without apology. It's what we saw, and continue to see and draw and dream-up, and now all thats left is making it into a reality. The reality of sharing it with the world, and becoming the next major house of fashion, based right here in the United States, and made in America. The simple dream of walking outside one day and seeing someone wear something you made, and loving it, thats what makes it all worth it. And now we are here! Taking the next step. And so if I ever want this to become the brand that changes the world, I'm going to need people who believe in what were doing. We have already created more than 100 samples, in just one year. Some finished, some unfinished because of time constraints, and because we all have other living-wage jobs that occupy us just so we can pay the bills. But HOUSE of ROTH is what we do on our spare time, which is every night, in our chats, time alone, at every free opportunity given, on our days off... The collection is nearly ready. I need to create more samples and the accompanying tech packs. I just need to facilitate an additional - paid sewing hand to speed up the process, funding for a wow-factor website, and additional machinery for close-stitch operations. Creating finishes for our samples, would drastically reduce our sample making costs and at the same time help us build altogether better pieces. Old machinery has usage constraints. By creating fully developed tech-packs for manufacturing and sourcing, production time will be halved, because we do it in-house. Second, our branding strategy speaks for itself. A dystopian retro-90s approach to RTW runway. In an age where the elemental of what is the brand doesn't have to be highly definable, what it should be is the result of what the response is to what we are doing. We brake all the rules and take no prisoners doing it. The brand will shake up the industry and challenge its peers in every garment group, and thats the pillar we intend to coast on when it comes to our logos, futurist designs, and reckless attitude of just doing what defines us.

project.name: Secret Code Perfumes, Inc. (Canceled)
project.description: The Language of Scent

creator.name: Secret Code Fragrances, Inc
creator.biography:
Secret Code Perfumes, Inc. is a luxury fragrance project dedicated exclusively to Extrait de Parfum, the highest and most concentrated form of fine fragrance. Founded with a commitment to quality, intention, and craftsmanship, Secret Code was created to offer fragrances that feel personal, lasting, and meaningful.

Each scent is designed as a “code” layered, refined, and meant to unfold over time on the skin. By working with professional laboratories and premium raw materials, Secret Code prioritizes depth, longevity, and balance over mass production or trend-driven releases.

texte: Secret Code Perfumes is a luxury fragrance project created to bring meaning back to scent.

In a world of mass-produced perfumes, Secret Code focuses exclusively on Extrait de Parfum the most concentrated and long-lasting form of fragrance. Each scent is designed as a “code,” unfolding slowly on the skin and revealing depth, emotion, and identity over time.

This project comes from a deep personal passion for fragrance as more than something you wear. Scent holds memory, confidence, and presence. Secret Code is about creating fragrances that feel intentional, powerful, and personal not rushed or diluted.

Funds raised will go directly toward professional formulation, premium raw materials, luxury packaging, and small-batch production. By launching with a focused collection rather than volume, we can ensure quality, craftsmanship, and authenticity from the very beginning.
Secret Code is not about trends. It’s about creating something lasting fragrances you connect with, remember, and come back to.

gone.name: The Duality Set
gone.desc:
The Duality Set brings together two contrasting expressions of Secret Code in a refined extrait format: Code Séduxia and Code Ascend.

Code Séduxia is warm, sensual, and enveloping—crafted to linger on the skin with depth and quiet intensity. Code Ascend is clean, elevated, and luminous—designed to feel effortless, modern, and refined. Together, they represent balance: seduction and clarity, depth and light.

Both fragrances are produced as Extrait de Parfum, offering exceptional concentration, longevity, and smooth evolution over time. Presented in a luxury duo box with a velvet interior, this set is designed for collectors and those who appreciate fragrance as an intentional experience rather than a trend.

The Duality Set is ideal for those who want to explore two distinct moods within the Secret Code universe or gift a complete, high-end fragrance experience.

gone.name: Founder’s Circle — Limited Edition
gone.desc:
The Founder’s Circle is an exclusive reward tier created for early supporters who want to be part of the foundation of Secret Code Perfumes.

This tier includes three full-size Extrait de Parfum bottles (100 ml each), crafted at the highest concentration for depth, longevity, and refined performance. Backers may select any three available scents from the collection, allowing for a personalized and elevated experience.

Founder’s Circle backers also receive a Discovery Sample Set, priority fulfillment from the first production run, and early access to future Secret Code releases. Optional founder recognition is included as a way to honor those who helped bring the brand to life at its earliest stage.

Produced in limited quantities and presented with premium packaging, the Founder’s Circle is designed for collectors and supporters who value craftsmanship, intention, and long-term vision.

project.name: ESPARTINAS: Artisan Espadrilles with Mexican Embroidery
project.description: Born from the love for Spanish and Mexican culture, ESPARTINAS blends the timeless espadrille with luscious Mexican talavera designs.

creator.name: Cristina Díaz
creator.biography:
Hola! I’m Cristina, from La Coruña, Spain.
After years working in fashion e-commerce in Paris, I decided to create something of my own — a project rooted in thoughtful design, tradition, and attention to detail.
These alpargatas are made in Spain using traditional techniques and feature Talavera mexicana–inspired embroidery. This campaign is a very personal step for me, and your support helps turn this idea into reality.
Thank you for being here. �

texte: We founded ESPARTINAS from opposite sides of the globe—Spain and Mexico. Though geographically distant, our countries share a long and intertwined history. Likewise, we share a 12-year friendship built on trust, creative alignment, and a shared respect and curiosity for craftsmanship.

Originally, our idea had been very different. While living in Paris, we dreamed of selling Talavera ceramics — we had always loved Talavera and wanted to bring a piece of home into our everyday life abroad. The real turning point came when Cristina invited me to La Coruña, in the north of Spain. There, I became obsessed with finding a pair of genuine Spanish alpargatas. One afternoon at the beach, sharing a simple cañita, we had an epiphany: what if we created footwear inspired by Talavera and merged both of our cultures into a single product?

We had always wanted to work in fashion since we were young. As a child, I (Jose) used to sneak into my grandmother’s closet and clack around the house in her shoes, convinced they were the most beautiful and magical objects in the world. She would place her older pairs on the lower shelves so I could reach them, protecting her good shoes on the top shelves so I wouldn’t take them jumping into puddles and mud.

I (Cristina), meanwhile, had grown up wearing espadrilles for every occasion and listening to my father speak passionately about exporting Spanish footwear for its beauty and craftsmanship. He began his own export business years ago before sadly passing away in 2020. Six years later, we found the perfect passion project, a way for Jose to honor his grandmother’s encouragement, and for me to honor my father’s legacy.

We first met at the Interlochen Center for the Arts: Cristina as a dancer, and I as a pianist and composer. Our lives took many turns, but creativity always remained at the center. With ESPARTINAS, we finally found a way to channel that shared creative spirit into something tangible — bringing the beauty of our roots into a single, meaningful project.

Our vision is to bring together the essence of both cultures into a single, cohesive product—one that honours the folklore and traditions of Spain and Mexico, and unites them through careful and curated design. Espartinas is the result of this convergence: a product that does not merely reference heritage, but carefully integrates it, creating something beautiful and timeless.
OUR JOURNEY

After months of research, we found a factory in Spain that could bring to life exactly what we had designed and envisioned. After giving the idea some thought and creating our business plan, we put together out first draft in February 2025 and finalized the designs in April 2025.

We sent the first mockups to production in June 2025 and received our first prototypes at the beginning of September. After multiple tests and adjustments, we finally received the finished product in October 2025.

This project has been designed and crafted with so much love and passion. We believe it offers something unique in the market—a dialogue between cultures that breaks boundaries through style. We hope you enjoy them as much as we do! 🦋
WHAT WE ARE OFFERING
ESPARTINAS symbolize the art of living, enjoying life, moving forward, and never giving up. We would love for them to become a part of your story and your everyday moments 💙
WHAT MAKES US DIFFERENT?
TALAVERA COLLECTION & THE ART OF LIVING
MULE TALAVERA AZUL

Refined and enduring, the Mule Talavera Azul is a signature piece from our New Collection Talavera, featuring embroidery inspired by Mexican artisanal designs. Its deep blue tone draws from the traditional pigments historically used in talavera ceramics from Puebla, lending cultural depth and visual richness to the design. Crafted with care in Spain by skilled artisans, it blends heritage with contemporary style in every detail.
The babouche-inspired silhouette transforms it into a versatile sandal that elevates any outfit, while the 3mm cushioned insoles ensure lasting comfort throughout the day.
ALPARGATA TALAVERA CUÑA

Sophistication and elegance in every step. Our Alpargata Talavera Cuñas are designed to bring a sophisticated and versatile touch to any outfit. Made with natural jute, they feature embroidered artisanal details that make them a perfect piece of wearable art for ther summer. Each pair is crafted in Spain by skilled artisans.
They include a natural heel counter, while the blue-colored ribbons allow for a comfortable and stylish fit around the ankle.
Additionally, the cushioned insole ensures a soft and comfortable step, perfect for accompanying you in any occasion with both style and ease.
MULE TALAVERA SNOW WHITE

Sophisticated and timeless. The Mule Talavera Snow White is our final signature piece from the New Collection Talavera, featuring our classic embroidered design in Snow White. Crafted with care in Spain by skilled artisans.

Designed for those who appreciate quiet luxury and prefer more understated, refined footwear, its babouche-inspired silhouette transforms it into a versatile sandal that elevates any outfit. The 3mm cushioned insoles provide maximum comfort for all-day wear, making it both beautiful and practical.
WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT ONCE WE GO LIVE

🦋 February — Kickstarter Launch
🌀 March — Orders Finalized
🦋 April — Production
🌀 Early May — QC & Packaging
🦋 Mid May — Shipping Begins
Note on Shipping

Shipping is not included in your pledge. After the campaign ends, we will contact you via email with instructions to pay for shipping. Only once the shipping payment is received will your reward be processed and shipped. If you choose not to pay for shipping, your pledge will still support ESPARTINAS, but no reward will be delivered. Please see the FAQ for more details.
BE PART OF ESPARTINAS FROM THE START
By joining with a digital reward, a single pair, or the whole collection, you’re helping preserve centuries-old traditions, and giving this craft a future to grow in. 🩵💙

comments.text: Hi, i just supported your campaign now and i have few question regarding it. kindly reply me through my email address because am not really active here on Kickstarter.

project.name: RiffTrax Makes MST3K! — Four NEW episodes in 2026!
project.description: Mike, Kevin, and Bill are heading back to the Satellite of Love for Mystery Science Theater 3000: THE RIFFTRAX EXPERIMENTS!

creator.name: RiffTrax: Mike, Bill & Kevin
creator.biography:
RiffTrax - We Make Movies Funny! We produce comedy tracks for big Hollywood hits and obscure B-movies alike. 

Written and performed by the stars of the award-winning TV series Mystery Science Theater 3000, RiffTrax brings the unique humor of "Satellite of Love" partners Michael J. Nelson, Kevin Murphy and Bill Corbett to movies big and small.  Visit www.RiffTrax.com for more!

texte: Something colossal is happening in the not-too-distant future — Mystery Science Theater 3000: The RiffTrax Experiments! For the past two decades, we’ve been serving up fresh movie riffs as RiffTrax, but in celebration of our 20th anniversary this year, we’re going back to where it all began.

We’re thrilled to announce that for 2026, in partnership with Shout! Studios, we will be making FOUR brand-new episodes of Mystery Science Theater 3000! Mike Nelson is returning as host, alongside Kevin Murphy and Bill Corbett as his robot friends Tom Servo and Crow T. Robot. And Mary Jo Pehl will be reprising her role of Pearl Forrester!

The entire production will take place this spring/summer in Minnesota with Mike, Kevin, and Bill as creative leads. We'll be building all-new, hand-crafted sets and props. And the hilarious MST3K host segments WILL, of course, be back! We plan to release all four episodes by the end of 2026.

Your pledge will go directly towards designing and building these sets and props, licensing the movies, editing and post, sprucing up the 'bots, and paying our excellent crew. Pledging is an opportunity to help us with production of MST3K: The RiffTrax Experiments and to pre-order these new episodes along with loads of other cool rewards. Plus, it will get you access to exclusive updates we’ll only be providing here on Kickstarter, like backstage pics from the set, peeks inside the production process, glimpses at Tom Servo’s dressing room rider demands, and more!
While there won’t be a traditional RiffTrax Live event this year, we ARE planning to have a Fathom Event to premiere Episode 1 in theaters nationwide! Stay tuned for details.

We’ll have more to share in the days to come. So check out all the pledge levels and great rewards! This is our 13th Kickstarter Campaign at RiffTrax, and we think it’s our most exciting yet. Join us, won’t you?

The guys at RiffTrax.com - Mike Nelson, Kevin Murphy, and Bill Corbett - have been providing hilarious movie commentary for years - first as writers and stars of the cult TV comedy show MYSTERY SCIENCE THEATER 3000, which aired from 1988-1999, and then online since 2006 as RIFFTRAX. In 2012, RiffTrax became an independent, artist-owned company.

The riffers have taken on movies both classic and not-so-classic: from our top seller TWILIGHT to every STAR WARS movie, as well as cinematic misfires like BIRDEMIC and SAMURAI COP — with one mission: to make them funny!

RiffTrax has created comedic riffs for over 1,000 movies and shorts that range from major Hollywood blockbusters, to obscure B-movies and goofy educational short films. We've even been on TV on the National Geographic Channel, riffing zany animal shows. You can enjoy these on RiffTrax.com as well as Pluto TV, Twitch, Amazon, YouTube, Tubi, Samsung TV Plus, and more!
We’ve even done 36 RiffTrax Live shows simulcast to movie theaters nationwide via our partner Fathom Entertainment — including our MST3K Reunion Show in 2016!

And that's not all: we have an amazing RiffTrax Sync app that AUTOMATICALLY syncs our jokes to the biggest blockbuster movies like HARRY POTTER, and LORD OF THE RINGS. Our "Friends” subscription service includes hundreds of movies and shorts for you to enjoy on the web or your Roku, FireTV, and mobile Android and iOS devices! And we recently launched the "Best Friends" subscription level which includes even more content, a 24/7 live TV feed, Discord server access, site discounts and more!

Video game fans rejoice! RiffTrax also made a movie-riffing game for 3-6 players that lets you be part of the comedy magic. You can play as a group in the same room OR play with your best Internet penpals with remote play. It's even platform cross-play compatible!
Thank you for reading this far, and we hope you'll make a pledge. Hi-Keeba!

Shout! Studios, a Radial Entertainment company, specializes in film and TV distribution, development, and production. Shout! has distributed Mystery Science Theater 3000 since 2008 and in 2015 partnered with creator Joel Hodgson’s Alternaversal to purchase the show.

The partnership spearheaded a variety of successful MST3K initiatives, including a revival of the series with three critically acclaimed seasons, two of which debuted on Netflix, two record-breaking crowdfunding campaigns, several national live tours, and the popular MST3K FAST channel. Radial recently completed the purchase of MST3K from Alternaversal, with a long-term growth strategy for MST3K including new content development, merchandise licensing, and content syndication to international territories.

comments.text: I think the question on everyone's mind about these episodes didn't get addressed in the hangout chat earlier.    It goes to the nature of the episodes you guys are planning on making.  Simply put and without dragging things out:

This will be so much fun! Thank you all for your hard work in the days ahead. I am sure you have the films picked out but I have a few titles. The Green Slime would be a nice throw back to the beginning of things. Any Quatermass film would be fun. No matter what it will be a blast. Thank you all!!!!!
I hope you have another Live Chat in the weeks to come. I waited to you were airing to ask questions. Next time if there is one I'll posts those in advance. It was very good. Thanks.
The live chat was great, thanks!

replies.text: I’ve been wondering this same thing! Always wanted to take a tour back in the old days—back when they were offered, but alas, I was a teenager and my folks weren’t about to drive me to Minneapolis to visit the puppet show set! 🤣

comments.text: So excited to see the "Mads" are returning and "Deathsport" is getting the treatment! What an amazing time to be alive...mostly.
I unironically enjoy "Cabin Boy" and would love to see that one get the MST3K treatment...

I know you've already picked all the films for this, but I stumbled across a made-for-TV film recently that I'd love to see RiffTrax do - "Baffled!" (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0068248/) starring Leonard Nimoy.

replies.text: Mary Jo Pehl watched this for a recent Movie Jo Night for her show on Dumb Industries. You can get a free one month membership and check it out.

comments.text: *cough cough* The Valley of Gwangi *cough*

Man, I didnt realize how excited I'd be until this became real. I've fallen asleep to the ending credits song more time then I can remember, and throughout my life, since I was a kid and dint even understand most the riffs, I have always been excited when the intro song came one. Thanks for making me feel like a kid again! Can't wait!

Also approve the OG Mads will return and try to take what what's theirs. About time Clay tried to stand up to Mom. If he does, she would finally be proud of him...just before she tries to kill him of course. Bobo and Observer might wind up inheriting the whole thing. Whether they want it is another matter
I don't think I've ever in my life sat down and watched an entire Clint Eastwood movie.  But, I find myself wishing the guys would pick one for one of their experiments

replies.text: John Sturges directed the equally glacial Ice Station Zebra (1968) the year before. Rock Hudson, Ernest Borgnine, Patrick McGoohan, Jim Brown. Zebra and Marooned (1969) are aged cheese and both hard to watch to the uninitiated. I and my friends really love Space Cowboys (2000) and I don't see the inert so bad it's good quality about it. To be on MST, it has to sink without the riffing. I always found Space Cowboys worked myself. "To each their own..." Thanks.
Ooh, Ice Station Zebra would be a good one, for sure.
Yeah. Ice Station Zebra (1968) is ideal. Though it's 2 hours and 28 minutes. You'd have to edit half the movie for it to fit. Or lengthen the format for it to fit.

comments.text: I’m so happy the Mads are back! I usually keep quiet and leave the creativity to creative people, but…please oh please oh please oh please have Trace & Bill be dueling Crows & please have Mary Jo be Pearl - but in full Dr. Clayton Forrester’s mom mode - “Clayton!”!

replies.text: That's my favorite version of Pearl!  Not the lead Mad (because was never a scientist herself) but the overbearing mother to a hen-pecked Clayton and the best friend to TV's Frank...

comments.text: It’s been a rough week and then I see… the mads are back?! This is enough to make my entire day.  So, so happy.
Just when I thought I couldn't be more excited you go and add Frank and Trace to the roster!
I'm so excited for this and so happy to see that the Mads are going to join for an episode which is simply amazing.

replies.text: They've made it clear that they're sticking with four this year no matter what.  They still have to cover Kickstarter's fee and the rewards with what they earn, and these episodes are in addition to their workload with Rifftrax.  Personally, I'd much rather see four really great episodes than have them spread themselves too thin.

comments.text: Absolutely jazzed that Trace & Frank are on board! Couldn't have asked for a better addition!
I’m so excited for Mike, Bill and Kevin to return to MST3K. This was my favorite cast.
I'm extremely pleased that Frank and Trace on board! So happy for this new season!
So far this kickstarter is shaping up to be more exciting than the previous iterations of the new MST3K! I’m so happy to see the old timers return!

project.name: Small Town Monsters 2026: UFOs, Dogman, and Bigfoot
project.description: 2026 will see the crew making new films AND episodic series. Join the adventure and see it first!

creator.name: Small Town Monsters
creator.biography: Small Town Monsters began as an independent film series exploring lost and bizarre history across North America. Focusing on cryptozoology, folklore and the paranormal, our team tells stories through the words and experiences of those who were most affected by them - residents and witnesses.

options.name: Werewolf: The Dogman Legacy: Aaron Deese
options.desc:
Reserve a copy of the next book in by Aaron Deese in his Dogman trilogy .
Aaron Deese’s third foray into the Dogman phenomenon attempts to take in the whole scope of these ongoing sightings. From the early tales of werewolves spread across the world to the modern encounters with upright canines, Werewolf: The Dogman Legacy will ask where the werewolf stories end and the Dogman sightings begin, following the upright canine’s trail throughout human history to its modern end in the cryptozoological lexicon.

options.name: Sasquatch: Variable By Aaron Deese
options.desc:
Reserve a copy of Aaron's new bigfoot book!

What is the Sasquatch Variable? From Aaron Deese, Sasquatch: Variable attempts to examine the disparate parts of the “Sasquatch Encounter Phenomenon”, asking simply what it is about Bigfoot that has prevented human beings from “finding” it, and what the future may have in store for the research community as technology and conversations continue to develop. Featuring interviews with members of Project Zoobook, The Olympic Project, Wild and Weird West Virginia, Micah Hanks and many others, Sasquatch: Variable will examine both the phenomenon itself, and the varied perspectives of those involved in the ongoing search for Bigfoot.

Reserve a copy of Aaron's new bigfoot book!

What is the Sasquatch Variable? From Aaron Deese, Sasquatch: Variable attempts to examine the disparate parts of the “Sasquatch Encounter Phenomenon”, asking simply what it is about Bigfoot that has prevented human beings from “finding” it, and what the future may have in store for the research community as technology and conversations continue to develop. Featuring interviews with members of Project Zoobook, The Olympic Project, Wild and Weird West Virginia, Micah Hanks and many others, Sasquatch: Variable will examine both the phenomenon itself, and the varied perspectives of those involved in the ongoing search for Bigfoot.

project.name: Returning to Pachamama
project.description: A one-woman motorcycle journey through ancient Mesoamerica exploring archaeology, myth, and the deep truth that nothing is separate.

creator.name: Abigail Maley
creator.biography: I am a writer, archaeologist and storyteller. I use mixed media, artistic narrative, genuine presence and humor to connect us to our shared roots and each other. I’ve led and worked on projects in Columbia, Peru, Oman, Greece, Ecuador, Germany, Italy and across the United States. My upcoming project will take me to Belem, Brazil and into the Amazon. I am a native New Yorker and love surfing, jiu-jitsu, Mongolian-style horseback archery and slam poetry.

texte: My name is Abigail Rose. I’m 25 years old, and I’m preparing for a six-month solo motorcycle expedition through Central and South America to create a film.

The journey begins in the Mayan lands of Yucatán, Mexico, and winds through Central America, across the Andes, and deep into the Amazon, ending in Brazil. Along the way, I’ll travel from archaeological sites to significant ruins, following ancient roads and living traditions, to explore how myth, land, and story have always connected us.

I’m a studying archaeologist, writer, and longtime solo traveler. But to be honest, this project isn’t driven by academic ambition alone. The logistics are intimidating: earning my motorcycle license, buying a bike, crossing borders, navigating jungles and mountains with limited experience. I have mentors. I have encouragement. Still, I had to ask myself what could possibly fuel such boldness.

At first, I told myself this burning desire to take to the roads of Central and South America was in the name of archaeology. That’s true, partially. I study archaeology. I love it. But archaeology alone doesn’t quiet the fear, or override the warnings, or explain the certainty that keeps pushing me forward. What I am really searching for is something that’s lit me up since I was a child, something that sent me racing across the Middle East in a battered rental car toward a city of djinn, that landed me as an untrained deckhand on a Spanish catamaran through the Corinth Canal, that pulled me to the pyramids of coastal Peru and the jungles of Ecuador.
I was looking for magic.

Not magic as illusion or parlor tricks, but magic as a relationship. Oxford archaeologist Chris Gosden defines it this way: “Magic emphasizes human connections with the universe, so that people are open to the workings of the universe and the universe is responsive to us.” Alongside science and religion, magic was one of humanity’s earliest ways of understanding the world. It sees spirit in the land, kinship between humans and animals, and meaning in transformation. Where science separates us from the world, magic immerses us within it, asking moral questions about how we relate to the universe itself.

This worldview was central to ancient civilizations and indigenous cultures across Mesoamerica and South America.

 The Maya were master timekeepers, aligned with cosmic cycles.
The Aztecs built advanced cities grounded in ritual and warfare.
The Chimú conquered the Pacific on some of the earliest surfboards, guided by their moon god, Si.
Across cultures and continents, these societies understood something we’ve largely forgotten: humans, land, myth, and spirit are not separate.

This film follows my solo motorcycle journey through these ancient landscapes. Traveling by road, exploring archaeology, mythology, and the living cultures that still carry these stories today. I’ll be standing face-to-face with places I once knew only from textbooks, where history isn’t locked behind museum glass but embedded in the earth itself.

Traveling alone by motorcycle allows for full immersion and slow, intentional travel filled with conversations with locals, scholars, and fellow travelers; oral histories passed down outside of academia; and a raw, embodied relationship with the land. Through first-person storytelling and immersive cinematography, this project explores how ancient knowledge continues to shape our understanding of humanity, and how we might rebuild a relationship with the collective spirit of the Earth.

This is not a traditional travel vlog, and it’s not a detached academic documentary. It’s a personal journey- reflective, authenic, and deeply human- where the road and landscape is my classroom. My goal is to make archaeology and anthropology accessible, alive, and even humorous, inviting curiosity rather than gatekeeping knowledge.
Along the way, I’ll document:
Ancient sites and their mythological significance
Oral histories and living traditions
The emotional and physical realities of solo travel
The ways land, identity, and story intertwine
Echoes of prehistoric myth that still shape modern life
At its heart, this project is about remembering connection in a world of separation, between people and place, past and present, science and magic.

I don’t claim to be all knowing. I'm no hero, no expert. I’m just a student, a messenger, following old stories across old roads. If this work sparks wonder, curiosity, or a sense of belonging to something older and larger than ourselves, then it’s done its job.
Because every culture across time has told us the same thing:

We are not separate from the Earth.
And we have never been alone.

project.name: One More, Please
project.description: A quick teaser of what "One More, Please" entails and details of our project plans.

creator.name: Nadia
creator.biography: Student filmmaker and videographer.

texte: One More Please, is a British social realism film that follows Kyle, a high functioning alcoholic who muddled his way through the day, trying to get into contact with his sister. Their relationship is strained as they haven’t spoken in years. He has a constant battle with his addiction and things become significantly more difficult when he's triggered by memories of him and his sister as children. The siblings face a heart to heart as they reunite in an awkward way- shes an escort. Their argument reveals past traumas and the ins and outs of their behaviour towards each other. This information is a big shock to Kyle. He finally asks for help from his sister to  overcome his addiction.
THIS IS A STUDENT FILM- your support goes directly towards transport, locations, food and basic production costs.

As the director and screenwriter, I whole heartedly believe that everyone is addicted to something in life, whether it be something physical like a person, drugs or alcohol or something psychological like your self image, gaming, social media, relationships or life style habits. It's important to me to be able to explore the desires and need for addiction and the tolls it takes on those around you.

Everyone involved in the project has experienced some sort of addiction or hyper fixation or has been involved with alcoholics. We aim to portray the most realistic depiction of a high functioning alcoholic. We have spoken to recovering alcoholics and incorporated their experiences within the film.

project.name: Biographical ShortFilm
project.description: The Godgrandpa

creator.name: The Godgrandpa
creator.biography: We are a team of film production students at Capilano University.

texte: The GodGrandpa is a drama inspired by the life of a real grandfather in 1980s Chinatown, Thailand, translated through the visual and emotional language of Hong Kong cinema of the same era. During that time, survival was not about chasing dreams, but about enduring hardship. With limited choices, my grandfather entered the underground casino world simply to keep his family alive. That lived experience became the foundation of this film.

This story also explores the Chinese mindset of being “The Man” during that era. Men were expected to carry everything alone, money, pride, responsibility, and danger without complaint. Providing was love. Silence was strength. Mun, the lead character, represents a generation shaped by these expectations, where protecting the family meant sacrificing oneself, even at the cost of health, dignity, and relationships.

Visually, the film honors the look, texture, and rhythm of 1980s Hong Kong cinema. It is cinematic yet raw, blending the grit of underground life with intimate, restrained emotion. Through this style, I want the audience to feel the weight of that time and the quiet strength of a generation that carried everything in silence.
This film tells the truth of a universal experience. The GodGrandpa is our way of honoring these family members—in this case, a man who fought his entire life so that his family could survive.
All cast and crew on this project are volunteers, with the entire team made up of film production students working under the university’s supervision and mentorship for this project.

All donations will go toward catering, art, location rentals, and festival submissions. Because the film involves complex locations, one of which is a restaurant and a large cast, crew and background performers who require meals. We are currently short on budget to cover these essential costs.
FEEL FREE TO REACH OUT!
thegodgrandpafilm@gmail.com
Instagram: @thegodgrandpafilm

project.name: Tally Light Broadcast - Video Drama
project.description: Tally Light … imagine The Dick Van Dyke Show’s writers room, shove Frasier's booth in and surrounded by the craziness of The Office.

creator.name: Caleb Fisher
creator.biography:
Caleb enjoyed his school years being homeschooled and feels the experience allowed him to learn at his own pace and use alternative methods of learning, while following his many interests.

He is the creator, producer and co-host of YouTube channel Good Morning Fellow Foodies with his brother Seth. He's a voice actor, playing parts in multiple episodes of Project Audion, and is also an assistant with his brothers farm business Mini Acre Farm.

An avid reader, Caleb enjoys words and investigating alternate ways to make communication more effective and distinct. He is currently working on several novels and articles for future publication.

texte: Imagine a universe where the writers room of The Dick Van Dyke Show all the sudden had Frasier's booth in the office surrounded by the craziness of The Office. That's a glimpse of Tally Light Broadcast. With no AI. All real voices, all real music, ALL ARTISTS!
Here is a link to our YouTube video proof-of-concept pilot episode. Hope you enjoy!

We're creating an audio drama with top notch talent from original music score, to brilliant voice actors, using vintage production methods of live performance with the modern technology of Zoom, with an international cast!
Our story takes place around a dilapidated and ill-used radio station and it's wacky inhabitants:
Carlton - The one with big plans, who won't quit.

Oscar - A grumpy owner no one will miss.

Kip - A pessimistic producer who runs on sarcasm, caffeine and no sleep. 

Shorty Gutierrez - A millionaire benefactor with big plans, some maybe too big. 

Ronnie - The Uncle, a donut shop owner, with heaps of tough love and teetering support.

Terbell - The new meteorologist with no DJ experience, who just lost a parent.
&
Marg - The spunky, adventurous new manager on a mission to prove her ex-boss wrong.
All stranded in a radio station...by choice!!!
OUR CAST INCLUDES:
And Special Appearances by:
Featured musical artists including:
Our first goal is to fund the first 2 episodes. The first episode is going to be redone, even better sound effects and development and filming of episode 2.
Here's a breakdown of our goals!
If we exceed our top goal of $5000 then actors will be paid more standardized pay. We'll be able to submit to more festivals and quality will increase even more!

project.name: Our Prodigal Sons & Daughters
project.description: Bridging the generational divide to save family businesses and find purpose. A legacy crisis meets a path to redemption.

creator.name: Kelvin Carter
creator.biography: Kelvin Carter is the mind and producer behind the reality TV show Our Prodigal Sons & Daughters.  He's also the Integrator at Data Framework Sciences and a partner at Carter Capital Holding Company, where he uses his business smarts to tackle big economic problems.  His show takes on the "gray tsunami" crisis, helping families connect their heritage with today's goals, mixing heartfelt stories with practical advice for small business handovers.

texte: Here's a 12-Act Scene Outline for "The Empty Counter":
ACT 1: THE DINER AT DAWN
The Double Eagle Diner, 1978. Frank and Marie, in their 70s, move through their silent, empty restaurant in a slow, tired routine. Frank stares at a wall of faded family photos.
ACT 2: THE CONFESSIONAL - FRANK
Direct-to-camera. Frank’s voice breaks. “We built this for them. But the kids… they have their own lives. If they don’t come home, we lose everything. Not just the business. The legacy.”
ACT 3: THE CAVALRY ARRIVES
A sleek SUV pulls into the empty lot. The HOST (Robert) and his three daughters—SOPHIE (Psychology), CHLOE (Art), and AVA (Real Estate)—exit, surveying the diner with professional detachment.
ACT 4: THE AUDIT BEGINS
The team fans out. AVA tours the property, taking notes on her tablet. SOPHIE sits with Frank and Marie, unpacking years of unspoken resentment. CHLOE sketches, reimagining the dated decor.
ACT 5: THE BRUTAL TRUTH
Robert pulls out a spreadsheet. "The land's worth a lot. The business is broke." A silent tear rolls down Marie's cheek. The "For Sale" sign is leaning against the wall in the back office.
ACT 6: THE HUNT - THE PRODIGALS

We meet the kids. LEO, a cynical corporate manager in a sterile high-rise. ELLIE, a freelance graphic designer struggling in a cramped apartment. Both are unhappy, lost, and fiercely protective of their "freedom."
ACT 7: THE BRIDGE - CHLOE & SOPHIE’S GAMBIT

Chloe and Sophie meet Ellie at a park. They don’t mention the diner. Chloe shows her rebranding sketches for a fictional “heritage diner,” incorporating Ellie’s own art style. Ellie’s eyes light up for the first time.
ACT 8: THE PROVOCATION - THE TECH SAVANT

The team’s tech expert, JAX, arrives. He holds up the diner’s rotary phone and paper ticket system. “This isn’t nostalgia. It’s a museum. Your customers left for apps years ago.” Frank is insulted. Leo, watching via a video call, is intrigued.
ACT 9: THE FAMILY MEETING - THE TWO FOLDERS

The whole family gets together at the diner after closing. Robert puts two folders on the Formica counter. FOLDER A: A modern succession plan with Ellie's branding and a digital makeover. FOLDER B: A finalized sales contract and retirement brochures for Florida.
ACT 10: THE SILENCE & THE REACH
A long minute goes by. Leo looks from his dad's worn hands to Ellie's hopeful face, to the sleek plans. He doesn't say anything. He just reaches out and pulls Folder A toward him.
ACT 11: MONTAGE - THE REBUILD

90 days later. A quick, uplifting montage: Ellie painting the new logo, Leo programming a new POS system, Frank teaching Leo the secret burger technique, Marie showing Ellie the books. The diner changes, mixing its soul with a new vision.
ACT 12: THE SUNSET KEY

It's the grand re-opening night, and the diner is packed. Leo's running the show, Ellie's hosting, and Frank and Marie are just watching from the door. Robert hands Frank the key, and Frank just puts it in Leo's hand. No goodbyes, just "Open at 6 AM," Frank says. Then they walk out, hand-in-hand, into the sunset, leaving the lights on behind them.
FINAL SHOT: The new neon sign, an eagle Ellie designed, is glowing bright and steady against the night. Not a flicker.

A new threat emerges from the shadows—feral, relentless, and more dangerous than anything the slayer has faced before. Known only as the Hounds of Hell, these supernatural predators are being unleashed to track, corner, and destroy.

As the lines between hunter and prey begin to blur, the slayer must confront a rising evil that threatens not just her life, but the fate of everyone caught in the growing war between the living and the undead.
Vampire Slayer II – The Hounds of Hell continues a supernatural saga that already spans two books and the first indie horror film.

The original Vampire Slayer is now streaming on Tubi, Prime, and YouTube, introducing audiences to a dark world of hunters, vampires, and ancient evil. With two published novels expanding the lore, the sequel brings the next chapter of this growing universe to the screen.

project.name: Ace Was Never Supposed to Exist
project.description: A Series That Wasn’t Supposed to Happen.

curatedCollection.name: Des courts qui en disent long

creator.name: Acceion
creator.biography: I am a storyteller who believes the best comedy comes from bad decisions and uncomfortable silence. I lead the writing and creative direction of the series, working with animators to transform real-life chaos into animated stories people can laugh at instead of reliving.

texte: Hi, I’m Ace,

I’m the creator and writer behind AcceionVerse. I come up with the stories, characters, jokes, and chaos, and I work with talented animators and voice actors who bring those ideas to life. This Kickstarter exists so we can turn one of those ideas into a fully produced animated episode.
🌀 What Is This Project?

This project funds the production of a standalone animated episode set in the Ace universe a character-driven, internet-born story inspired by real-life situations, awkward relationships, and the kind of moments that feel funny until they hit a little too close to home.
If you’ve seen my short, animated clips online, this is the next step:
A longer, complete story
Higher-quality animation
Fully voiced characters
A polished, finished episode

I handle the concept, writing, and creative direction.
The animation is brought to life by experienced animators working directly with me.
🎭 Why This Exists
Animation is one of the hardest mediums to fund independently.
I can create ideas all day, but animation takes time, skill, and money. This Kickstarter allows me to:
Collaborate with animators properly
Pay artists fairly for their work
Finish the episode without cutting corners

This isn’t a studio production.
It’s a small, focused team turning one strong idea into something real.
🛠️ Where Your Support Goes
The funding goal is $3,000, and every dollar raised goes directly into making the episode:

🎨 Animation & visual polish — $2,000
Character animation, scene transitions, revisions, and final renders.

🎧 Voice acting & sound design — $500
Paying voice actors, recording sessions, and audio cleanup.

🎼 Music & audio mixing — $300
Background music, sound balancing, and final mix.

📣 Promotion & marketing — $150
Helping the finished episode reach an audience once it’s released.

🧩 Platform & processing fees — $50
Kickstarter and payment processing costs to keep the production budget intact.
Total: $3,000
This campaign is about funding the work not pitching a concept that may never happen.
⏱️ Why Kickstarter?
This episode doesn’t exist without support.
Instead of waiting for permission from studios or algorithms, Kickstarter lets the audience decide if this story deserves to be made.
If we reach the goal:
The episode gets fully produced
It gets released publicly
The Ace universe officially expands
No gatekeepers. Just creators and supporters.
🎁 What Backers Get
Backing this project means becoming part of the episode’s history.
Depending on your tier, you may receive:
Your name in the episode credits
Early access to the finished animation
Behind-the-scenes updates and artwork
A permanent place in the first official Ace episode
This episode will always exist because of the people who backed it.
🚀 Final Word
This project starts with an idea and becomes real through collaboration.

If you believe in independent animation,
If you want to support artists directly,
And if you want to help turn a concept into a finished episode,
This is how it happens!
AcceionVerse

TikTok:(1)AcceionVerse (@acceionverse3) | TikTok

project.name: Lovers' Afterlife: Animated Short Film
project.description: A ghostly husband must prepare the perfect outfit for the long-awaited reunion with his recently departed wife.

curatedCollection.name: Des courts qui en disent long

creator.name: Elizabeth Ingrassia
creator.biography: Hello! My name is Elizabeth Ingrassia (she/her) and I'm a Senior Computer Animation student at Ringling College of Art and Design! Primarily a 3D model, light, and texture artist, I love getting my hands into every part of the 3D pipeline.

texte: Lovers' Afterlife is a 2 minute 3D animated short film directed and created by Elizabeth Ingrassia.

With pre-production beginning in January 2025, Lovers' Afterlife has been in production for a few months with an estimated completion date of May 2026. This thesis film represents the culmination of my schooling at Ringling College of Art and Design and aims to showcase all the skills I have collected in the past 4 years, from storyboarding to animation!

Lovers' Afterlife follows the story of 2 lovers separated by death. After waiting in purgatory for years, the Husband hears news of his wifes passing. It's been years since they've seen each other so he needs to find the perfect outfit to make the best "first" impression. Surrounded by memories of their past, what will he choose to compliment his new ghostly form?
The quintessential main character of Lovers' Afterlife, the Husband long awaits his wife's eventual return to his arms.
Recently deceased, the Wife isn't sure what may be on the other side for her.

An attic carries a lifetime span of memories forgotten. From childhood toys, old hobbies, and boxes of outgrown clothes, the attic is the perfect set for two lovers to reunite amongst shared memories.

Lovers' Afterlife stems from the idea of loves power and shared history. Through aspects like color and lighting, the film aims to heighten the emotional intensity the main characters are feeling once they reunite with each other. The entire production of the film will be completed early May 2026 and will be available to the public within a year!

Since Lovers' Afterlife is a solo student film project, it comes with some needed resources that can't be provided by only myself.  All donations go towards the betterment of the film and post production outreach!
Composer/Music Licensing: $500
Film Festival Submissions: $500
Kickstarter + Reward Fees: $500
Your support is extremely appreciated! Each donation tier contains donation rewards that will be shipped out around December 2026!
(If donating to a higher tier, you will receive all of the rewards for the previous tiers!)
Thanks to support from people like you, I'm able to make Lovers' Afterlife the best it can be! To keep up with the films production, you can follow @Lovers.Afterlife.Film on Instagram!
For more of my work:
Instagram: @Lizzanya__
Portfolio: https://ingrassiaelizabeth.wixsite.com/elizabethingrassia

project.name: Flour, Butter, Europe. A modern European cookbook
project.description: A Gorgeous Collection of European Baking from Everyday Breads to Elegant Cakes

creator.name: Iana
creator.biography:
I am Yana, a passionate baker and food photographer from Warsaw, Poland.
Everything related to cooking, hospitality, and entertaining guests always inspires me. I love experimenting with food, flavors, and textures.

titre: Flour, Butter, Europe. A modern European baking cookbook
What kind of dough will we be working with:
texte: I'm creating a book that brings European café baking into your home: the pastries you see in windows from Warsaw to Vienna, made simple enough for your kitchen.

Imagine Sunday morning, your kitchen warm with the smell of fresh dough. A stunning tart on your summer table. A celebration cake everyone thinks came from a café. These aren't professional recipes—they're the everyday bakes that fill small European cafés, and I'm here to show you how to make them yours.

Flour, Butter, Europe is a modern cookbook for classic European baking. Fifty recipes— from Bavarian pretzels to Hungarian tortes and Polish cheesecakes—each one designed to work in your kitchen. And every single photo in this book is taken by me.
Flour, Butter, Europe is an 11 × 8.5 inch hardcover with approximately 130 pages featuring approximately 50 recipes.
E-book Edition — portable, accessible, and perfect if you want all the recipes on your device.
Hardcover Edition — premium hardcover printed on high-quality paper with full-color photography throughout. Includes e-book edition.
Signed Copy (Limited) — for collectors who want a personal touch.
Signed Copy (Limited) with an artisan-made gift.
If this book calls to you and we reach our goal, I can't wait to share the timeline with you:

Book finalized: March-April 2026
Printing begins: April-May 2026
Estimated delivery: April-May 2026
Wouldn't it be great if there were so many of us who love to bake European pastries that we could achieve:🎯 PLN 5,500

Every backer receives a beautifully designed digital guide (printable PDF format) that decodes European flour types. Learn which flour to use for which recipe, and how to substitute with American flours when needed.
The next bonus for achievement:🎯 PLN 7,500

Every backer gets a surprise bonus: 12 additional recipes for European desserts with a secret—vegetables transformed into elegant sweets. From spinach to caramelized onion to celery, these veggie push the boundaries of what dessert can be. Your guests will never guess the secret ingredient.

Producing a high-quality hardcover cookbook with premium paper and full-color printing is expensive. Independent publishing means there are no big publishers covering the costs — it’s just me and you, the backers who want to see this book become reality.

By backing this project, you’re helping fund the design, recipe development, cooking, photography, and printing of Flour, Butter, Europe. Together, we can make a book that looks and feels special — one that wouldn’t exist without your support.
