project.name: Taste 100 Years of Yamagata Ramen Tradition in Your Own Home
project.description: Enjoy authentic soy sauce ramen from a century-old restaurant, now available as premium dried noodles made with local craftsmanship.

creator.name: Saraya Shokudo
creator.biography: Saraya Shokudo, located in Sagae City, Yamagata Prefecture, is a long-established restaurant founded in 1924. While originally a soba shop, its signature menu item is Chinese-style noodles. The founder’s vision was to make the restaurant a community hub and to support local workers. Today, the restaurant continues to serve the local community while also operating an online shop, soba-making classes, and a kitchen studio.

titre: Eat ramen from a 101-year-old, long-standing, popular restaurant in your own home!
Experience a Restaurant Quality Taste Delight in Just 3 Minutes!
Yamagata Prefecture's Local Specialty: Chilled Ramen
Perfect as a gift for a friend!
Regarding Serving Sizes and Reward Selection
texte: A beloved ramen from Yamagata, cherished by locals for many years, is now available in dried noodle form and ready to be enjoyed at your own table.

There are two reasons we launched this project on Kickstarter.
The first is to share this unique local culture with the world and to show that even from a regional community, it is possible to reach a global audience, inspiring hope and courage in others.
The second is to reintroduce our products to Japan as “world-recognized items,” opening new overseas markets and shining a new light on our hometown.
For our backers, we have prepared special Kickstarter-exclusive sets and experience-based rewards. This project is not simply about selling products, it is about creating a lasting initiative that contributes to the continued revitalization of our region.

The rich flavor perfected over many years is found in every morsel, from the soup to the noodles and the aroma.
The broth is deep and full-bodied, while the homemade noodles have a pleasantly chewy texture that hardly seems like dried noodles.
Even in the midst of a busy day, this bowl offers a nostalgic and comforting taste that gently soothes the heart.

By just having a pack of these noodles, you can experience authentic noodles easily in your own home. Perfect as just a light snack, or if you feel cooking is a pain after a long day at the office, you can cook up some popular Japanese ramen and discover a taste sensation!

Until now, we used the soy sauce specified by the manufacturer, but to allow everyone around the world to enjoy our flavor exactly as it is in our shop, we have switched to the soy sauce we actually use in our restaurant. This change ensures that you can experience the authentic taste of our ramen no matter where you are.

The soup is a unique fusion of beef, bonito flakes, kelp, shiitake mushrooms, and two types of soy sauce, all mixed together to create a truly special flavor. Each ingredient’s natural umami is carefully drawn out, creating a rich and layered flavor. This bowl delivers a satisfying depth that keeps you enjoying every last sip. Please savor this carefully crafted bowl, made with our utmost dedication.

Each serving of soup contains just 5 grams of fat, roughly one-third the fat of a popular tonkotsu ramen shop that creates its own packs that you can take home as souvenirs. Despite the lower fat, it delivers rich flavor and satisfying umami. This makes it an ideal bowl for those who want a delicious ramen while keeping health in mind. It is gentle on the stomach, perfect for those sensitive to richness, and can be enjoyed as a late-night meal without guilt.

Katsuobushi loses its aroma in just about 10 minutes after being shaved. Because we are a soba restaurant, we have the expertise to bring out its full natural fragrance and umami. In making soba broth, we use a unique method of simmering over high heat to extract every bit of flavor from the ingredients. This technique is also applied to our ramen, successfully drawing out the soup’s full depth of umami. Adding soy sauce further enhances the taste, giving the broth richness and sharpness for a more satisfying bowl.
Comparing the noodles to other types of noodles

Among the many types of ramen, shoyu, known in English as soy sauce, ramen stands out for striking the perfect balance between flavor and health.
Each serving contains only 72 kcal and 5g of fat, making it a lighter option without sacrificing richness or depth of taste. Despite its clean, refreshing profile, it delivers a satisfying umami that lingers with every bite.

Furthermore, with 3.2 g of protein, it offers both nourishment and fullness. At 6.1 g of salt content, it has a lower salt content than that of miso or tonkotsu ramen, making it easier to enjoy as part of your daily meals without guilt.
This is a bowl that embodies gentle comfort — light yet flavorful, simple yet deeply satisfying. Experience the pure, refined taste of soy sauce ramen, crafted to please both body and soul.
A light yet deeply flavorful soy sauce ramen. It is gentle on the body while still offering a satisfying, full taste, so please try it for yourself!

The noodles that are included in this set are the same that we use at our restaurant which uses the same ingredients and is made by the same artisans. 
The wheat is carefully selected to match the texture of the fresh noodles, allowing you to enjoy an authentic experience at home that is indistinguishable from dining in.

Furthermore, the production of these dried noodles involves the same artisans who make the fresh noodles, meaning that they are well-versed in balancing the noodles with the soup for optimal texture and flavor. As a result, even as dried noodles, they achieve a seamless harmony with the soup, recreating the same quality as the ramen served in our restaurant.

The story begins in the Taisho era, where, surrounded by the pristine waters of the Sagae River, fed by the melting snow of Mount Gassan, and rich natural surroundings, the third-generation Saraya Tarobe started making udon.

The techniques this third-generation owner developed for udon and later for hiyamugi, which are thin wheat noodles, were passed down to the fourth-generation Saraya Tarobe in the Showa era. Determined to capture the authentic taste of Japanese soba in dried noodles, this fourth-generation Saraya Tarobe conducted extensive research and in 1960 launched the Tarobe Soba line.

Today, the fifth-generation Saraya Tarobe continues the legacy of his predecessors. For over 100 years, spanning the 65 years since the Tarobe Soba’s launch, the family has devoted itself entirely to perfecting noodles. Driven by the desire to see smiles from those enjoying their noodles, they continue to dedicate themselves to producing dried noodles that bring joy to customers every day.
The Base Ingredients
High-absorption medium-strong wheat flour is used to create noodles with firm texture and a pleasant, smooth mouthfeel.
Mixing

Flour is kneaded into dough to maximize flavor. 
The amount of water added is adjusted according to the conditions of the day. 
Even for the same product, variations in weather, temperature, humidity, and ingredient quality can affect the dough. 
Skilled artisans use their decades of experience and intuition to ensure the dough is always of the highest quality.
Sheeting

The kneaded dough is passed multiple times through rolling machines to strengthen the texture while thinning it out. The dough is cut to the precise thickness while anticipating how it will change during drying.
Drying

The finished noodles are then dried, trapping the flavor in the noodle.
Low-temperature drying over two days preserves texture and aroma. Artisans monitor temperature and humidity closely to ensure drying is neither too fast nor too slow.
Cutting

The dried noodles are then cut to the best size that optimises their taste.
Careful checks are performed to ensure flavor is intact and the noodles are not brittle.

Weighing
Short pieces and uneven ends are removed, and the noodles are weighed to the specified amount before packaging. Some of the finished ramen is taste-tested by artisans, and only those that pass are shipped as final products.

In Yamagata, there is a local dish called “Imoni,” a soy sauce–based stew made with beef, taro, and other ingredients, cherished by the community for generations. We have taken care to honor this traditional flavor while reimagining it in the form of ramen. Among the many possible soup bases, such as tonkotsu or salt, we deliberately chose soy sauce to highlight the unique local taste of Yamagata.

Yamagata Prefecture is said to have the highest consumption of soy sauce and ramen in Japan. For residents, the taste of soy sauce is deeply rooted in daily life and holds a special place in their hearts.

This bowl of ramen carries the essence of Yamagata’s natural environment, the warmth of its people, and a deep respect for its food culture. For locals, it evokes nostalgia, while for visitors from other regions, it offers a fresh and delightful surprise, making it a truly special ramen.
The soup is delicious! I’ve been eating it since a long time ago, but the char siu (specially cooked pork belly or loin) is also tasty!

A cold broth, together with crisp, firm noodles, and seasonal toppings makes up Chilled Ramen, and not only perfect for summer, but this bowl can be enjoyed all year round. Its origin stems from a simple wish: to allow customers to enjoy ramen even in summer. Before air conditioning became common, our shop served shaved ice during the warmer months, and we used that ice to chill the broth, giving birth to chilled ramen.

We continue to honor this traditional flavor while adapting it for modern lifestyles, making it easy to enjoy at home. Experience the taste of Yamagata’s climate and the dedication of our artisans in every bowl of chilled ramen, any time of year.

The founder, determined to “make a living through the business of food,” began by making dumplings using a single stone mill, guided by the desire to become a place of support for the local community through food. This was the origin of Saraya Shokudo.

Over time, the founder wondered, “Is there something more filling and easy to eat?” and began milling buckwheat with the stone mill. Meanwhile, after the 1923 Great Kanto Earthquake, Chinese immigrants displaced from Yokohama’s Chinatown settled across Yamagata Prefecture and began serving ramen from street stalls, marking the beginnings of Yamagata’s ramen culture.

Against this backdrop, our philosophy developed: to offer a meal that is nutritious, energizing, affordable, and delicious for everyone, one that satisfies not just the stomach but also the heart. It was this vision that led a soba shop like ours to begin serving Chuka Soba.

The right side of our noren (shop banner) shows threads that have begun to fray. We see this as a symbol of the many people who have passed beneath it over the years. Each worn thread carries with it the weight of human presence and the passage of time.

The memories and feelings of all who have visited seem to have gradually seeped into this right edge of the banner. For this reason, we cherish this “fraying” and intend to preserve it as a warm and welcoming entrance for everyone who comes through our doors.

Our city, Sagae in Yamagata Prefecture, is known as Japan’s top cherry-producing region. Located near the center of Yamagata with a population of around 40,000, the city is surrounded by abundant nature and stunning seasonal landscapes, making it a hub for fruit and agricultural production.

Sagae is especially famous for its cherries, boasting some of the highest production in the country. In early summer, jewel-like red cherries ripen, attracting visitors from all over Japan. The region’s clear water and distinct temperature differences between day and night create the ideal conditions for cherries with a perfect balance of sweetness and acidity.
From this land, we share the charm of Sagae through food, allowing you to experience its natural beauty and the warmth of its people.

1. Put the noodles in already-boiled water.
2. Let boil for 3 minutes.
3. Put the soup in a bowl and then add hot water.
4. Once boiled, put your favourite toppings in and then add the noodles!

1. Put the noodles in boiling water.
2. Boil for 3 and a half minutes.
3. After the noodles have boiled, then place in cold water to chill.
4. In a bowl, put the soup and cold water, then add the thoroughly chilled noodles and enjoy.

Unfortunately, due to the President of the United States' Executive Order, which has stopped the De Minimis Policy of allowing shipping items under $800 to enter without needing to pay for import taxes, shipping via Japan Post is temporarily stopped. This means that we are looking at other ways of shipping to the US.

Because of this, we are unsure that we are able to deliver the ramen to backers. We are still in the process of communicating with logistics on how we can ship, due to the nature of the product. In the event that we can't ship we will cancel all pledges to the US and refund after the project ends. We will inform everyone what will happen closer to the time.

Also because we can't ship via Japan Post, this will mean that the cost of shipping may become quite costly. The chart below will only show a rough estimate and may become more costly. We'll try to keep backers up to date in this regard.

For US Backers, we foresee that you will need to pay import taxes, however, we don't know how much this will cost. We must insist that you pay these taxes, as if the items are returned to us, it will cost even more to resend the item. Please be aware of this.

Shipping is collected through PledgeBox at the end of the project. Please be aware that your initial pledge doesn't contain the price for shipping. We have done this as the commission that Kickstarter takes is based on the total raised on the project, which would need to be factored into the shipping prices. PledgeBox has much lower fees and thus is the cheaper way to collect shipping. We ask for your understanding in regard to how we are collecting shipping fees.

Since there are more countries we can ship to rather than not, and Kickstarter doesn't have any way for us to distinguish what countries are exempt, so we'd literally have to list each country we can ship to, we have the setting for worldwide shipment to be possible. However, due to global situations, there is a small list of countries that we unfortunately can't ship to at this time.
If you are living in the following countries, we apologize, but we won't be able to ship to the following countries:
Afghanistan, Bermuda, Russia, Syria, Turkmenistan, Paraguay, Bolivia, Malawi, South Sudan

Saraya Shokudo, located in Sagae City, Yamagata Prefecture, is a long-established restaurant founded in 1924. While originally a soba shop, its signature menu item is Chinese-style noodles. The founder’s vision was to make the restaurant a community hub and to support local workers. Today, the restaurant continues to serve the local community while also operating an online shop, soba-making classes, and a kitchen studio.

project.name: Petes Pizza Popup, a small batch sourdough pizza food truck!
project.description: Pizza brings people together, and that's exactly what we're here to do.

creator.name: Petes Pizza, LLC
creator.biography: Petes Pizza Popup, small batch sourdough pizza.

texte: Thank you for being so kind and taking your time to read this. My name is Peter Denham, I am here from some google searches to be honest. I don't know much about crowdfunding but I do know about pizza. I make small batch sourdough pizzas. I started with finding a 20qt mixer, finding a starter I liked, and experimenting. I do have some background in the pizza business I was GM of Thats A Some Pizza located on Bainbridge Island, WA. I do have a massive amount of experience eating pizza. Something I must try when I travel is local pizzerias. I'm wanting us to bring amazing sourdough pizza that is healthy and locally sourced ingredients to work with our community. I have tons of community support already from friends and family to local business owners. By raising this money and having the ability to have a food truck that is complete and follows guidelines of the health department, we could make this happen. Be mobile opposed to having a brick n mortar would help me strive in my environment of traveling, meeting new people, creating new friendships, partnerships, and creating a great environment for people to get great pizza and enjoy time with friends, family, and strangers! Something personal to me is nursing homes, my grandparents adopted me when I was my daughters age now around 5 years old. I would love to be able to bring my food truck to the nursing homes, hospitals, and other places of that sort to bring something special to the people that may not get something like that anymore or often. Again, thank you truly for taking your time to read this and considering my dream.
Who I do it for.

project.name: 🐾 Pure Beef Liver Nutrition for Dogs & Cats 🐾
project.description: Nutrient-Dense Supplement with One Single Ingredient

creator.name: Julie VN
creator.biography: I’m the founder of Alpine Botanicals Apothecary, focused on creating simple, whole-food products made with transparency and care. This project grew from my desire to support pets with real nutrition while supporting local Montana farms and responsible sourcing.

texte: Most dog and cat foods today are highly processed and rely on long ingredient lists and synthetic additives. Even premium options often lack naturally occurring, bioavailable nutrients.
We’re launching a single-ingredient, whole-food supplement made from 100% grass-fed, grass-finished beef liver, gently freeze-dried to preserve its natural integrity.
Simple. Transparent. Real nutrition — in one scoop.
We’re raising funds to produce and launch a freeze-dried beef liver supplement for dogs and cats.

Our product contains one ingredient only: beef liver.
No fillers. No additives. No synthetic vitamins.
Beef liver is one of nature’s most nutrient-dense foods, traditionally included in animal diets but largely absent from modern pet food.
As pet owners, we wanted a cleaner, more honest way to support our pets’ daily nutrition — without relying on overly processed foods or long ingredient lists we couldn’t fully trust.
We believe pets deserve food that’s as close to nature as possible.

We also care deeply about where our ingredients come from. By sourcing beef liver from local Montana farms, this project helps support responsible ranching, regional agriculture, and transparent supply chains.
Supporting local producers allows us to prioritize quality, traceability, and ethical sourcing while contributing to rural communities that value land stewardship and animal care.
We use freeze-drying, a low-temperature process that removes moisture without heat. This helps preserve naturally occurring nutrients, flavor, and whole-food integrity.
The result is a fine powder that’s easy to sprinkle over wet or dry food and suitable for dogs and cats of all sizes.
Nothing hidden. Nothing unnecessary.
Your support will help us:
Alpine Botanicals Apothecary is committed to simple, transparent formulations rooted in whole foods and responsible sourcing.
This project is about doing less — but doing it better.

project.name: Allergy, Vegan and Cruelty Free Scan App
project.description: An allergy, vegan, and cruelty-free product scanner for real-life safety.

creator.name: Oyku Muminoglu
creator.biography:
I’m an independent creator working on an app that helps people with allergies, intolerances, and ethical boundaries make safer decisions when buying everyday products.
This project didn’t start as a startup idea. It started from daily frustration reading ingredient lists over and over, cross-checking brands, worrying about hidden allergens, and still never feeling fully certain. When health risks and ethical choices overlap, the mental load becomes constant.
I’m not building this as a medical authority or a perfect database. I’m building it as a practical tool that prioritizes clarity, honesty, and caution especially in situations where missing or unclear information can actually cause harm.

texte: Millions of people live with food, skin, and ingredient sensitivities. Vegans and cruelty-free consumers face the same risk: unclear labels, hidden ingredients, and brands that change formulas without warning. This app lets users scan a barcode or ingredient list and instantly see whether a product is safe for their allergies, vegan, and cruelty-free; before they buy or use it.

I have a niece, aunt and cousins with celiac disease, I also struggle with gluten intolerance and finding an app that covers lots of allergies is really impossible. I want to solve that problem and also give attention to ethical side of things too.
I am the only person who is working on this project.

items.name: Special Thank You and App Demo.

comments.text: Hi. I love this idea. I’m allergic to gluten, dairy and soy. How long will your allergy list be?

replies.text: Hello, thank you for your support, I have a list of all wheat types (rye, barley, oat…) including malts, all dairy types and all soy related ingredients. The app also has long list of other allergies from going anaphylactic to intolerance, such as tree nuts, peanuts to pepper. We are also inculcating skin allergies!

project.name: Building the Next Chapter of The Baking Bar
project.description: Help us raise $20K to fix the outside and upgrade The Baking Bar into a proper café & brunch spot.

creator.name: The Baking Bar
creator.biography: Bar & Maya are the duo behind The Baking Bar - bakers, brunch lovers, and believers that a great café should feel as good as it tastes.

titre:
Our mission is simple:
Make the outside of The Baking Bar look as good as the inside smells, and turn our bakery into the café/brunch spot it’s clearly trying to become.
texte: 😏 Let’s be honest.

The food? Incredible.
The vibes inside? Cozy, warm, full of life.
The outside? …yeah. Needs help.

The Baking Bar has grown into a full-on café and brunch destination, and our space is this close to matching what we’re actually doing here. We’re raising $20,000 to fix what’s not working, level up what is, and finally give the bakery the glow-up it deserves.

This isn’t about going fancy.
It’s about going intentional.
Your support will help us:
✨ Redo the exterior so people stop walking past us
☕ Improve our café setup (because coffee should flow, not bottleneck)
🍳 Upgrade parts of the kitchen to better support brunch
🪑 Make the space more comfortable for lingering, chatting, and ordering “just one more thing...”
Basically: same soul, better setup.

We could’ve taken out a loan.
We could’ve rushed changes.
But instead, we’re inviting the people who already love this place to help shape what it becomes next.
Plus, we made really good rewards. Like… dangerously good.

The Baking Bar has always been about comfort food, creative baking, and a space that feels human. This campaign helps us build a bakery that looks like it belongs to the community it serves - messy mornings, long brunches, and all.
If you’ve ever said, “Let’s just stop at The Baking Bar,” this one’s for you.

project.name: KVL Hill Garden Teas: From Garden to Cup
project.description: Darjeeling & India-sourced teas—Black, Green, White, Oolong for your everyday ritual

creator.name: KVL Hill Garden Teas
creator.biography: KVL Hill Garden Teas brings rare, single-origin teas from India’s renowned hill gardens to tea lovers in the U.S. We partner with growers, blend locally, and craft small-batch teas that celebrate heritage, purity, and exceptional flavor.

texte: Story
Our Story: From Garden to Cup

At KVL Hill Garden Teas, we bring you the freshest teas straight from the hills of Darjeeling, directly to your home. By honoring the rich heritage of West Bengal, our mission is to deliver the finest teas to the United States. Each cup is a tribute to the legacy of the gardens and the craft of tea-making.
What We’re Producing With This Campaign
Your support helps us turn Hill Garden Teas from a vision into a real, launch-ready brand. Here’s exactly what this campaign will fund:
Every pledge goes directly toward building the foundation of a transparent, quality-first tea company—and delivering exceptional tea to your cup. 🍵
WHAT ReSeARCH HAS FOUND WITH ReGULAR TeA CONSUMPTION
🌱 The Big Picture

Research doesn’t say tea is a cure-all. But it does consistently show that regular tea consumption is linked with better long-term health, antioxidant support, heart health, and balanced energy—across black, green, white, and oolong teas.
That makes tea one of the simplest, most enjoyable daily habits you can build for long-term wellness.
🍃 What Research Suggests About Regular Tea Consumption

All true teas—black, green, white, and oolong—come from the same plant (Camellia sinensis). The differences are in how they’re processed, but they share many of the same naturally occurring compounds, especially polyphenols (like catechins and theaflavins) and flavonoids.
🫖 1. Rich in Antioxidants
Studies consistently show that tea is a major source of antioxidants in many diets. These compounds help:
Green and white teas are especially high in catechins, while black and oolong teas contain theaflavins and thearubigins—different antioxidants formed during oxidation.
❤️ 2. Heart & Circulatory Health Support
Large population studies have found that people who regularly drink tea tend to have:
This doesn’t mean tea is a medicine—but it is consistently linked with heart-healthy lifestyle patterns.
🧠 3. Focus, Calm Energy & Mental Alertness
Tea naturally contains caffeine + L-theanine, a combo that research suggests may:
This is one reason many people describe tea as “calm energy in a cup.”
🦠 4. Metabolic & Immune Support
Research has linked regular tea consumption to:
Green and oolong teas are often studied in metabolism-related research, while all true teas show immune-supporting antioxidant activity.
🧘 5. Overall Wellness & Longevity Patterns
In many long-term observational studies, regular tea drinkers tend to show:
Again—this is about supporting wellness, not making medical claims.

project.name: Cheers! Coffee
project.description: A coffee concept rooted in exceptional hospitality & great coffee based in Midtown Atlanta.

creator.name: Jeremy Fisher
creator.biography: Cheers! Coffee

texte: Cheers longs to be a place that feels like home, whatever that is to you.

Lately, we’ve felt a growing desire to push back against the forces that pull our communities apart. Coffee has always acted as a unifier in our lives, and cafes have been spaces we have gathered, connected, commiserated & celebrated. 

But we’ve also felt an ache at a gap in our market. We are setting out to create a space that feels open, welcoming, and accessible to our friends and neighbors; no matter who they are or where they’re coming from.
The People:
We’re Jeremy and Nicolle Fisher, the owners of Cheers!

We’re deeply enamored with great hospitality, we’ve loved being and working in Atlanta’s vibrant coffee culture, AND we believe there’s still room for more. We’ve both experienced coffee spaces that feel impersonal and unwelcoming rather than places meant for people.

Atlanta deserves more coffee spaces that prioritize warmth, generosity, and joy. We imagine Cheers! as a place that feels playful and inclusive, where people gather the way they would around a family dinner table.
The Business:

Right now, Cheers! operates as a free, once-a-month pop-up, fully funded by us and supported by the kindness of friends and community members who believe in what we’re building and want to see more of it.
Through this Kickstarter, we’re inviting you to pay what you want to help us take the next step. Contributions will go toward essentials like:
The Dream:
Our vision for Cheers! has always been a permanent home: a physical space that lives out this mission every day.
This funding round is a crucial step - a proof of concept that Cheers! isn’t just viable but possible. That it feeds community and has the potential to grow into a brick-and-mortar café.
Thank you for being part of this with us - Cheers!

project.name: The Ritual Collection: Herbal Teas for Everyday Rituals
project.description: Small-batch organic, herbal teas rooted in ritual, care, and community.

creator.name: Kris Haas
creator.biography:
Hi, I’m Kris.

Before opening The Botanica Boutique, I was — and still am — a writer, and I was a New Jersey public school teacher. Storytelling, education, and helping people make sense of complex things have always been at the heart of my work. I’ve spent years listening closely — to students, to readers, and later, to a community searching for ways to feel better in a world that often feels overwhelming.

During the pandemic, that search became deeply personal. I’ve lived with anxiety for most of my life, and when the world slowed down, everything felt louder. I realized I wasn’t making space for myself, and that self-care wasn’t something optional — it was essential. Through that time, I turned toward plant-based remedies, ritual practices, and small, grounding habits that helped me sleep, think clearly, and feel more steady day to day.

That experience planted the seed for The Botanica Boutique.

What began as a personal need grew into a vision: a wellness space rooted in care, intention, and trust. I immersed myself in research, herbal study, and the process of finding clean, thoughtfully made products from companies whose values aligned with my own — prioritizing plant-based ingredients, organic or regenerative practices, and women- and minority-owned businesses. Every product in the shop is personally vetted, because I believe wellness should feel supportive, not overwhelming.

As the shop grew, one thing became clear: people weren’t just looking for products. They were looking for moments of care — rituals that could help them slow down, breathe, and reconnect with themselves in everyday life.

That’s where The Ritual Collection was born.

This small-batch line of organic herbal teas is a natural extension of the work I’ve been doing for years — blending herbs with intention, listening deeply, and honoring the power of simple rituals. Each blend is designed to support everyday moments like rest, focus, calm, emotional balance, and seasonal shifts. I also offer custom teas, blended thoughtfully for individual preferences and needs.

The Ritual Collection represents the next chapter of my work — one rooted in ritual, community, and the belief that wellness doesn’t have to be complicated to be meaningful.

Thank you for being here, and for supporting this journey.

titre: 🌿 The Story Behind The Ritual Collection
🌱 What Makes The Ritual Collection Different
texte: The Ritual Collection is a small-batch line of organic herbal teas designed to bring intention, calm, and connection to your everyday rituals. Crafted with care inside a community-based wellness shop, these teas invite you to slow down, breathe, and create meaningful moments — one cup at a time.
For the past several years, I’ve been building a small business with a simple mission: to help people feel better using natural remedies and everyday rituals.

Through my work at The Botanica Boutique, I’ve spent years studying herbalism, researching organic plants, and learning how herbs can gently support the nervous system, mood, sleep cycles, and emotional wellbeing. Along the way, I began blending herbs with intention — pairing calming botanicals for rest, or uplifting herbs for gentle clarity and focus during the day.

Herbs are often overlooked in modern life, but they’ve supported humans for centuries. My grandmother has always said, “A cup of tea can heal anything.” She’s 99 years old, so I tend to trust her wisdom.

As I continued learning and blending, something became clear: people weren’t just looking for products — they were looking for moments of care. A pause. A breath. Something grounding in the middle of busy, overstimulated lives.
That’s where The Ritual Collection was born.
At the heart of everything I create is ritual.

Ritual is how we mark transitions.
It’s how we soothe ourselves.
It’s how we signal rest, presence, and care for both mind and body.

Ritual can be simple. It’s the moment before bed when the kettle boils.
It’s the deep breath you take while the herbs steep.
It’s holding a warm cup with two hands and letting the day soften.
These moments may seem small, but they have the power to change how we feel.
In a world full of wellness products, The Ritual Collection is intentionally simple.
These teas aren’t about trends or quick fixes — they’re about creating small, meaningful moments of care you can return to every day.
What sets them apart:

• Organic, thoughtfully sourced herbs
Every blend is made using organic, sustainably sourced herbs selected for quality, freshness, and integrity.

• Blended with intention
Each tea is crafted to support a specific moment — rest, focus, calm, emotional balance, or seasonal wellness — without overwhelming the senses.

• Small-batch and handcrafted
All blends are created in small batches by hand, allowing for care, consistency, and attention that mass-produced teas can’t offer.

• Ritual-first, not clinical
These teas are designed for everyday use — comforting, grounding, and supportive — without medical language or overwhelm.

• Rooted in community
The Ritual Collection was created inside a real, woman-owned wellness shop, shaped by years of conversations, questions, and shared needs.

• Custom blends, made just for you
Select rewards include custom-blended teas created specifically for your preferences, rhythms, and intentions.

Sweet Dreams
A soothing evening blend designed to help you unwind and ease gently into rest.

Bright Focus
A gently uplifting blend created to support clarity, presence, and steady energy.

Quiet Calm
A grounding blend for moments of stress, overwhelm, or when life feels a little too loud.

Open Heart
A warm, comforting blend intended to nurture emotional balance and reflection.

Seasonal Balance
A nourishing blend designed to support resilience through seasonal shifts.
Custom Blends
A personalized blend, made just for you.
For years, customers in my shop have asked for the same thing: an Apothecary.

A place where herbs are visible.
Where teas are blended with care.
Where you can slow down, ask questions, and feel connected to what you’re choosing.
This campaign helps make that vision real.
With your support, I’ll be creating a dedicated Apothecary section inside The Botanica Boutique — a space centered around organic herbs, small-batch tea blends, and intentional ritual.

This space will include:
• Airtight glass apothecary jars filled with organic herbs
• A sensory experience — seeing, smelling, and learning
• Thoughtfully curated tools like scoops, infusers, and ritual objects
• Space for custom blending and personalized guidance
The Apothecary is not about shelves of products — it’s about access, education, and care.
Every tea in The Ritual Collection will pass through this space, making it the foundation of the project.
Each reward tier is designed to invite ritual into your everyday life — from individual teas to curated luxe ritual boxes and custom blends.
(Reward details are listed in the sidebar.)
We’re committed to bringing The Ritual Collection to life thoughtfully, without rushing or cutting corners.

Weeks 1–2
• Campaign closes
• Backer surveys sent
• Final quantities confirmed
• Packaging and supply orders placed

Weeks 3–6
• Organic herbs sourced in bulk
• Apothecary jars and storage arrive
• Apothecary section is built and organized
• Packaging design finalized

Weeks 7–10
• Teas blended in small batches
• Custom blends created
• Ritual boxes assembled

Weeks 11–12
• Orders packed and shipped
• Tracking sent to backers
Local backers will have the option for free in-shop pickup

project.name: Bel's Fanfare
project.description: An otherworldly RPG inspired by the Zelda classics

creator.name: Chibig
creator.biography: We are a small team of young people who are very enthusiastic about video games. We have been working together for several years on consoles and PC games.

texte: Bel's Fanfare is an immersive RPG with exploration and expressive battle encounters. You play as Bel, the new aura cleaner of the once-luxurious vessel The Witch of the Sea.
Purify the rooms of this cruise ship inhabited by otherworldly beings and find a resolution to their spiritual troubles.

Inspired by the first Zelda 3D classics, we present our most atmospheric adventure to date, brimming with exciting and fast-paced combat and promising narrative excellence at every moment of this heartful story.
The Ukobach gong-shield is your all-in-one tool for combat, exploration and puzzle-solving. Absorb aura, block projectiles, play music, catch fish... discover its multiple uses along your adventure.
Defeat hostile aura in expressive arenas with surprises at every stage. Culminate the experience with boss battles set inside the spirit of passengers.

Explore the many (hidden) rooms of the Witch of the Sea, bask in its glorious past and uncover its (unsettling) past history. Every area is carefully crafted with attention to detail and a nostalgic touch.
Immerse yourself into the lives of the magical beings that inhabit the Witch of the Sea. Many will ask for your help, whether they deserve it or not.
Push characters into a resolution of your choice. Experience its consequences as their stories unfold.

Shield skins: During your adventure you will find new aspects that will change the appearance and sound of your gong-shield. 

Thanks to your support the game will include additional skins!
We recently hit a stretch goal for adding skins based on Valencian culture. Who knows what will be next!

By now, you should know that we are obsessed with the Nintendo 64 era.
We would like to bring the good times back by replicating the most characteristic artifacs of the games that we used to play as children.
The image above is a mere mockup, we are currently studying how far we can push this look.
Bel's Fanfare gameplay is composed of exploration and combat. Here is a rundown of the game mechanics.
As an aura cleaner, it is your job to clean the rooms of the ship from this substance. Ring your gong to collect aura flies. Use their power to disrupt and cleanse cursed objects.
Traverse the rooms of the ship in search for secrets. Some will lead you to interesting places. Others... will better be left ignored.

Meet the colorful cast of the Witch of the Sea. Meddle into the issues of others and watch their stories unfold. Attend to a notorius wizard wedding, bow to the (ex) Queen of Mara, or mediate a neighbours squabble. Find drama at every scale.
Along your adventure, you will discover many things to do that your father would not approve of...
Hostile aura resists being cleaned and will trap you into arenas. Dodge hazards and block resonant (colored) projectiles until your shield is fully charged!
To truly erradicate aura, you must find its source inside the spirit of key passengers. There, a special challenge awaits you.

The Witch of the Sea, once a symbol of prestige in the world of magic, has fallen into decadence. Its rooms overflow with aura and its passengers suffer the consequences.In a desperate attempt to save the ship, Captain Popplar calls upon the demon Belceboo, who, forever bound to the boiler room, is forced to power the vessel's engine.

For many years, Belceboo and his many children have been left forgotten in the depths of The Witch of the Sea. Now, he has the chance to send his favorite daughter Bel to the outside, where she will serve the captain as the new aura cleaner.
Before parting, Belceboo grants Bel a final gift: the Ukoback gong-shield, an old family heirloom capable of disrupting and absorbing aura.
To the passengers, Bel is restoring the ship to its former glory, but in secret, she is setting in motion a plan to free her family from their imprisonment.
The passengers of the Witch of the Sea hide deeply human stories behind extravagant and supernatural appearances.

The full game takes place inside the Witch of the Sea, a moving world between the fantastic and the mundane. Despite its colossal size, Bel and her family have always been confined in the boiler room.

Now you have the chance to discover all its wonders and (terrifying) hidden truths, while letting yourself be enticed by the vestiges of greatness and wealth of the past. Roam around the old theater, attend a grand wedding on the deck and visit the world-famous bath house.
By supporting Bel's Fanfare development you will obtain rewards! Some of these rewards include physical items, so we encourage you to take a good look to all of them and read their descriptions.

We also have limited tiers with special rewards, so stay tuned to our Kickstarter page because you never know what surprises there might be! 
 
Bel's figurine: A limited edition, full color figurine of Bel. Size: 4”/ 10cm  Material: PVC

Collector's figurine:  A limited edition, handpainted figurine of Belceboo's hand holding Bel. The shield and Bel's body can be attached and dettached. Size: 6”/ 15cm  Material: Resin.

Phone call: Send your own encouraging message to Bel. It will help her during difficult battles.
Kickstarter Shield Skin: An exclusive shield skin for backers unlocked through a secret code. This is a cross promotion with our other project Elusive.

What is the Wedding Invite Postcard? This is an exclusive physical postcard to “attend” the Magical Wedding we will witness in the game (it's just a symbolic physical invitation - every player is invited ;)
(...Confused? Check our FAQ!)
Bel's Fanfare will come in: English, Spanish, German, French, Japanese, Chinese and Valencian.
You can request new language additions supporting the campaign from your region.
Bel's Fanfare digital game will be released on: Steam, Nintendo Switch 1 & 2, PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X.
Bel's Fanfare physical editions will be released on Nintendo Switch 1 & 2 and PlayStation.
*Nintendo Switch 2 physical editions are cartridge games, not game key cards.
Adding to wishlist on Steam helps us a lot!

Every single area and character of Bel's Fanfare is crafted with intention, meticulous detail and love. We draw inspiration from cultures all over the world with an emphasis on Spanish and Japanese references.
Bel's Fanfare soundtrack is composed by Ellery Smith, an independent musician from Nashville, USA. Here are some of our current composed songs:
Bel draws inspiration from the stylized, low-poly artistry of Majora's Mask and the dreamlike atmosphere of Spirited Away, both approaches of creating a fantasy world grounded in reality.
Like Undertale, narrative is deeply integrated into the course of battles. The expressive bullet hell combat complements the experience by adding challenge and meaning to each confrontation.

A meeting point for the Chibig universe: Bel's Fanfare is brimming with references to all previous (and current!) Chibig games. If you are a fan of us, we have many surprises for you. If you are a newcomer, welcome aboard!
Our latest campaign was for Elusive in 2025, raising over €300K, but our most successful campaign to date has been for Mika and the Witch’s Mountain (2023 — €1.3M).
This is our sixth Kickstarter campaign, which means we have had the opportunity to create and launch six video games thanks to the support of a wonderful community that has grown with each project.
Our first Kickstarter campaign took place in 2019 with Summer in Mara, and since then we have found a way to bring our games to life with complete freedom.

Even today, we are still a small team, which means we face many limitations in development, but we are brimming with talent and never hesitate to take on new challenges with each project. Each Kickstarter campaign has opened up new opportunities for us, but the most important of all is having found and grown a community.

Thanks to these people, we have not only raised the financial support to make our games a reality, but they have also helped us make better games with their feedback and have reserved a place for us in one of the most important things for them: their love of video games.

It's very exciting to see that there are people who have supported us from the first campaign to this day.  That's why we'll continue to rely on Kickstarter to maintain our creative freedom and gain the support of more and more people. Thank you for being the first to believe in us!

comments.text: Hello everyone! About the BETA:

replies.text: Thank you for this clarification! Super helpful!

Hi hi!!! I backed a few days ago for the digital version with a figurine (so excited to have a friend for my Koa one!!) and I was just wondering, do I need to add an Early Access key as an add-on or are all the digital versions going to be EA?
hello, so the beta addon also comes with a key to the full game on steam?

comments.text: Love the unique feel of this game just from the trailer can't wait to play it
Will this game be compatible for the Switch console (not the 2nd)?

In the future will you offer the “hands cradle” big figures as an add on for the singular physical reward tiers? Im just curious if it’ll be possible to snag later. Very happy with just having a little bel 😌 tho
Hi. Why is it only a digital art book? I would like to have a physical edition, possibly signed.
When a Games seems to be more Zelda like than the current ones. I am totally in Love with Soundtrack and graphics.
Out of curiousity, I appreciate all the updates, but what is the plan after the campaign is over as far as updates considering the game isn't expected until  2027?
Got the cute postcard in the mail, had to back 🥰

replies.text: Aww thank you so much!

comments.text: Hello, this is my first time doing anything on kickstarter. Do the discord chat happens after the 7th?

replies.text: Hi Gloria! The dedicated Discord will come in the future, but in the meantime you all can join the Chibig's general Discord: https://discord.gg/yV3DAEM2Cr - Thank you for your support!
Thank you

comments.text: Since the team is Valencian and the trailer being in English, I'm curious - in which language is the game being originally made?

replies.text: Mostly in Spanish :)

comments.text: Italian language pls

replies.text: Hi Celestino! We can't confirm more languages for now, sorry.

comments.text: Would a physical edition add-on be available for the Beta Tester Tier? With the upgrade for physical editions I’m really debating the physical version, but I’m already on the beta tier and it seems this tier doesn’t have a physical edition add-on (and other tiers don’t give access to the beta)

replies.text: Hi! There's a condition with Kickstarter pledges: your pledge needs to include at least one physical item to include any physical addons, because of the shipping costs, sorry.

comments.text: Backed the golden edition this game brings back a lot of great memories can’t wait to play it
What is the Wedding invitation Postcard in the new tier?

replies.text: Hi Diana! It will be, literally a wedding invitation in postcard format hahaha Not to attend to a real wedding, it's related with the game, of course hehe We'll be giving more info about this in the upcoming updates!

comments.text: Just wanted to say congrats on such a successful campaign! You guys have something really special here and I think you more than deserve all the support! Wishing you all the best with development!

replies.text: hahaha thank you so much!!

comments.text: Will graphics be different from platform to platform? Is it better to play on ps5 or switch 1?

replies.text: Hi! We'll be trying to reach the best performance for each platform, but it's too early to confirm it, sorry

comments.text: Heya! I was wondering if we could choose to have a physical NS1 version, or will all physical copies be for NS2?

replies.text: Hi! you'll be able to choose NSW 1 or NSW2, no worries ^^
Since the NSW2 version has been confirmed, does this mean there will also be a patch if someone chooses the NSW version and upgrades to NSW2 in the future? (Also, congrats for the new goal!)

comments.text: Hello, hope everyone is having a great start to the week!

replies.text: Hello Orenji!
Lovely, thank you for confirming! All the best :)

comments.text: Hi! Very excited for this game :D I backed the "COLOR FIGURINE" which includes the digital game and digital artbook/OST.

replies.text: Hi! It will remain only for the physical, as we'll need explicit consent from our partner to share it in this case. We'll ask them for permission, and we'll let you all know, no worries! Thank you for your support :)

comments.text: In the "PHYSICAL EDITION + FIGURINE" package, can I choose the physical Nintendo Switch 2 game and the digital Steam game, or do they have to be from the same platform? Also, how do we let you know?

replies.text: Hi Davide. No worries, we'll be sending a survey in the future for you to indicate the platform for your physical and digital copies. That could be for different platforms, of course. Thank you so much for your support!

comments.text: Will you guys have holiday based stuff, like Halloween or Christmas? 🤔

replies.text: Not for now, sorry, we'll be focused on developing the game :)

comments.text: Please please please have loads of puzzles and areas to explore

replies.text: Noted! hehe

comments.text: Hi team! Are there plans for in-game achievements? Would love to hunt for them on the Switch 2 :)

replies.text: Hi Shawn. There will be achievements in Steam (as it's the platform where's easiest to include), but we can't confirm it for the others, sorry.

comments.text: Hey guys, I actually received your postcard in the mail. Of course, I had already backed this project. But it made me wonder if you had postcards for your other projects? Basically, I would love to have a collection of your postcards, if so (to display with the figures, for ex). And if it's something that doesn't already exist, I'm sure I'm not the only one who would pay for an add-on.

replies.text: Hey Samantha, We're glad you received the postcard! We’ve created other postcards for our previous projects in the past, but unfortunately, all of them were for Kickstarter backers, and we don’t have any other copies left.

comments.text: Will the NS2 version be full game cartridge? I will never own a game key or CIB, so can we have this confirmed before end of campaign? I am thinking of adding an extra physical edition.

replies.text: Hey Poxikox! We really want the cartridge to contain the full game (that’s also our wish as players). NS1 will have the full game, and even though this is our first NS2 game (and we need to move forward with the process to confirm it 100%) we believe it’s possible and consider it our main option.

project.name: Final Girl Series 4
project.description: Final Girl is back with Series 4! Tons of new content awaits you in this critically acclaimed solo game.

creator.name: A.J. Porfirio
creator.biography: Van Ryder Games has previously and successfully fulfilled multiple games many of which can be viewed in our KS history and/or by visiting our website. We produce high quality, thematic games and gamebooks with the utmost care and attention!

gone.name: FG Series 4 A La Carte
gone.desc:
Choose the Series 4 Feature Films you would like for $25 a piece. You need to add a Core Box for $25 if you are new to Final Girl. You will be able to choose your Feature Films in our post-campaign pledge manager.

Only Series 4 Feature Films will be available a la carte (S1, S2, & S3 Feature Films will NOT be offered)

You will receive all the Bonus Items revealed during this campaign except the Vignette Miniatures which you will get only if you add-on one or more Feature Film Miniatures Boxes.

Shipping and applicable taxes extra and will be charged in our post-campaign pledge manager.

comments.text: *** Please try not to comment on this Pinned message as it clutters the top of the comments page and makes it harder to find new comments***
Just going to send it! Ultimate all in!

replies.text: That's awesome!! Welcome to Final Girl.
Welcome! You're gonna love every time you hate it! (It's like eating spicy ramen. It hurts, but it's worth it)

comments.text: will there be a normal Ursula min (a not killer)?

replies.text: Stay tuned to the reveals!
The bigger question is who is Elisabeth?

comments.text: Really looking forward to the Ursula character pack. To be both the killer and the final girl at the same time (using the same meeple) is something different and I can't wait to try it out. Excellent work on this campaign so far. Looking forward to all the daily reveals.

New to the mystery boxes here. What are they? I know that seems counter-intuitive... asking what's the mystery. I mean, what have they typically been in the past? I have no experience with them to know if I'm getting dice, alternate minis, etc? Thanks

replies.text: This is not the place to ask, as they are intended to be kept as a mystery. If you are really curious what they have been in the past I'd suggest that you google it or check out videos on Youtube. It won't be discussed here, though.

And I'd suggest not spoiling it for yourself. They don't add gameplay elements, so you're not missing out on secret Girls or Killers if you don't get them, but they are fun and extremely well done (in my opinion) enhancements to the seasons they come with. VRG is really good at having fun surprises, and not spoiling it is half the fun.
To add a counter to the rabid fan service here... they are just fine. You don't need them everything they offer can be done with out them. But they add a touch of fun to it.

comments.text: need some help here, I own everything from previous campaigns and I want all the new stuff, will below mentioned items cover everything new or am I missing something?

replies.text: the Ultimate Box comes with the miniatures. You just need that plus:

comments.text: I'm interested in getting the alternate killer minis, particularly for series 4. I typically don't use the minis, as I find the wooden meeples to be great, but there are instances where I prefer the minis, such as any FF with minions that would otherwise use cardboard tokens. For Series 4, does the alternate killer mini add-on include all the minions as well (Billy's Buddies, T. rex/Raptors, etc.)? I don't need the Final Girl minis, so if I can get a single package that includes all the Killers and minions only, that would be my preference.

replies.text: alternate Killer miniatures do not include Minions. Also the T-Rex is not technically a "killer" in the game definition of the term, so it does not have a alt mini.

comments.text: Is The Bleeding Heart promo card available through this content? Or is it provided in one of the extra boxes?

replies.text: Thanks Mike, I was looking to see if it had come up previously, I figured it had.

Please note that the Bleeding Heart is not an official Final Girl product. It was created by Evan for fun and has never been used as a convention promo, or available through crowdfunding, or the VRG store. Think of it as Evan's business card and you have to go up to Evan to get one.
Duly noted! Thank you again for your assistance.

comments.text: I've currently pledged for the catch-up bundle, plus the 3 additional mini packs for Season 4, as well as the S3 Storage box.  I'm trying to work out what the predicted shipping costs are likely to be after adding the storage box (based in UK), can anyone help?
If I bought the catch-up box and all the remaining feature films and their miniatures individually, would I be missing something that is in the Ultimate Box?

replies.text: AJ's answer is definitely more complete. I was just answering if there was anything you'd be missing compared to just getting the Ultimate Box.  None of the items AJ mentions above are NOT part of the Ultimate Box nor the Catch Up pledge but you may want to consider them.

Ooops...several typos above. To clarify... the items AJ mentioned in is response are NOT part of the Ultimate Box or the Catch Up pledge. They are add-ons for both pledge levels. As he mentioned, please check the pledge assistance tool.
Yes, that's what I meant just a comparison of Ultimate box vs Catch-up box with FFs and their miniatures. Thanks for the help to you both, love your guys' work!  :)

comments.text: Any guesses on what today’s next secret reveal will be?  He said it’s a pretty big one.  Maybe another special feature? Two player mode? Dice tower?  What you think?

replies.text: Hoping for something new, like a set or location pack so they can explore films outside the one killer genre without having to find an appropriate killer to tie to it. For example you have a board with a slowly flooding underwater base with sharks on one side and a plane full of vipers and convicts on the other side. Comes with item cards, tokens, the final girls Sam and Jackie, and a special action card allowing you to use expert level profanity.
@Jeremiah that would be amazing!
@Pavel The point goes to you though. Character pack it is.

comments.text: I'm still slightly confused about the difference between backer levels.  Am I right in thinking that even though I've got Shriek, Buddyland (with minis) and deadly harvest (no minis) - it's still cheaper for me to go for the all-in s4 box, than to piecemeal select the stuff I'm missing to complete s4?

replies.text: The Catch Up Box plus the 2 Feature Films you're missing (A Demon in the Shadows and The Green Terror) plus the 3 Minis Boxes you are missing (for A Rotten Harvest, A Demon in the Shadows and The Green Terror) would cost $159.

comments.text: Okay - silly question here: I am backing the S4 ultimate box ($199)- even though I already own buddyland from the summer release. I keep seeing addons that are (miniatures only) for all the S4 stuff- do I need to purchase any of these miniatures, or are they all included in the feature films that already come with my pledge? Also, the back of my current summer release of buddyland does not say that it includes any miniatures in it: am I missing something here? I’ve never opened it yet.

replies.text: If you buy stuff and never open it I'd say you're missing out on a lot 😉
Thanks Dan!

Thank you Dan- that clarifies everything for me. I went digging really deep and found my minis for buddyland. I will just sell it when my S4 ultimate comes in. I already have shriek thankfully, and it has minis as it’s a special feature. I have ordered the season 4 alternates also. Trying to complete everything before they stop making stuff as this is the end of this era.

comments.text: Will Era two content be about a sequel game called the final guy?

replies.text: The horror movie trope of a final girl is established for a reason, and although there are admittedly exceptions I'd say that the final girl is generally quite valid still to this day. Introducing a "Final Boy" would be a curve ball no one saw coming indeed, but would it be something the majority would *like* to see? I'm a bit doubtful myself, and think it actually could lead to decreased sales... Final Girl and its contents are all about the tropes, after all. But who knows?
I'm with Dan on this one.
Yes, a Final Boy idea would only work for me as an exception. Maybe a character pack for a grown up Savior or something. But I wouldn't enjoy a big change.

comments.text: Pledged the S4 Ultimate (wow the S1-S4 pledges comes with a lot of add'l stuff, almost wished I waited lol but have all the other season already).  S4 Ultimate comes with the Special Feature Shriek correct?  I don't see option to add it on and I recall a previous Season getting the North Pole w/ the Ultimate pledge (actually almost a year early if I recall correctly).  If it doesn't come with it and can't add it on does that mean I can't get it through this campaign?  (that would be very odd).  Thanks in advance for providing clarity

replies.text: So on the first page there's a detailed list of add ons (feature films, alt minis, mystery boxes, etc) but when I go to "change pledge" I only have maybe 6 or 7 reward tier options.  Maybe I'm missing something or maybe it'll be an option later?  Slight bummer not included, would've grabbed it when it came out, lol.
Go to "change pledge", choose your pledge again. Then you can add add-ons before continuing to check out.
Bingo Yasir, thank you so much!!

comments.text: Maybe I missed it, and maybe I'm slow, but with the $25 Ala-carte pledge, where do you pick the Feature Film you want? I see the Add-Ons, but those are $25 as well... and when I select only one, it says my total is $50. Maybe I'm not seeing something obvious, but I feel like I'm missing something here.

replies.text: Back at a la carte, then add all but one that you want as an add-on. Then in the PM, you'll pick that other one as the one for the a la carte pledge copy.

Nathan's right, but it's also perfectly reasonable to just pledge a la carte, then do your selection and add-ons in the pledge manager. For some people, this is easier to mentally process. But you do you!
Or select all that you want here and the extra money can go toward shipping.

comments.text: I see lots of references to the Mausoleum Box in all the updates.  Is this the big storage box?  I'm doing the catch-up tier and it doesn't mention the Mausoleum Box like other tiers do, but I don't see it as an add-on.

replies.text: The storage box itself is not the Mausoleum Box. The Mausoleum box is *inside* the storage box. It's the big, wide box that goes in the top of the storage box in the spot where the playmat boxes and/or Special FX Crate boxes were back in Series 1 - 3.
Ahhhh, thank you good sir.  We seem to back a lot of the same things.  Love that Hero Realms update.
If Tone Deafness were a commodity, the team for HR:D would have the market cornered.

comments.text: Do the Julie and Meg promos come in the Series 4 Ultimate Box?

replies.text: No, those would have to be add-ons to S4 Ultimate (as these Premium Promos are not part of S4, per se)

comments.text: For now i think i got FG with my actual order complete - there is only one thing missing..... PLEASE make - Replacement Tray Pack - from your shop an add on with this Kickstarter!
Does the Mausoleum box come in the Catch up campaign?

replies.text: Yes

comments.text: The main page says we will get 5 postcards, when the update post says 10

replies.text: 10 is the correct number. The graphic will be updated to reflect this.

comments.text: Any chance the Julie and Meg promos will come with regular cards as well as the foil cars?

replies.text: Not saying it won't ever happen...that's up to AJ. I just know that's not the current plan.
I would put my preference with non-foil cards in the future.
+1 for non-foil options

comments.text: When will you receive the survey to fill out?

replies.text: A month or two. Its still funding.

replies.text: It includes everything released up to this point. There are no add-ons in this campaign the provide something that is missing from the Ultimate All-In pledge.
The pinned comment at the top should have the link to the spreadsheet that tells you what all is in each pledge, including the all-in. It breaks it down pretty handily

project.name: Dark Matter Mega Box: Sci-Fi 5E
project.description: A 5th Edition campaign setting set in a universe inspired by Mass Effect, Dune, and Star Wars. With maps by Czepeku!

creator.name: Mage Hand Press
creator.biography: Mage Hand Press is a small team of exceptionally talented writers and illustrators that have been working for over six years to produce professional quality 5E content.

texte: Dark Matter is a 440+ page sci-fantasy campaign setting that launches your D&D 5E game into space! Gather your crew, build your starship, face down alien horrors, and explore the farthest reaches of the galaxy. Using the 2024 5E rules, you can break free from medieval fantasy and live out Dune, Star Wars, or Mass Effect at your tabletop!
The Dark Matter Mega Box has everything you need to start playing today!
Featuring an Kickstarter-exclusive box of battlemaps by Czepeku!

Stomp through the streets and battle colossal kaiju in a hundred-foot tall Battleframe! Your mech suit levels up alongside your character, and you can outfit it with an arsenal of weapons, armor, and upgrades.

Play as a rainbow-colored oozelike Amoeboid, a Skathári bug barbarian, a towering Nautilid fish-person in power armor, a robot cowboy Vect, or one of a thousand humanoid offshoots. The ‘Verse is a place of endless diversity, of which you play but one small part.
Eight new playable species await you in Dark Matter!

Fantasy and science fiction live side by side in the ‘Verse. Play an axe-wielding barbarian or a machine-gun toting android. Wizards and power-armored space commandos can plot to steal a starship. And lute-strumming bards can ply their trade in taverns perched on asteroids.
Find 45 new subclasses for core and Mage Hand Press classes in Dark Matter!

Dark Matter also introduces the new Gadgeteer class, a master of technology and engineering. Assisted by your AI companion, you can pursue the cutting edge of science, acquiring a mass of Gadgets and a wealth of knowledge along the way. This new base class comes with seven subclasses!
Grab the keys to your starship and launch into epic, collaborative starship battles against space pirates, cosmic dragons, and terrifying alien creatures!

No campaign in Dark Matter is complete without a starship! Build your own ship and customize it with Mega-scale weapons and an array of systems and upgrades. Whether it’s a rust-bucket jalopy or a cutting-edge cruiser, your ship is your crew’s home base and your ticket to freedom in the galaxy.

The greatest battlemap designers in the world, Czepeku, bring you a slipcase full of starships, megacity streets, asteroids, and alien worlds! These 50 beautiful battlemaps are curated for Dark Matter and instantly elevate your tabletop experience. And they're compatible with every TTRPG!
These maps are double-sided, dry- and wet-erasable (11 x 17"), and durable enough for years of games! And the entire pack comes in a beautiful, functional slipcase to keep the entire set organized.
ALL backers also get an exclusive 40% Off a 3-month subscription to Czepeku Sci-Fi!

Grax’s Club is a brand-new Dark Matter 200+ page hardcover campaign (levels 1-8) where you and your closest coworkers embark on a wacky series of space adventures. Each adventure is a whirlwind spoof of a beloved book, film, or video game. Explore the colorful recesses of a Willy-Wonka-inspired soda factory, go head-to-head in a Phoenix Wright style court of intergalactic law, and survive a ship of space vampires in a horrific send up of Alien.
Also available on Roll20, Alchemy RPG, Foundry VTT!

Contractor Corps is a brand-new anthology of Dark Matter adventures (levels 1-6) built around sci-fi battlemaps by Czepeku. You work for the criminal syndicate known as the Firm, picking up freelance jobs on the side to stay one step ahead of your ruthless AI overseer. Each adventure can be played as a one-shot or woven together into a sprawling criminal campaign. (Contractor Corps can be combined with Grax's Club for a single mega campaign!)
Also available on Roll20, Alchemy RPG, Foundry VTT!

Dark Matter: Sci-Fi 5E is compatible with the brand-new Valda's Spire of Secrets Class Update, which brings ten groundbreaking character classes to D&D 5E 2024! This means you can play a Space Cowboy Gunslinger, a Lunar space Witch, or a Cyberghoul Necromancer! (And, of course, you can find all of these classes for free on MageHandPress.com!)
Take a look at these Dark Matter campaigns to see real players and characters in the 'Verse!
Watch more Dark Matter here or here!

Dark Matter has been updated for the 2024 5th Edition ruleset with over 150 pages of new content. When you pick up Dark Matter, you’ll have the option to choose the new or legacy version of the book, using the 2014 ruleset. The Legacy version comes with a free Quality of Life Update PDF. The VTT of legacy Dark Matter is only available on Alchemy RPG.
Grax’s Club and Contractor Corps are compatible with both 2014 and 2024 5E.
The PDF Tier ($29) comes with a digital PDF for Dark Matter (2014 or 2024 version).
The Hardcover Tier ($59) comes with the hardcover Dark Matter book (2014 or 2024 version) and its digital PDF.
The PDF Bundle Tier ($69) comes with digital PDFs for Dark Matter (2014 or 2024 version), Contractor Corps, and Grax’s Club. Over 800 pages of content!
Note: This reward tier currently lists a hardcover for Contractor Corps instead of a PDF. We're working with Kickstarter to rectify that.
The Czepeku Battlemaps Tier ($119) includes the hardcover Dark Matter book (2014 or 2024), its digital PDF, and 50 Sci-Fi Battlemaps by Czepeku, and a digital version of the battlemaps.
The Digital Game-Ready Tier ($149) comes with everything you need to play online on a premium virtual tabletop:
Note that the 2014 legacy version of Dark Matter is ONLY available on Alchemy RPG. If you select Alchemy RPG, you get a VTT module for both 2014 and 2024.

Get the Mega Box Tier ($179) for all three hardcovers (Dark Matter—2014 or 2024 version, Grax’s Club, and Contractor Corps), their PDFs, a set of laminated essential handouts, and a high-quality 3-panel GM screen.
The Mega Box - Game Ready Tier ($249) includes everything you need to start playing today. It comes with:
If you want to pick up VTT modules, you can include them as add-ons or pick them up in the All-In Tier!
The All-In Tier ($399) comes with everything, including enamel pins, liquid core dice, VTT modules, and the Kickstarter-exclusive Grax’s Guys membership coin!

After backing any reward tier, you can add these great extras to your pledge! If you just want one or two items without a pledge tier, you can grab the Add-On Tier and pick up items ala carte! (Note: because of how Kickstarter calculates shipping, shipping is often cheaper on tiers than add-ons!)
As this campaign reaches certain milestones, we'll expand the Dark Matter book with new features and unlock standalone PDF expansions! ALL stretch goals are free to all backers.
We're only showing off the next one or two stretch goals at a time, so check back often to see what we've unlocked and what's next!
Click here to download a free sample PDF of Dark Matter: Sci-Fi 5E, including four subclasses, two species, and an overview of ship combat rules!
