comments.text: Hi! Is there a plan to support and update the foundry module post initial release to conform with whatever changes the foundry team makes on their end?

replies.text: That's a great question! Our Foundry specialist covers a limited period of update support and we plan to keep him on board for the next few big projects. I expect we'll have this up to date with Foundry changes for at least a couple of years.

comments.text: if I take the vtt one , can I have the pdf like the pdf bundle ??

replies.text: Hello, what I'd like to know is: if I buy the vtt module on roll20 for each campaign, will I get the campaign PDF in addition to the vtt? Two items instead of one?
Yes, if you get the Roll20 module for each campaign through the Kickstarter, you will get the PDF for that campaign as well!
nice. I change my participation so.

comments.text: Are any of the subclasses from the original Dark Matter release getting a 2024 update/refresh? If so, which ones? I have a Radiation Freak sorcerer in my current campaign, so I'd love to see it get some love.

replies.text: This is a great question! We've done a ton of work to update practically all of the subclasses. Some of them ended up very similar, like the Path of the Wrecker and some of them completely transformed for the better like the Space Cowboy and the Way of Gravity.

comments.text: Love your product but why are the dice 90 dollars?!

replies.text: Liquid core dice are expensive.
Unfortunately, this is basically the case. Our quote for the dice was about what we'd expect to pay for gemstone dice, or potentially a bit more if the order quantity is low.

comments.text: I’d love to see this on Demiplane!
I'm very curious to learn if your gageteer class is different from the one in Humblewood: Beyond the canopy, or is it more like a collab and expansion of that class?

replies.text: Our Gadgeteer is a totally different base class that's been around since 2016 or so, but the new Dark Matter book gives it a transformative rework. We have an update from a few days ago that talks a bit about its features.

comments.text: Is there a way to do the PDF bundle pledge but still get physical add ons? I am not seeing that as an option but I would really like to add on the dice.

replies.text: Hey Cori! Unfortunately, when a tier is digital-only, you can't add physical add-ons (it confuses the shipping pricing on Kickstarter's end, I think.) You can swap over to the Add-On tier and build your order entirely out of Add-Ons if that helps.
Okay, thank you. I'll take another look at it.

comments.text: Are the 50 maps not available at all for those not interested in the VTTs?

replies.text: Czepeku would rather we direct you to their site: https://www.czepeku.com/scifi. These maps are available digitally there  and all backers get an exclusive 40% off their first three months as a subscriber

comments.text: Are the PDF copies planned to be sent on March 5th, or is it just a later date in 2025? I have a campaign starting up in Dark Matter soon and wanted to know how to plan around starting with the new content!

replies.text: Which PDFs are we talking about, it said December 2026 in the digital pledge?

The PDF for Dark Matter (2024) is ready to go out and Grax's Club should be ready by March 19th (it's missing 2-3 art assets and needs some visual polish). An early print-and-play version of Contractor Corps should also go out around the same time.

Mage Hand Press that is a nice touch, most KS does the opposite and things get delayed beyond the time they mentioned, so nice to hear that we might get dark matter before the pledge delivery time, I do know delay can still happen :)

comments.text: I'm so excited for the VVT module! My friends and I have been planning a Sci-Fi campaign for ages but we never had a good one for Foundry until now

replies.text: I think you'll be very pleased with what we've been cooking up on Foundry!

comments.text: I was wondering, the Freelancer ship in the demo, which of the Czepeku spaceships would that be??

replies.text: You've hit on a really interesting thing. We constantly struggle with the question of size when it comes to our ships, battlemaps, and how they interact. Much like with regular D&D sizes, we've considered the area occupied by the ship a sort of maximum space it takes to fight effectively, which includes room for wings, engines, and other non-explorable parts of the ship. And even that leaves room for some insanely large battlemaps! So when it comes to the Czepeku maps, I'm sort of scaling down a bit for sanity's sake, but we can easily imagine a Transport-size ship being dramatically larger.
I had a look at some of the other ships, and I noticed that Razorbill could also be a good choice, it has sort of 1 hangerbay, and there can be one more with a bit of a visual modification.
If we're talking Czepeku ships generally and not just the ones I'll have in the printed set, I'm a big fan of the Hawkeye as a Transport ship/Freelancer stand-in.

comments.text: Hi, super excited to back this campaign.

replies.text: 1. Great question! The maps are all 11 x 17" folded down to letter size to fit neatly on your gaming shelf.
Awesome, thanks for the quick response.

comments.text: There seems to be a small error with the PDF Bundle description after ordering. The list of contents states it includes pdfs for Dark Matter and Grax's Club, but the hardcover for Contractor Corps, which can't be right.

replies.text: Hello! That’s a typo.. The PDF tier is completely digital, no physical items will be included.
Thank you for the confirmation.
You're welcome!

comments.text: Backed and looking forward to this. A couple of questions:

replies.text: I so have another question, is the GM screen (which I noticed says has ship combat) the same as the ones previously out? or is there changes? (so should I add one after already having one?)
Hey Daniel! Love to answer these.
This is awesome, thank you.

comments.text: Question for the dark matter kickstarter can i ask why the mega box is expected to take a full year extra to arrive compared to the All in box?

replies.text: Hello! That's a great observation! That is a typo... All of the physical goods should fulfill around the same time.
thanks
You're welcome!

comments.text: I would like to know if there is consideration for adding Fantasy Grounds to the VTT offerings?

replies.text: We're not currently considering Fantasy Grounds. Logistically, we can only support so many VTTs -- three is about our limit!

comments.text: I was gifted the "Book of Extinction" and was incredibly impressed. Glad I was one of those first 56 backers to help you hit the goal so quickly. No brainer choice from me :)

replies.text: That's amazing to hear! Thanks for supporting us on this one too <3

comments.text: What is the difference between the Space Cowboy subclass in your gunslinger class book and the Space Cowboy in the Dark Matter book?

replies.text: I might have seen the old version, level 10, 15, and 18 was not the same as in the demo, will the gunslinger be in the Dark matter book?
I ask as it seems odd to have to buy the complete Gunslinger book and the subclass being already in there, and then the same subclass being in the Dark Matter which will seem pointless.

All of MHP's classes are available for free on their website (with only one archetype). You can use that free class with the archetype found in Dark Matter, unless you want access to the other archetypes available in the Complete Gunslinger.

comments.text: Does the quality of life pdf bump the legacy 2014 version up to match the new 2024 version, or is there so much more to the 2024 version over the original? I’m just deliberating how far to go with add-ons 😁

replies.text: Great question! The Quality of Life Update brings the original book a little more in line with Tasha's or Xanathars (think better recharge mechanics, more flexible choices, and such). It doesn't attempt to add back the ~150 pages of new content in the new book.
Thanks!

comments.text: Is the only difference between the Meg Box and Mega Box Game Ready tiers the printed battlemaps?

replies.text: Thanks, that's how I was seeing it.
Oh *weird.* We might have set that price up a bit strangely. For most tiers, you'll lose about $10 in shipping doing that as an add-on (because of how add-ons are calculated) so it's kind of a wash
Ah, my bad, I didn't factor in shipping. That makes up the difference.

comments.text: Hi! I want the two versions of Dark Matter (2012 and 2024). Is necessary to pick another PDF on addons? I'm also a prebacker in your website (1$ for the coin), is required from my part to send you the screenshot or something?

replies.text: If you pick up Dark Matter (hardcover or PDF), we'll ask you after the campaign which one you want. You'll need to pick up the PDF twice if you want both versions.

comments.text: I might be missing it but I can't see a fulfilment timeline anywhere?

replies.text: There's an estimated delivery on each pledge tier. Expect all digital rewards to be fully finished by the end of the year, and physical updates finished next year.

comments.text: I see the maps in physical form come with the digital version, but not way to add-on *just* the digital version? I'm just backing at the base PDF pledge currently.

replies.text: Ok, this isn’t too bad.  Can we get a “list” of named maps that are being printed for the campaign so that we could go on their site and get them?
Sure thing! This is the list of maps in my prototype (non-final, subject to change):
Wow!!  That’s a great list.  Thanks!

comments.text: Would there be a way to get the 2014 quality of life pdf as an add-on? I plan on grabbing the 2024 version,  I already own the 2014 book and would like to have it for the sake of variable uses.

replies.text: The Quality of Life PDF goes out for free to anyone who picks up the 2014 version. And you should be able to download it wherever you picked up the original book. If you have any issues finding it, hop on our Support Page and we'll send it over: https://magehandpress.com/support/

comments.text: Woo funded! Congrats

replies.text: Thanks for supporting us!

project.name: Troy - Black Tales RPG [5e, OSE and Mork Borg compatible]
project.description: Discover the truth behind the myths in this grim and deadly RPG, join Ulysses' and Aeneas' crews and conquer the Mediterranean sea!

creator.name: Officina Meningi
creator.biography: Officina Meningi is a creative agency based in Padova, Italy. We create tabletop role-playing games, boardgames, gamebooks and more.

texte: Black Tales is a rules-light tabletop RPG for 1, 2 or more players compatible with 5e, Old School Essentials and Mork Borg.

[ITA] Enea ed Ulisse divennero mito e saccheggiarono il mondo conosciuto dopo aver distrutto la sacra roccaforte di Troia. Macchine del fato, carnefici senz'anima. I poemi dei vincitori ignorano l'eroismo disperato di quanti ne affrontarono l'indomabile avanzata.

Black Tales è un gioco di ruolo da tavolo per 1, 2 o più giocatori con regole semplici compatibile con 5e, Old-School Essentials e Mork Borg.

[ENG] Black Tales pledges and add-ons are available in two languages (English or Italian). At the end of the campaign you will be sent a survey to provide your address and select your preferred language.

[ITA] Le ricompense e gli Add-on di Black Tales sono disponibili in due lingue (inglese e italiana). Al termine della campagna ti verrà spedito un questionario per indicare l'indirizzo di spedizione e selezionare la lingua.

[ENG] Odyssey - Black Tales includes our original ruleset + the Odyssey campaign
You will be part of Ulysses' crew, the greatest liar in history, and rank in his small army of marauders. Will you partake in the pillaging of the Mediterranean or will you risk your life in an attempt to protect the peoples of the Great Sea? The choice is yours alone…

[ITA] Odyssey – Black Tales include il regolamento e la campagna dell'Odissea
Farai parte dell’equipaggio di Ulisse, il più grande bugiardo della storia, e dei ranghi della sua piccola armata di predoni.
Parteciperai al saccheggio del Mediterraneo o rischierai la vita nel tentativo di proteggere i popoli del Grande Mare? La scelta spetta solo a te…

[ENG] Troy - Black Tales includes 2 campaigns: Iliad and Aeneid
You’ll experience firsthand the siege of Troy — whether as the besieged or the besiegers — and will sail with Aeneas on the conquest of Italy, playing as part of his crew, or as part of the invaded Italic peoples.

To play Troy – Black Tales, you need the complete rulebook included in the volume Odyssey – Black Tales, or the Conversion Kit included in the Black Tales volume (in which case it will only be possible to play in 5e, MÖRK BORG, and OSE).

[ITA] Troy – Black Tales include due campagne: Iliade ed Eneide
Vivrai in prima persona l’assedio di Troia — come assediato o come assediante — e solcherai i mari con Enea alla conquista dell’Italia, giocando come membro del suo equipaggio oppure come parte dei popoli italici invasi.

Per giocare a Troy - Black Tales è necessario il regolamento completo contenuto nel volume Odyssey - Black Tales oppure il Conversion Kit contenuto nel volume Black Tales [in tal caso sarà possibile giocare soltanto in 5e, Mork Borg e OSE]

[ENG] Black Tales - Adventures and Conversion Kit 
This handbook includes numerous extra adventures and a simple and immediate conversion system for MÖRK BORG, OSE, and 5e. [ITA] Black Tales - Avventure extra e Conversion Kit
Il manuale comprende numerose avventure extra e una conversione agile e immediata per permettervi di giocare utilizzando le regole di Mork Borg, Ose e 5e.
[ENG] Odyssey - Black Tales won the trophy of Best Adaptation, thanks to the public vote at the NDU Awards 2024, a contest organized by the international website No Dice Unrolled.
[ITA] Odyssey - Black Tales ha vinto il titolo di Miglior Adattamento grazie al voto del pubblico agli NDU Awards 2024, il contest indetto dal sito internazionale No Dice Unrolled.

[ENG] The sole survivor of his troop of Marauders, with the world believing him dead or lost after years without sightings, Ulysses washes up on the island of Scheria and meets Nausicaa, daughter of the Phaeacian king Alcinous. Moved to pity, the young woman leads him to the palace, where he receives a hero’s welcome by the king and the promise of a ship to return home.

The castaway reveals to Alcinous that after a long series of trials, at the very last hurdle, his crew mates killed several of Zeus’ sacred cattle, and for that grave offence the God of the sky obliterated them all with lightning. Ulysses alone was spared.

[ITA] Unico sopravvissuto di un equipaggio di Predoni, dato da tutti per morto o disperso, dopo anni senza sue notizie, Ulisse naufraga sull'isola di Scheria e incontra Nausicaa figlia di Alcinoo, re dei Feaci. La giovane, impietosita, conduce l'uomo a palazzo e il sovrano accoglie l'eroe di guerra, promettendogli una nave per ricondurlo a casa.

Il naufrago, durante il suo soggiorno, rivela che, dopo aver affrontato innumerevoli prove, nell’ultima i suoi compagni hanno ucciso alcuni buoi sacri a Zeus e per questo oltraggio il padre di tutti gli Dèi li ha puniti sterminando i membri del suo equipaggio con un fulmine.  Tutti, a parte lui.

[ENG] Ulysses and his crew sacked and pillaged their way across the Great Sea, stealing treasures and oppressing its peaceful people. His ship bore no flags and the Marauders’ faces were concealed so as to avoid being recognised.

But the lost song of the Sirens tells of a small band of true heroes which acted, unbeknownst to their captain, to foil him and save as many people as possible from his bloodthirst. Their plan was to overthrow the tyrant Ulysses and end his streak of violence, but the legends do not say whether they succeeded.
Now, you are tasked with telling the true tale of the Odyssey.
LA VERITÀ È UN'ALTRA...

[ITA] Ulisse e il suo equipaggio hanno saccheggiato senza pietà il Mediterraneo, razziandone i tesori e riducendone in schiavitù le genti pacifiche.  La loro nave errava senza una bandiera e i volti dei predoni erano bendati, per impedirne il riconoscimento.

I canti perduti delle Sirene narrano però di un piccolo gruppo di eroi, che, di nascosto dal loro capitano, prestò soccorso ai popoli sotto attacco, salvandone il più possibile durante le ruberie, nel tentativo di ingraziarsi degli alleati.
Il loro obiettivo era spodestare Ulisse e mettere fine alle sue razzie, ma le leggende non riportano l'esito del loro piano.
Sarete voi a raccontare la vera storia dell'Odissea!

[ENG] In Troy – Black Tales, the war of Troy is not a tale of honor and predestination, but of conquest, cruelty, and survival. The Greek heroes are ruthless leaders, driven by pride and vengeance, and their followers are instruments of siege.

[ITA] In Troy – Black Tales, la guerra di Troia non è un racconto di onore e predestinazione, ma di conquista, crudeltà e sopravvivenza. Gli eroi greci sono leader spietati, mossi da orgoglio e vendetta, e i loro seguaci sono strumenti d’assedio.

[ENG] This handbook includes a simple and immediate conversion system that allows you to play the ruleset presented in Odyssey and Troy – Black Tales using your preferred systems: MÖRK BORG, OSE, and 5e. 

In addition, you will find numerous extra adventures that will let you face new stages in the journeys of Ulysses and Aeneas, pitting you against the Gaze of Medusa, the wrath of the Minotaur, the fury of the Harpies, and many more...

[ITA] Il manuale comprende una conversione agile e immediata per permettervi di giocare il regolamento contenuto in Odyssey e Troy - Black Tales con i vostri sistemi preferiti: Mork Borg, Ose e 5e.

All'interno, inoltre, troverete numerose avventure extra che vi permetteranno di affrontare nuove tappe nel viaggio di Ulisse ed Enea, mettendovi contro lo Sguardo di Medusa, l'ira del Minotauro, la furia della arpie e tante altre ancora...

[ENG] In Black Tales you can choose to play as Marauders, taking part in the pillaging and attempting to survive until the spoils of war are shared (fools!), or as Saviours, scrambling to save the peoples of the sea without being caught, and finally to gather allies and weapons to overthrow Ulysses or Aeneas when the time is right.

TO PLAY SOLO: The manuals will include rules to play Odyssey or Troy as a journaling game, with various prompts to select on every dice roll which will guide you in filling the ship’s log. You’ll be keeping track of resources and allies while the choices you make will determine both your fate and that of the people of the Great Sea.
FOR 2+ PLAYERS: A duet journaling game in which one player is always part of Ulysses’ raiding party while the other changes roles to represent the various peoples being attacked by the ancient hero.

FOR 3+ PLAYERS: Players will traverse the seas as Marauders or, as above, interpret the peoples who are being attacked and oppressed by Ulysses’ or Aeneas crew. The manual includes an original roll-under Old School ruleset developed by Andrea Rossi accompanied by maps, classes, magic items, equipment and monsters inspired by the classic poems. 

[Try it now - Download the Quickstart]

[ITA] In Black Tales potrete giocare come Predoni, partecipando ai saccheggi e tentando di sopravvivere fino alla spartizione del bottino (poveri illusi!), oppure come Salvatori, cercando di proteggere i Popoli del Mare o militando dalla parte degli assediati.

PER IL SINGOLO GIOCATORE: il manuale include un regolamento per giocarlo come Journaling Game, con numerosi spunti di avventura da selezionare con un tiro di dado che ti guideranno nella redazione del Diario di Bordo. Dovrai tenere traccia delle risorse e degli alleati e le scelte che prenderai nel corso delle varie scene determineranno il tuo fato e quello dei Popoli del Mare.

PER DUE GIOCATORI: il gioco si svolge come un Journaling Game, ma un giocatore farà parte dell'equipaggio di Predoni di Ulisse, mentre l'altro cambierà ruolo a ogni scena, vestendo i panni di un membro dei vari popoli rappresentante dei Popoli del Mare attaccati.

PER 3+ GIOCATORI: i giocatori condurranno la campagna come Predoni oppure, come sopra, vestendo anche i panni dei Popoli del Mare oppressi. Il manuale include un regolamento Old School originale sviluppato da Andrea Rossi, corredato da mappe, classi, oggetti magici, equipaggiamenti e mostri ispirati al celebre poema omerico. 

[Provalo ora - Scarica il Quickstart]
The Odyssey – Black Tales Map Pack includes 7 A4 tactical maps, plus the Map of the Mediterranean and the “Aeolus’ Deceit” Encounter Table:
The Troy – Black Tales Map Pack includes 6 tactical maps of various sizes, plus all unlocked Stretch Goal maps:

Last Sabbath - The Witches' RPG  is a masterless rule-light cooperative (or solo) tabletop journaling RPG that takes you and your Coven in a magical journey from the initiation to the confrontation with an awful threat, through the discovery and control of your consuming powers. The special limited-edition pack includes a Magic Pack consisting of:
Totem - The Spirits' RPG is a Narrative Map-Making Horror Role-Playing Game with simple rules inspired by classics of the Ghost Story genre. The Ghost Pack Includes...

MY COUNTRY DOES NOT SHOW AS AN OPTION
If you cannot find your countryas an option, please contact us so we can add it to the list of destinations.

WE CAN NOT SHIP TO THE FOLLOWING COUNTRIES
Russia, Ucraine, Belarus, Israel, Iran, Kazakhstan, and Afghanistan.

Unfortunately, the political situations, import laws and customs in some specific countries have made it impossible for us to ship to these countries.

IL MIO PAESE NON COMPARE TRA LE OPZIONI
Se non riesci a trovare il tuo Paese tra le opzioni, contattaci e lo aggiungeremo all’elenco delle destinazioni.

NON POSSIAMO SPEDIRE NEI SEGUENTI PAESI
Russia, Ucraina, Bielorussia, Israele, Iran, Kazakistan e Afghanistan.
Purtroppo, le situazioni politiche, le normative di importazione e le procedure doganali di alcuni Paesi rendono impossibile effettuare spedizioni verso queste destinazioni.
[ENG] Officina Meningi is an independent label of gamebooks and RPGs completely different, awarded with several important trophies!

The authors involved in our projects are established professionals and for Black Tales, we have created a spectacular team involving Valentino Sergi, author of the award-winning projects The Necronomicon Gamebook, The Horror Gamebook and many successful RPGs such as Blood Sword 5e, Brancalonia (4 ENnies Awards); Atropo Kelevra, award-winning designer of Last Sabbath - The Witches’ RPG and Totem - The Spirits’ RPG (written with Valentino); Andrea Rossi, curator of the italian edition of Old-School Essentials; The artists Jorge Coelho, Emanuele Ercolani, Marco Sada, Fabio Babich, Mimir, Valentina Tretola, Anita Zaramella, Francesco Biagini and Alessandro Amoruso; Moreno Paissan, cartographer for Free League, Acheron, Horrible Guilds and dozens of other publishing houses; Veronica Wu, twitcher and Old-School cartographer; Alberto Furlan and Ian Hathaway, translators and RPG authors; Annie Petronelli, historical consultant.

Special Thanks to Tavern Anime
[ITA] Officina Meningi è un’etichetta indipendente di librogame e giochi di ruolo completamente fuori dagli schemi, premiata con numerosi e importanti riconoscimenti!

Gli autori coinvolti nei nostri progetti sono professionisti affermati e, per Black Tales, abbiamo creato un team spettacolare che comprende Valentino Sergi, autore dei pluripremiati The Necronomicon Gamebook, The Horror Gamebook e di numerosi GdR di successo come Blood Sword 5e e Brancalonia (4 ENnies Awards); Atropo Kelevra, designer pluripremiata di Last Sabbath – The Witches’ RPG e Totem – The Spirits’ RPG (scritto insieme a Valentino); Andrea Rossi, curatore dell’edizione italiana di Old-School Essentials; gli artisti Jorge Coelho, Emanuele Ercolani, Marco Sada, Fabio Babich, Mimir, Valentina Tretola, Anita Zaramella, Francesco Biagini e Alessandro Amoruso; Moreno Paissan, cartografo per Free League, Acheron, Horrible Guilds e decine di altre case editrici; Veronica Wu, streamer su Twitch e cartografa old-school; Alberto Furlan e Ian Hathaway, traduttori e autori di giochi di ruolo; Annie Petronelli del Club delle Tovaglia, come consulente storica.

project.name: Project: Farmer Grandpa
project.description: An action game where you defend your farm from enemies

creator.name: Meyi Entertainment
creator.biography: An indie team focused on creating unique, fun, and memorable gaming experiences through creative design and strong gameplay.

texte: Roadmap:
Farming:
In this game, farming is not just for visuals. Every crop you plant has a meaning.
Your fields attract enemies at night. The more you grow, the stronger the threats become.
But this is also your opportunity. Defeating enemies gives valuable loot. That loot is what allows you to craft better gear, unlock new upgrades, and face even stronger challenges.
Your farm is your strength and your risk.
Progress Through Combat & Loot:
Enemies are not just obstacles. Each fight rewards you with materials, rare items, and resources. These drops are essential for crafting new tools, weapons, and farming equipment.
Stronger crops bring stronger enemies.
Stronger enemies bring better rewards.
This creates a natural loop of growth, risk, and progression.
Trading & Deliveries:
You are not farming just for yourself.
With your vehicle, you can deliver products to the town and complete orders for money and rewards. You can also sell your crops at the market. Sometimes for cheaper, sometimes for quick profit.
Choose your path:
Take safe deliveries, or take risks for bigger rewards.
Dangerous Wilderness:
Beyond your farm lies a vast forest waiting to be explored.
It is filled with hostile creatures, rare resources, and hidden opportunities. Some crops and materials can only be found there.
Exploration is risky but necessary.
If you want to grow stronger, you must face what lives in the wild.

project.name: The Path to Love: A Card Deck for Brave Hearts & Naked Souls
project.description: Your map for conscious love, authentic relating, and aligned choice. Every card is a mirror, a teacher, a spark.

creator.name: Linet
creator.biography: Cuban-born, now living in Denmark. I’m a trauma-informed relationship coach who helps people choose love with more honesty and heart. I created The Path to Love deck to make dating and connection feel safer, deeper, and more authentic.

titre: WHAT I’M RAISING FUNDS TO DO
HOW I WILL MAKE IT HAPPEN
WHO I AM AND WHY I CARE
texte:
The Path to Love is not another conversation deck.
It’s the first relational tool designed for the nervous system, not the performance self.
A structured, attachment-informed journey that teaches your body -not just your mind- how to feel safe, open, grounded, and connected
A path that meets you softly where you are and invites you deeper, one card at a time.

It’s the map you wish you had the first time your heart broke.
The first time you betrayed yourself to be chosen.
The first time you felt the quiet panic of wanting more but settling for less.
The first time you realized you were carrying patterns that didn’t begin with you.

Every card is calibrated to meet a core attachment need.
Every category is a step in the architecture of secure bonding.
Every question is a bridge between who you were taught to be… and who love is asking you to become.

This is not self-help nor entertainment.
This is a movement toward mature, conscious, emotionally regulated connection.
And it’s the beginning of a new way of loving. One that honors the wisdom of the nervous system, the truth of the heart, and the courage of the soul.
This deck is built for people who refuse to keep repeating the same patterns; who crave relationships where they can breathe, be themselves, and feel genuinely met.

Whether you are dating, healing, partnered, married and rediscovering each other after years together, or beginning again, this deck is a ritual of remembering your worth, your voice, your longings, your courage, your desires, your essence.

It is for the woman who knows she deserves more than breadcrumb intimacy.
For the man who wants to lead with presence instead of fear.
For every couple who has forgotten how to meet each other in the middle.
For every human who wants love that feels like home, not like walking on eggshells.

This deck is a companion for those who refuse to repeat the story of trading their authenticity for belonging.
For the ones who are done loving from fear, hunger, and survival.
For the ones who crave a love that doesn't cost them their nervous system.

This is the Path to Love. The real one.
The one your soul and nervous system recognise as home.
The deck is complete. The journey is designed. The prototypes are already touching hearts.
Now I’m raising funds for the first large, high-quality print run (using premium materials, sustainable production, and global fulfilment) so this tool can reach the people who
Bulk printing means better quality, sustainable materials, and affordable worldwide shipping, but it requires upfront capital. That’s why I’m here.

Most relationship tools stay on the surface.
Most dating advice keeps people in their heads.
Most conversation decks promise deep connection, without a structure to hold it.
This deck is different.

It meets the nervous system, not the ego.
It works with attachment patterns, not wishful thinking.
It guides people through connection in an arc that mirrors secure bonding rather than chaos bonding.

It helps you:
• slow down the anxious chase
• soften the avoidant armour
• regulate when intimacy feels threatening
• express needs without collapsing
• understand your emotional patterns
• repair instead of retreat
• leave relationships that hurt with clarity instead of confusion
• choose partners who are emotionally aligned
• deepen intimacy in long-term love
• stay rooted in yourself while staying connected

It’s not “a game.”
It’s a relational tool, gentle enough to invite depth, structured enough to prevent

The artwork is complete.
The categories are finalized.
The prototypes are printed and tested.
Manufacturers are lined up and ready, and digital bonuses and journals are in production.

Your support funding this campaign will go directly into:
• bulk printing & eco-friendly materials
• packaging & fulfillment
• global shipping preparation
• journals, guides, and digital bonus creation
I’ve worked in tech, product development, and communication for over a decade; execution is my comfort zone.
I’m Linet; Cuban-born, Denmark-based, a trauma-informed relationship coach, nervous system geek, mother, writer, and lifelong cycle-breaker.

I grew up in survival. Scarcity. Emotional unpredictability.
A childhood that taught me to stay quiet to stay safe. I became a trauma-informed relationship coach because I refused to pass that inheritance on to my daugther and future generations.

For years, I’ve helped singles, intercultural couples, expats, cycle-breakers, and women seeking love untangle patterns that block intimacy. The same conversations kept repeating:
“Why am I drawn to the wrong people?”
“How do I know if someone is emotionally safe?”
“How do I stay true to myself?”

This deck was born from that work.
From the tears, the breakthroughs, the softened shoulders, the repaired ruptures, the first moments, someone finally said:
“I feel safe. I feel understood. I can breathe.”

The Path to Love exists because too many people are walking through life longing for a connection that feels safe, sacred, and true, but not knowing how to build it.
This deck is not just a tool. It’s a gentle revolution.

Supporting this project means taking a stand for something rare in today’s world:
emotionally mature, consciously chosen, deeply rooted connection.
The kind of love that builds families.
The kind that softens generational wounds.
The kind we want our children to grow up inside.

This is more than a deck you can gift or use on date night.
It’s an heirloom of emotional safety.
A bridge between people who want to love each other well.
A small act of rebellion against the numbness, the rushing, the chronic self-protection, and the trauma patterns that have kept us from each other.

When you back this project, you’re not buying a product.
You’re joining a movement.
You’re helping me bring relational literacy, nervous system wisdom, and cycle-breaking tools into homes and hearts around the world.
You’re becoming part of my legacy... and maybe beginning one of your own.

For yourself.
For someone you love.
For a friend who deserves better.
For a couple learning to find their way again.
For a future family that hasn’t been born yet.

The most important things in life don’t have a price tag.
Love.
Loyalty.
Connection.
Attachment.
Belonging.

This project is an offering to all of them.
And I’m honoured you’re considering walking this path with me.

gone.name: Early Bird - The First Step on the Path
gone.desc:
For the first brave hearts who join this movement.
You receive The Path to Love deck — the entire journey in your hands — plus The Dating Companion Journal to deepen every prompt, integrate insights, and turn your dating life into a conscious practice rather than a guessing game.

A gentle, generous entry into the Path.
Lowest price this deck will ever be offered.

Available only for the earliest cycle-breakers.

project.name: Molecule Mayhem
project.description: Build molecules faster than your opponents but watch out for any sneaky lab mishaps that could ruin your progress!

creator.name: The Big Science Project
creator.biography: For 7 years I’ve run The Big Science Project, creating "aha!" moments for kids at my science events. To keep the discovery going at home, I have built an ecosystem of 4 science kits, 4 science activity books & a science themed card game. I’m crowdfunding to make science accessible to all.

titre: Why We Are Here & How We’ll Make It Happen
texte: We are The Big Science Project, a small team based in the heart of Mid Wales. Our mission is simple: to make science accessible, inclusive, and entirely unintimidating for everyone.

Until now, we’ve focused on creating educational books, home kits, and running live events to help children see the wonder in the world. But we realised something, kids shouldn't get to have all the fun! Many of our team’s best memories are built around after-work games nights, so merging the world of science with social play felt like a natural evolution. Molecule Mayhem is our way of bringing adults (and families) into the fold while staying true to our core ethos: clear language, inclusive design, and learning through laughter.

The Scenario: Welcome to the world’s most prestigious - and most chaotic -chemistry laboratory. You and your fellow chemists have been tasked with a monumental challenge: assembling the complex chemical structures that power our world. But there is a catch. The lab is short on supplies, the equipment is temperamental, and your rivals are just as determined to claim the Nobel Prize as you are!

The Chaos: In this lab, a steady hand and a sharp mind are your best tools. One moment you are perfectly bonding Hydrogen and Oxygen to create life-sustaining water; the next, a Molecule Mayhem event sends your research flying across the room. Safety goggles aren't just a recommendation - they’re your only hope when the experiments start to bubble over!
Your Mission:
Race to Build: Be the first to complete your chemistry goals.
Risk the Accident: Decide when to play it safe and when to push your chemistry to the limit.
Survive the Mayhem: Navigate the sabotage, accidental explosions, and the "Element of Surprise" to emerge as the lead scientist.

Being based in Mid Wales, we are passionate about supporting our local heritage and making science accessible in more than one language. We are thrilled to announce that Molecule Mayhem will be available in both English and Welsh. Every backer will have the opportunity to choose their preferred language version after the campaign concludes.

We have spent months refining the games mechanics, testing the balance of the cards, and perfecting the artwork and colour scheme. Now, we are ready to bring Molecule Mayhem to life, but we need your help to cross the finish line.
We are raising funds to:
Kickstart our first major print run: Your support will allow us to manufacture the game at scale, ensuring high-quality components and sustainable packaging from a UK based company.

Stock for Schools & Stores: Beyond just this campaign, we want to get this game into the hands of educators and local retailers. These funds will provide the initial inventory needed to begin distributing to schools and science clubs across the UK, helping us break into the wider market.
Logistics & Distribution: Funding will help us establish the shipping and storage infrastructure required to get the game from our Welsh headquarters to your front door efficiently.

At its heart, Molecule Mayhem is a social experience designed to bring friends and family together for a brilliant games night. Whether you're at the pub, gathered around the dinner table, or enjoying a rainy afternoon at home, the focus always remains on the laughter, the competition, and the shared experience of play.

Because the mechanics are intuitive and the language is clear, the educational side is simply a fantastic added bonus. This makes it just as effective in a classroom or a science club as it is in a living room; teachers and group leaders can pick it up and lead a session confidently without needing a PhD. It creates a relaxed space where you happen to pick up science facts while you’re busy trying to win!

The availability of a Welsh-language edition also makes this an ideal resource for bilingual classrooms and clubs. It creates a relaxed space where students and families can explore science in the language they feel most comfortable using, ensuring the focus remains on participation, laughter, and shared experience.

options.name: Sticker sheet
options.desc:

What’s Included: A mix of 10 stickers featuring hazardous waste symbols, key chemical elements, dramatic explosions, and molecular structures.

The Design: While the example image shows the vibe we’re going for, the final designs will be custom-tuned to match the ruthless and vibrant style of the card game itself.

Perfect for the fact-finders who want to show off their scientific side (or just for those who like sticking hazard signs on their lunchbox!)

project.name: My Home Games: Manage Your Video Game Collection
project.description: Play your video games directly from a modern, self‑hosted library that keeps your collection organized, secure, and reliably maintained

creator.name: Luca Stancapiano
creator.biography:
Luca Stancapiano is an Enterprise Portal Architect with over a decade of experience in the Java ecosystem, specializing in enterprise applications and client/server architectures. I have been active in the IT industry since 2000, building large-scale portal solutions with a strong focus on robustness, scalability, and long-term maintainability. Over the years, I have deepened my expertise around Java EE and JBoss-based stacks, working on complex environments where integration and reliability are critical.

I am responsible for defining portal architectures, choosing the most suitable technologies, and guiding development teams throughout the software lifecycle. I work to translate business requirements into concrete technical solutions, establishing standards and best practices that ensure security, performance, and ease of evolution over time. Daily, I collaborate with developers, operations, and stakeholders, acting as a bridge between strategic objectives and implementation details.

Beyond my day-to-day work, I contribute to the Java community through open-source initiatives and technical writing. I am the author of “Mastering Java EE Development with WildFly,” where I share practical guidance for building enterprise-grade applications based on real-world experience. Over time I have worked with and around platforms such as Apache, Alfresco, and Atlassian, which has helped me develop a pragmatic mindset focused on delivering reliable, maintainable systems that can grow with the needs of the business.

texte:
MyHomeGames turns your scattered video game collection into a single place where you can organize, play, and rediscover everything you own, from any device.​
It’s self‑hosted, multi‑language, Twitch‑enabled, and designed to be maintained and improved over time so your library never becomes obsolete.

It's raising funds to turn a solid self‑hosted prototype into a polished, long‑term platform where you can organize, play, and preserve your entire video game collection.​
These funds will support development time, infrastructure, usability improvements, and documentation so the project can stay updated, secure, and easy to use for years.​

I care deeply about this project because I am a lifelong gamer and developer who hates seeing digital libraries scattered across launchers and services, and I want players to truly own and control their collections.​
By shipping incremental releases, listening to community feedback, and keeping the codebase open and well‑documented, I plan to deliver a stable, maintained app that grows with its users.​

We currently have a version available for Mac OS X that I'll send as a reward, but there's still a lot to do:
- Version for Windows and Linux
- Ability to organize your games by platform, publisher, developer, category, theme, and custom collections
- Ability to choose the skin
- A listener that keeps you updated on the product
- Ability to view your custom lists in a table
- Alignment functions with IGDB and other gaming databases
- Running your games based on the chosen platform
- Alignment with your games on PlayStation, Steam, GoG, Xbox, and others
- Import tools from other gaming platforms
Another important thing for those who support the product will be the ability to decide on future implementations!

My Home Games is a self‑hosted software tool that helps people organize and manage their personal video game collection on their own server or computer.
This project does not include, provide, or distribute any ROMs, ISOs, BIOS files, or any other game media or content protected by copyright.
Backers will need to use only their own legally obtained games, in full compliance with copyright laws and with the terms of service of the respective platforms.

My name is Luca, and I am an Italian developer with experience in web applications and open‑source software, currently maintaining MyHomeGames as an Apache‑2.0‑licensed project.​
With your support, I can dedicate focused time and resources to make MyHomeGames the definitive home for your video game collection.​

texte: You begin as a former privateer turned pirate after being betrayed by a corrupt Sovereign Crown admiral. With a stolen sloop and a small crew of loyalists, you must rebuild your fortune and reputation in the dangerous waters of the Azure Shoals.
But the sea has its own rules, and **every plunder has its price**.
As you rise from a desperate fugitive to a feared captain, you'll encounter:
- **Legendary Captains** like "Red" Blackwood, Captain Sienna Drake, and Admiral Marcus Thorne
- **The Shadow Syndicate** - a mysterious organization controlling politics across the Shoals
- **The Obsidian Compass** - a legendary artifact that points to unimaginable wealth
- **Rival Captains** with their own ambitions and grudges

Your choices will determine your fate: Will you unite the pirates into a republic? Seek redemption through service to a crown? Pursue pure wealth at any cost? Or discover the truth behind the Shadow Syndicate?

project.name: Azzy Battles the Darkness
project.description: A 3D story driven platformer about technological misuse within an elementally charged land, and the adorable Felko, Azzy

creator.name: Celtic Dragon Studio
creator.biography: Solo dev in Scotland that's driven to create modernised experience inspired by ps2-era action-platformers!

texte: In this vibrant, Retro-inspired 3D action-platformer, a young Felko named Azzy sees his world flipped upside down by the sudden disappearance of his father and the emergence of an ancient, all-consuming Darkness. Thrust into a grand adventure, Azzy must channel the synergistic power of the elements through his trusty bionic arm, collecting upgrades and fighting to restore balance to the corrupted lands

Throughout your adventure across the world, you will meet Engineers that will tell you more about Azzy's dad and give you help gain more abilities that can be used for platforming, combat and puzzle solving
Use Chloromancy to turn your enemies into shrubs for a short time and grow platforms in set spots to reach higher places
Smash through large bolders to reveal hidden paths and delievery a devestating blow to enemies

Throw an icey ball and send out a shockwave on impact that will turn your enemies into a block of ice within the radius and can freeze some water to create temporary platforms of ice or stop water flow completely for puzzle challanges
Unleash a high-pressure jet to drench and repel lighter enemies. You can instantly douse flames and carve slick, temporary water trails across the environment
Throw fireballs to burn your enemies and reveal new hidden paths
Throw a ball of magma that will leave a pool of lava on the floor that will burn anything that it touches for a short time period
Get a short burst of the zoomies!
Use Electricute on your enemies to stun them and give them a shocking experience as well as on certain objects to power them

Some abilities can interact with each other and give slightly different effects e.g. use Chloromancy to keep your enemies in place and use Fireball on them will cause moredamage to the enemy, equally if the enemy if frozen or has the wet effect because they recently have been frozen or had Aqua Jet used on them, the Fireball will only give half the damage and wont cause a burn effect

Discover five vibrant, elemental villages. In every location, you'll meet new residents to uncover local lore and consult with their resident Engineer for essential elemental upgrades. Explore environments uniquely designed around their local element before confronting the region’s powerful, unique Elemental Boss

Azzy's journey will be blocked by five powerful Elemental Bosses, each with unique skills and powers designed to exploit your weaknesses and halt your progress
Here are the first three bosses you will encounter:

Greeser is a gigantic, corrupted plant spreading the darkness throughout the land. He uses his massive, corrupted roots to ensnare victims and poison the environment, slowly suffocating everything his tendrils wrap around

Davina is the formidable Captain of the Shark Pirates. She is so deeply favored by the sea and the ocean itself defends her, granting her unmatched command over the waves and currents as she fights to protect her bounty

Nergal was born from pure fire and has a passionate love for music. Using his blazing riffs and melodic chaos, he puts on a dangerous show, aiming to burn you with his blazing musical attacks before you can silence his destructive performance

I have set out to recreate the magic of the early 2000s 3D platformers a time of big characters, big worlds, and satisfying progression. My primary influences are clear, the smooth, engaging platforming, vibrant environments, and unique character upgrades found in classics like Jak and Daxter and Ratchet & Clank. If you loved mastering new abilities and exploring hidden corners in those games, you will feel right at home with Azzy
The game is guaranteed to launch on PC via Steam, and offering a DRM-free PC copy.

While I am pushing for a simultaneous console launch having been approved for Switch and currently exploring the path to Xbox and Playstation developer status the tight initial budget is focused on delivering a polished PC release.

I cannot promise a console version yet, but should I confirm an official release for the Nintendo Switch, Xbox or Playstation, every backer with a digital copy will be able to swap their PC key for a console key at no extra cost!
I am the solo developer behind Azzy Battles the Darkness, and this game is the culmination of over a decade of personal development experience.

The concept for Azzy has been percolating for many years, but it took time to truly realize its full potential. The game has seen a dedicated two years of active development, a period where the final vision the element combining 3D platformer took shape. I have also salvage and adapt some of my old work from 2020, when I first fully realized the scope and heart of the adventure Azzy was meant to be.

This long process ensures that every aspect of the game is carefully considered, from the design of all five core areas to the smooth integration of the Nintendo Switch dev kit. By backing the £75,000 goal, you're not just funding development, you're supporting the final, focused time needed to launch this decade-long dream at the quality it deserves
BETA Access
You will receive access to each area as it is polished and ready! meaning you don't have to wait for release day! Some aspects may still change from the BETA to the full release
ALPHA Access

Access to every single build until launch! You'll watch as each level goes from block out to polish. Play through the game with rough animations, characters and even design, have input and feedback into the final game, and watch as the game grows and changes.

My game has been planned out from start to finish. Each area and script laid out with a cost and a project plan, I know roughly how much this game will take to make. All of my budget thus far has come self funding, which I have put into polishing the Felko Forest, and the boss fight. I doubt I can hit the games full budget in one Kickstarter and will seek external funding for the rest of the goal

I don’t want to extend the current scope past what I've already planned for the game, but I’ve laid out the breakdown above for each area cost. The more that is funded and unlocked the less I need to get from investors, making it easier to fund but also letting me keep a bigger percentage of the game! I plan to make the entire game regardless, this is a intense passion project, but the more money here I can get the easier the process will be and the better quality work I can deliver!

project.name: Vic Allen | Let's make Album #2!
project.description: I’m inviting you into the process so we can make album #2 together THIS YEAR, along with a ton of other fun extras!

creator.name: Vic Allen
creator.biography: A country-pop artist with a love for telling stories about life, love and adventure.

texte: I can't quite believe it's been three years since my debut album, Some Place I'd Rather Be. I've learnt so much since releasing that little collection of travel songs, and this time I want to do things a bit differently.

Some Place I'd Rather Be came together slowly over the course of a few years. I think the first song came out in.... 2018?! I don't want to make you wait that long for Album #2. You've already heard many of these songs, you've been asking for them, I've been playing them live... and you deserve them right now!

As you know, I'm 100% independent. That comes with a lot of creative freedom, which I love, but having no label also means that every part of making an album has to be funded by me, which is the main reason it’s taken so long to get new music out.

For this album, I’ll still be covering a large portion of the costs myself, but this Kickstarter is about giving the project an initial boost - so instead of waiting another three years, I can give you Album #2 THIS YEAR!
Just to break it down for you, costs include:

I've learnt how to do several of these things myself, like editing videos, but even though I'm learning, production for this album is something I don't want to compromise on, which is why I'll be working with Barnabas Shaw, the incredible producer who recorded a lot of my first album.

I am SO excited to start this process and have you involved every step of the way! It's been so fun getting to know you more and more over the last few months, both online and at live shows, and I'm so grateful for your support I can't even begin to explain.
THANK YOU for being a part of this album! We have 30 days... let's see if we can do this!!!
Vic 💛

project.name: Otway: The World Record
project.description: celebrating the thirty-three and a third anniversary, the band circumnavigate the world, gigging, recording an LP, a film and book.

creator.name: John Otway
creator.biography: John Otway is an English singer-songwriter who has built a sizeable cult audience through extensive touring, a surreal sense of humour and a self-deprecating underdog persona.

texte: 20 Years after I should have flown around the world with my band on the World Tour - A project that ended up as a disaster - I decided that this was unfinished business and decided to finally take them on a proper circumnavigation. I've had a couple of hits, made a movie and had two autobiographies, but not yet toured the world with my band, which of course I need to do in order to call myself a proper Rock Star.

Turns out that March 2026 coincides with the thirty three and a third anniversary of the band. Yes, we've been together that long without a line-up change, which is some sort of long playing record. Hence the idea of recording an LP with one side recorded in the Southern hemisphere and the other in the Northern hemisphere. It will also be available as a CD.

It has been 10 years since Montserrat, the last studio album we recorded together, so I reckon it's time to have a go at another. As well as the gigs, studios have been booked in Vancouver, New Zealand, Australia and Japan.

Travelling with us on the tour to film the adventure is Steve Barker (who directed "Otway the Movie") and David Painter, a cameraman who has just filmed "Seven Marathons in Seven Continents In Seven Days".

One of the books that had a huge influence on me before my career began was Ian Hunter's "Diary Of A Rock And Roll Star" - A chronicle of Mott The Hoople's 1972 tour of America. So I'm also writing a diary to cover this project. It might not be as influential as Ian's book, but I have had a really good reaction to the two books I've written and hopefully this one will please and amuse you too.

The crowdfunder package is any combination of the Picture Disc, Paperback, DVD, and CD. If anyone is interested, I'll also include handwritten lyrics (as they proved really popular when we crowdfunded the Montserrat Album) and a couple of other amusing bits from the upcoming tour. All the artwork for the album and book etc. that I've included on these pages are for guidance only to give an idea of what we are producing, with the final designs to be revealed later.
This whole project is costing me a fortune - So if you fancy helping by pre-ordering anything that you fancy, it will severely lessen the ouch and be really appreciated.

project.name: Brooke Annibale: New Songs, New Depths of Inspiration
project.description: I found the joy of making music again. I'm writing, producing, and mixing new songs myself. With your help I’ll have a new album.

creator.name: Brooke Annibale
creator.biography: Not confined by any one genre, Brooke's expressive and beautifully thoughtful songwriting creates a dreamy, dark, and enticing sonic landscape.

texte: For the first time ever, I’m producing and mixing my next collection of songs myself. I’m almost there, and I need your help carrying it over the finish line.
This is my first Kickstarter since 2017, when so many of you helped to release Hold to the Light in 2018. I’ve never forgotten that support, and hope you'll join me for this new adventure.

In 2022, I shared the news that I’d signed a record deal for my album Better By Now. About a year after its release, the label decided to drop me. The reason they gave is that it hadn’t generated enough streaming revenue (a reminder that Spotify pays roughly $.004 per stream). I had hoped for a long-term partnership, one that would support making music for years to come. Instead of giving it more time and believing in my music, things ended abruptly and sent me back to square one. I had to rediscover why I make music in the first place.
So here I am with no team and no funding. Just me, doing it all, and redefining what “all” means every single day.

The surprising part? This process has made me feel like a kid again. After more than 20 years of making music, I’m learning new things constantly, getting deeply inspired by the craft in a way I haven’t felt in years.

After months of coaching and continued mentoring from the phenomenal Christian “Leggy” Langdon (producer of Better By Now), and countless hours of meticulous work since, I’ve grown more than I ever expected. It’s been slow, quiet, sometimes invisible growth, but I hope you’ll hear it in the songs.

These songs are the most hands-on, personal work I’ve ever made. I’m incredibly proud of them and genuinely excited to share them with you. I've given this project literally everything I've got, and I'm not going to stop now.
If my music has ever meant something to you, would you support my next chapter? 💛
PS. REAL TALK

I’m sipping my coffee. I’m reading the news. I’m heartbroken daily, enraged often, and feeling powerless frequently. I’m watching violence and cruelty and being told it was deserved. I’m watching the government murder citizens and grab children from the street and being told it’s lawful. I can’t look away. But my heart can’t take anymore. I also cannot pretend that something dark isn’t happening.

It's a crazy time in the world. Honestly, I feel quite ridiculous promoting my work in the middle of the chaos unfolding daily. I do not agree with the current US administration's actions, even if most days I don't know what to do. I believe in freedom and human rights. I believe in empathy and kindness. I also believe that we all need to do what keeps us sane and softhearted, so we can keep fighting the good fight. Music keeps me sane. It provides a little bit of light in the dark. It connects people. I want to connect with you.

project.name: "Bridges" - World-Fusion Album by Tau Ensemble
project.description: Our second album bridging Middle Eastern Maqam, Jazz Harmony and Desert Grooves

creator.name: Tau
creator.biography:
Tau Ensemble, formed in 2022 in the Negev desert,
is a German–Israeli world-fusion group blending
the various ancient traditions of Maqam, the
improvisational freedom of Jazz, and the tribal
grooves of the eastern Mediterranean. 
Their music creates a bridge between cultures, shaped by their
backgrounds in the Middle East and Europe.

titre: Our Journey So Far
How your contribution will be used:
texte:
Hi! We are Tau Ensemble - a German-Israeli world-fusion band, formed in 2022 in the heart of the Negev desert by five musician friends:
Miri, Jonas, Or, Almog, and Nadav.

This spring we want to bring our new Album "Bridges“ alive - by producing it professionally and manufacturing an physical Album. Our intention is to build bridges and inspire our community to do so as well. 
Bridges between tradition and modernity, between the inner and the outer world, bridges between people. Creating space for peace, honesty, authenticity, cultural exchange and healing.

Coming from different cultural and musical backgrounds in the Middle East and Europe, we met at the Internal Compass Institute in Mitzpe Ramon, southern Israel, with the same intention: Fully committing to developing our skills in music.

Our music was born from the silence, vastness, and raw landscapes of the desert. In this timeless environment, listening became a central part of the creative process; listening to the land, to one another, and to the sounds that emerged between us.

Initially being jazz students, we soon discovered our mutual fascination with "Maqam" - the modal system at the heart of much Middle Eastern music. What began as curiosity quickly deepened into a dedicated and ongoing artistic collaboration.
Over the past four years, we have:

Our upcoming album, Bridges, is a natural continuation of this journey - and a deeper exploration of it.
Musically, the album weaves together:
In this live session you can get an idea of how this might sound like:

But “Bridges” is not only a musical connection - it is also a deeply human one.
With our music we aim to go beyond geographic, cultural and political divides to create a common space in which openness and honest exchange can exist naturally.

The album will feature the voices of Israeli and Palestinian children, sharing their thoughts about what they would need in order to cross a metaphorical “bridge” to the other side. These short, honest reflections will be embedded in our music throughout the album as a subtle emotional thread, offering a sincere, human perspective that anchors the music in the reality in which Tau was born and continues to exist. 
The voices do not aim to explain or resolve - they simply remind us why bridges are needed in the first place.

Just like each piece of music carries a story that can only be understood by listening carefully, so does each culture and each human being carry its own truth that reveals itself when we are patient and persistent enough to look beyond outer appearances.
By making these principles audible with our music, we invite you to keep your ears and hearts open as the music itself turns into the bridge on which we meet in authenticity.

By supporting this campaign, you are not only helping us record an album -
you are enabling us to work with professionals we deeply respect, and to offer our community the best possible listening experience. By that, you help us bringing our vision of building bridges alive.

“Bridges” will be recorded in March 2026, and we have chosen to create it independently in order to preserve full artistic freedom - and to give this music the best possible sonic home for our listeners.

After taking a deeper look into the production processes of our favorite artists, all paths led us to the same source: Shahar Kaufman of Onyx Studio, renowned for enhancing the warm, natural, and transparent sound we were searching for.

At the moment, Shahar is based in Portugal, where he runs a studio surrounded by nature and serenity. This added logistical layer is part of our choice to not compromise on quality, and to create “Bridges” in the best possible way.
All the extra funds will flow into one of these projects:
We chose to crowdfund this project because we believe in creating this album together with our community.

This is an all-or-nothing project:
If we reach our goal, the album can come to life.
If we don’t, the project cannot move forward in this form.
This also means that you will only get your reward and pay the money for it if we successfully finished our campaign.


Therefore every contribution - big or small - truly matters.
To appreciate your support, we’ve created a range of rewards:

Each reward is another bridge - between us and you.

Find all the rewards in our offerings list.

Important note:

- All pictures in the rewards sections are examples, the final products may look slightly different.
- Estimated delivery of local rewards (e.g. Almog's house) is just the latest possible delivery time. The actual delivery time is very flexible and depends mainly on your availability.
Our music seeks to be a meeting place - between cultures, between people, and between inner worlds.

Now we invite you - our listeners, supporters, and fellow human beings
to be part of the next chapter.

Help us record “Bridges”
and turn this connection into reality.

Thank you for being here,
Tau

comments.text: Hello

project.name: Stunt Double ROC Debut Album
project.description: Let's make this debut album one to remember! This project will feature our original songs for all to hear!

creator.name: Elaina Alston
creator.biography: Hi I'm Elaina, band leader of Stunt Double! I'm creating this Kickstarter in hopes of having the funds to create our debut album.  We've had some studio sessions for the three songs we already have released but an entire album is a HUGE undertaking.  Any help counts and we hope to share this album with you all next year!

texte: Three years ago, Stunt Double was just a dream, a crazy idea.  As cliche as it sounds, that's just the honest truth.  Elaina Alston wanted to create a band in the Rochester scene that stood out from the rest.  Jam Bands, Cover Bands and Jazz make up the demand of the scene and she wanted a group that could do all three at the same time.  Finding the talents of musicians along the way helped the band carve out a unique sound filled with funk, soul, blues, R&B and new roots!  Soaring vocal harmonies, spontaneous jams and groove driven vibes are the driving force in any live performance for Stunt Double. Last year, the band made a return to the Rochester Lilac Festival and premiered their new original songs.  After such positive reactions from the crowd, the band decided to pivot into the direction of creating a debut album to showcase their hard work.  Creating any musical work is no small feat and an album is no different.  Songwriting and Studio sessions take countless time, energy and dedication for any project with the goal of creating original work.  Stunt Double has experienced so much growth since the beginning and this debut album would cement their place and build a foundation for their future as musicians in Rochester and beyond.   There are hopes that this album will reach new areas allowing for the band to tour later this year. With your contribution, Stunt Double moves forward with their goals as professional musicians!

project.name: Stations / Ghostland EP VINYL / Produced by Martin Hannett
project.description: Stations’ unreleased 1982 3-song EP Ghostland, recorded with producer Martin Hannett (Joy Division) finally released with your support.

creator.name: No Sé Discos
creator.biography: No Sé Discos is a family-run art and music collective based in Brighton Park, Chicago, operating outside the traditional art and music industry. Founded by brothers Angel and Jorge Ledezma and Lupe Martinez— all members of the music group Allá— we have been featured in Chicago Reader, The Guardian, Pitchfork, PBS, SPIN, VICE, BBC and NPR. Allá was founded in 2003.

texte: " Chicago’s Greatest Post-Punk Obscurity Returns from Oblivion." Steve Krakow   Chicago Reader (2022)
“ I always thought David & George should have gotten more recognition”  Steve Albini (2022)
While active in the late 70s and 80s, STATIONS (led by David Stowell and George Black) released only one single. But behind the scenes, they were building a formidable legacy:
The 808 Pioneers: They were among the first in the Midwest to wield the now-legendary Roland TR-808.
The Albini Connection: Steve Albini new to Chicago joins Stations on briefly on bass before starting Big Black.

Missing Link between Manchester Sound and Chicago: In 1982, Martin Hannett—the architect of Joy Division’s Unknown Pleasures—flew to Chicago to produce an EP for them. Due to industry feuds and Hannett's personal struggles, those master tapes were never finished.
For forty four years, these tracks existed only on a single "time capsule" cassette heard by fewer than 20 people. Until now.
We are ready to go to the plant. The artwork is done. The audio is mastered. We need $7,500 to manifest this music into the physical world.
This is a "One and Done" release:
Limited to 500 copies on heavy Blood Red Vinyl.
Includes the Hannett Poster: A poster-sized replica of the original 1982 recording contract between STATIONS and Martin Hannett—a true piece of music history saved from the flames.
Strict Limit: 2 copies per order to ensure this reaches the fans.
The Hannett Sessions: All three tracks produced by Martin Hannett in Evanston IL USA and mixed at Strawberry Studios
The Studio Archive: Unreleased studio material produced by the band, showcasing their mastery of the 808 and early goth textures.
Live Evidence: Rare recordings from legendary venues like Tuts, capturing the raw intensity of their live lineup.
The Condensed History of Stations: 1978–1982
Written by David Stowell

In February of 1978, George Black auditioned for the band, which had just formed. The original lineup included Marty Binder (drums), Andy Cers (bass), Ed Yeo (guitar), David Stowell (guitar), and George Black (vocals). They made their debut at Katzenjammer Kids on Wells Street in Chicago in the early Spring of 1978, with a set of original material fleshed out by covers including Buzzcocks, Television, Magazine, Ultravox, and Gang of Four compositions.

These were among the bands we all liked, but there were lots of other influences happening. Pere Ubu got listened to quite a bit, as I remember. Also straight-ahead rock like Sex Pistols, Generation X, 999, The Jam, and The Damned. We also dug Bowie, Iggy, Kraftwerk, and many others.

That original lineup lasted about six months, playing clubs like O'Banion's, Huey's, Ann Arkee's, and The Gazebo. The band got a taste of the deep corruption of the entertainment scene in Chicago and the creepy hand of Organized Crime which hung over everything like a poison gas. The details of this part of the story are rather grotesque and definitely not to be repeated here.

Ed smashed his Les Paul to bits one night at O'Banion's in classic Pete Townshend style and Andy Cers left the band to go to Architecture School in Minneapolis, Minnesota. That was the end for STATIONS Part One.George Black - Stations - 2023 - Photo by Randy Corwin

George Black and David Stowell stuck together and moved into a dilapidated house at 1648 West Bloomingdale in the Wicker Park neighborhood of Chicago. The house had been tenanted previously by The Dadistics, another outsider band on the scene. We found copies of their single sleeves scattered around the house. And needles.

In February of 1979, a year after meeting, on a bitter cold night in a van with a broken heater—our legs wrapped in blankets and plastic trash bags—a song came on the radio and the opening bassline of Joy Division's "Transmission" started up. As I listened to the way the song developed and the way it sounded, I KNEW that I was hearing the sound of the future, and I knew I wanted STATIONS to be part of that sound, part of that future. We put together some songs and started rehearsing with Greg DeLap on keyboards, Stevo Georgiafandis on drums, and Dexter Veka on bass.

We recorded two songs at Studiomedia in Evanston and produced our own single, putting it out on the (unregistered) DuVall Records in August of 1979. It was the era of the end of Stadium Rock. John Bonham died; Led Zeppelin announced their retirement and put out their last record about the same time we put out our first. Zeppelin's last single "Fool in the Rain" sold hundreds of thousands of copies. Stations' first single "Against the Grain" sold, well, a few hundred.

I bought the Joy Division LP Unknown Pleasures and discovered the name of the producer, Martin Hannett, and began seeking out any record with his name on it. George discovered the name of the London distributor of Factory Records, Pinnacle Entertainment in Orpington (Bromley), London. We sent a copy of the STATIONS single to Martin Hannett c/o Factory Records c/o Pinnacle Entertainment. Somehow it made it into his hands and ears. We had thrown a piece of plastic across the Atlantic Ocean hoping it would land in Manchester, and somehow it did.

Some months later, if my memory serves it was in March of 1980, we got a call at the Bloomingdale house. A fellow with a pronounced Mancunian accent who identified himself as Martin Usher, "a friend of Hannett's," was hoping to stop by for a visit. "I'm calling from a Vienna restaurant," (calling that place a restaurant was a very kind thing) "but having trouble finding your address." Our place was stuck between an ancient railroad siding and an alley; no street access. We gave him instructions and he stopped by.

Soon we were sitting down with Martin Usher, who was not only a friend of Hannett's but a skilled engineer who wound up building the gear that would make New Order's sound possible some months later. Usher was and is one of the most brilliant computer heads one could ever hope to meet. Some months later he invited us to visit Manchester during the Christmas Boxing Day holiday of 1981. England was in the throes of Thatcherism and celebrating the marriage of Prince Charles and Lady Diana. Strange Days had found us.

In the meantime, things were changing at the Speed of Life for us. Stevo left to join Al Jourgensen's new band Ministry; Dexter and Greg moved out west. Our sculptor friend David Kotker brought Steve Albini to meet us at the Bloomingdale house and we did a few months' work with him, doing demos on cassette and playing one gig with him at the old Exit on Wells Street on December 17th, 1981. It was at this time we acquired a Roland TR-808 Rhythm Composer and began using it. I found that I could trigger stuff off the TR-808 through my ARP 2600 three-oscillator analog synth, and that opened up a whole new texture for us. We played that one gig at Exit with Steve Albini on a night upon which there was a vicious ice storm in Chicago, but still the place was packed. Not a horrible gig; we even did a cover of John Cooper Clarke's "Strange Bedfellows" and a little Lotte Lenya for good measure. But things didn't work out with Steve Albini. Steve liked to play his bass with the treble cranked all the way up, more in the guitar and vocal range of frequencies than the bass, so it became a really midrange-dominant sound. George and I both felt that Steve would take off better doing his own sound, and it turned out he did just that with Big Black.

George and I kept scouring other bands for drummers and bass players. Frank Brodlo was working with a few different bands, including The Cunts and Painter Band. John Elliot was in Chicago working, and we managed to convince both of them to join STATIONS. We began working in earnest, writing new material rapidly and getting ready to play live gigs. In my mind, that was the best iteration of Stations: Frank, John, George, and David. We just clicked.

We played better venues—Tut's on Belmont, Cabaret Metro, and multiple shows at the 950 Club (also known as Lucky Number). We were asked to do the support slot for Joy Division at Tut's on May 27th, 1980. All the musicians and music fans in Chicago were excited, none more than we, but it was not to be. Ian Curtis killed himself on May 18th, 1980, in Manchester, just nine days before the Chicago gig. Everybody was crushed. The gig had been sold out for weeks. Joy Division was no more.

So, in the summer of 1982, Martin Hannett and Susanna O'Hara (code name Susanna O'Hooligan) flew to Chicago and we did the three-song session for the proposed EP at Studiomedia in Evanston. That same weekend we played a backup slot at Cabaret Metro behind Killing Joke, and Hannett did live sound for us. Killing Joke got paid in little bags of smack. I asked Joey Shanahan for cash for our fee. STATIONS wasn't a drug band at all; a tall can of beer at the end of rehearsal was our limit.

Hannett, on the other hand, was a down-for-the-crown smackhead, "chasing the dragon" as they say. It was a stretch for us to score gear for Hannett, and led to some weirdness, but all in all, it was exciting to have Martin in Chicago working with us. Smack or not, Martin had great ears and was a wickedly smart and talented musician and bassist, and a likable, generous guy. How many artists did he encourage and promote? The Buzzcocks, Magazine, John Cooper Clarke, The Psychedelic Furs, The Only Ones, Durutti Column, Nico, The Names, ESG, Stations, and Happy Mondays, to name a few.

He had a slightly bemused, slightly manic, slightly cynical sense of humor. One thing about producing artists—you can try molding them, scolding them, or controlling them, or just finding and bringing forward something they themselves aren't aware of in their work. Martin was ready to jump in and help, ready to experiment until something started to click. I only wish we could have done more with him. I remember sitting in the control room with him; he was looking around at all the effects and processors and he turned to me and said:
"We're all going to be replaced you know... It's all going to go digital, everything... no more tape, no more musicians, no more me, no more you."
Martin brought two books with him to America:
The Elvis Presley Biography
The Physician's Desk Reference (in order to determine what might cover for smack from the tourist crap that might turn up. No fool there.)
I think I told him that I thought he was nuts, but he wasn't. He was right. He saw the compressed, sterile, ugly, inhuman future of popular entertainment 41 years ago and tried to warn me about it.

We did the three songs—"Climate of Violence," "Demonstration," and "In Defense of Cosmetics"—and Martin and Susanna scampered back to Manchester with the 24-track master on 2-inch tape. Eventually, Martin sent us a cassette of his mixes, done at Strawberry Studios in Stockport (former studio home of 10cc).

This project sat frozen for forty-four years. What you're listening to now has been heard by less than 20 people in the entire span of its existence. The almost illegible underside of the crumpled box of Fascist Candy Corn of Ronald Reagan and Maggie Thatcher.
“Martin was ready to jump in and help, ready to experiment until something started to click. I only wish we could have done more with him.”  - David Stowell
George Black (Stations)
David Stowell (Stations)
Produced by Martin Hannett (Factory Records, ESG, Joy Division, Magazine, The Psychedelic Furs, A Certain Ratio, The Stone Roses, Happy Monday)

Mixed by Martin Hannet at Strawberry Studios, Stockport UK
