project.name: ULTIM8 JIG - Print Bed Alignment System for EufyMake E1
project.description: Precision alignment made effortless. Protect your plate from overspray, lock in repeatable alignment, and turn complex jobs simple!

creator.name: Peter Solomon
creator.biography:
Peter Solomon was born in Philadelphia, PA USA. 
He graduated from Pratt Institute, New York in Industrial Design. 
In California for the next five years he designed museums, computers and peripherals, furniture, lighting, toys and interiors. During this period his work was also represented in five different galleries in New York, San Francisco and Los Angeles.

In 1993 he moved to Milan, Italy to obtain a masters in industrial design from Domus Academy. He then collaborated with different influential designers and was project leader at Isao Hosoe Design for 6 years. In 2000 he established his studio in Milan where they designed a great variety of products such as cell phones, furniture, lighting, office furniture, sporting equipment, train interiors, etc.

He also founded two start-up companies XOX Audio Tools and Altra Design.
With the ambition of helping developing designers, Peter Solomon taught master, undergraduate, and professional courses in industrial design at the Instituto Europeo di Design, Milan, Italy.
In 2010 he returned to the to the USA as Chair of Industrial Design and 6 programs at SCAD, Savannah College of Art and Design.
He then became Design and Marketing Director for Marblue in Hollywood, Florida. 
In 2015, peter solomon design was re-launched in South Florida where it continues to thrive and grow. Peter Founded Wham Bam Systems in 2018 to address the need for useful upgrades to 3D printers and now spends a good portion of his time running the company.

Peter Solomon’s work is part permanent collection of design at the Chicago Athenaeum Museum, has been published in over seven books on design, hundreds of magazines.
Hi work has received many prestigious awards including; Compasso D’Oro 1998 & 2004, Bio 16 Lubiana 1998, IF Design Award 1998, American Package Design Award 2014, Chicago Athenaeum Good Design; 1998, 2000, 2004, 2006, 2007, 2013, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2012.  Design Innovations 1999, International Design Yearbook 1999 & 2000.

titre: The Problem:  Why Setup Still Slows You Down
What Makes the ULTIM8 JIG Different than the EufyMake Bed?
Why this Kickstarter is Low Risk
The Birth of the ULTIM8 JIG
texte: The Ultimate Precision Print Bed Upgrade for EufyMake E1

Precision alignment made effortless.
Protect your build plate from overspray, lock in repeatable alignment, and turn complex jobs into simple, confident prints—again and again.
Designed specifically for EufyMake E1 users who want faster setup, cleaner results, and workflows that feel calm, reliable, and repeatable.

Kickstarter pricing starts at $99
Save up to 30% with limited Super Early Bird rewards
First 1,000 kits ship within 3 weeks of campaign close
(Taxes included in Kickstarter prices)
The EufyMake E1 is a powerful and flexible machine. Like all advanced tools, it benefits from the right workflow support.
If you print regularly, you’ve likely experienced some of these common frustrations:
None of these issues are flaws in the machine—they’re signs that the workflow needs a better system.
ULTIM8 JIG is a precision alignment and holding system designed specifically for the EufyMake E1.
It replaces disposable, improvised setups with a durable, repeatable, modular system that turns alignment into a one-time decision - not something you solve over and over again.
With ULTIM8 JIG:
ULTIM8 JIG is not a flat mat or a workaround—it’s a complete alignment system.

Precision hole grid
Ø5 mm holes spaced 10 mm apart, with each row offset by 5 mm, create consistent reference points across the entire bed.

Modular FIXTURES and CAM LOCKS
Secure flat, thin, tall, round, or irregular objects without custom bed-sized jigs.

High-grade silicone MATS
Flexible, durable, and resistant to UV overspray—designed to last the life of the machine.

Built-in repeatability
Once a setup works, it stays working. Print, remove the part, drop in a new blank, and print again.
This is how industrial workflows feel—translated to a desktop machine.

1. Place the MAT
Lay the ULTIM8 JIG MAT on the E1 bed, align it once, and secure it with the included SPRING CLIPS.
2. Add FIXTURES (and CAM LOCKS if needed)

3. Print with Confidence
Your part stays locked in place - square, repeatable, and aligned to your artwork. Overspray is contained to the MAT instead of accumulating on your build plate, and when it does occur, it peels off easily.

4. Print Again - or Flip
For repeat jobs, simply place a new blank into the same fixture setup and hit reprint - no repositioning or re-alignment required.
For double-sided prints, flip the part between FIXTURES and reprint with confidence.

5. Clean Up in Seconds
Overspray peels off easily:
Best for most EufyMake E1 users
Best for users with more than one EufyMake E1
Best for users filling the bed with fixtures and printing many objects at once

All ULTIM8 JIG kits support full-bed printing.
The difference is how many parts you want to fixture and print at the same time.

Backers receive exclusive Kickstarter pricing as a thank-you for supporting the launch.
Super Early Bird rewards are limited and available on a first-come, first-served basis.

Fulfillment begins shortly after the campaign ends.
The first 1,000 kits ship within 3 weeks of campaign close, with remaining orders shipping approximately eight weeks later.
Wham Bam Systems began the way many great maker companies do: with frustration, curiosity, and a deep love for building things better.

Founded in 2018 in Florida by industrial designer Peter Solomon, Wham Bam was born from decades of hands-on experience in both industrial and desktop 3D printing. Long before affordable desktop machines existed, Peter was actively working in professional print labs, operating high-end industrial systems that cost hundreds of thousands—and in some cases millions—of dollars. That background shaped a clear expectation: printing workflows should feel precise, repeatable, and reliable.

As desktop and prosumer 3D printers became more capable and accessible, a pattern emerged. The machines themselves were improving rapidly—but the workflows around them were still full of friction. Setup took too long. Small mistakes caused wasted time and materials. Simple jobs often felt harder than they needed to be.

Peter began designing upgrades, tools, and process improvements to close that gap—bringing industrial-style confidence and repeatability to desktop machines. At first, these solutions were shared openly through forums, videos, and community discussions.
Then something unexpected happened.
Users started asking him to stop explaining how to build the solutions—and instead, just sell them the product.
That moment marked the beginning of Wham Bam Systems.

From the start, the mission has been clear: make 3D printing easier, more fun, and more productive. Every Wham Bam product exists to remove friction, reduce failure, and give users confidence—so they can spend less time troubleshooting and more time creating.

Today, Wham Bam products are used by hobbyists, engineers, print farms, cosplayers, miniature and RC builders, small businesses, and industrial users around the world. While those users are diverse, the goal remains the same: tools that work reliably, feel intuitive, and elevate the entire printing experience.

Wham Bam designs and develops products in-house and works closely with long-standing engineering and manufacturing partners in Taiwan and South China. This hands-on approach allows tight control over materials, tolerances, tooling, and quality—ensuring products are not just well designed, but well executed.

While Wham Bam has received industry recognition and awards, the real validation comes from the community itself: the messages, reviews, photos, and stories shared by customers who rely on these tools every day.
We stand behind our products because we use them ourselves - daily, in real workflows - just like you will.
Jeff Turner brings together engineering rigor, hands-on testing, and real-world workflow insight.

An engineer with a background in law, Jeff brings together technical depth, structured thinking, and a relentless drive to improve how things work. He is deeply passionate about 3D printing and making, and has spent years beta testing, advising, and collaborating with Wham Bam Systems and other respected companies in the industry.

Jeff’s approach aligns perfectly with Wham Bam’s mission. He focuses on removing friction, simplifying workflows, and making tools that feel intuitive and repeatable. Through his company, Psycho3D, Jeff takes bold ideas and pushes them through real-world testing until they become practical, manufacturable, and reliable products.
Jeff doesn’t design in theory - he designs from experience.
The ULTIM8 JIG was born from real-world frustration.

After nearly a year of hands-on testing with the EufyMake E1, Jeff repeatedly encountered the same issues: slow setup, inconsistent alignment, and a lack of repeatability that made even simple jobs take longer than they should.
Instead of accepting those limitations, Jeff began sketching solutions—asking how the experience could be easier, more fun, and more productive without compromising precision.

When Jeff shared the concept with Peter, the alignment was immediate. Together, they refined, engineered, tested, and reworked the system until it met Wham Bam’s standards for durability, precision, and real-world usability.
No shortcuts. No compromises. Just a better workflow.
ULTIM8 JIG doesn’t change what your machine can do—it changes how it feels to use it.

Less friction.
Less waste.
More confidence.
Back now to secure limited Super Early Bird pricing and make every print feel like it should.

comments.text: I'm backer 1,010, if 10 people back out of the kickstarter will I be included in the first 1,000 shipment?
I am buying this for my Xtool UV printer. I know it is not the correct size BUT, I want to get in on the price discount.

replies.text: Hello Ambrose, thank you for your request however, I’m not sure that’s the right decision, the bed size and the clip system will be completely different. I’m not sure when we are going to make it for X tool it really depends when we get designs for the actual bed and can develop the system, the fixtures and magnets and backing plates will be the same but the mats and the clips will not

comments.text: Is there another color option?

replies.text: Hello David, sorry, no. These are made with a gorgeous orange color that helps to differentiate parts from the build plate when matching up graphics in Eufy Studio

comments.text: Is Canada shipping from Florida or China? It's odd we have the highest shipping price.

replies.text: Hello Aaron, I will check again tomorrow. What USA to Canada prices are until now. It made more sense for us to ship directly from China and to import to USA with high tariffs and then ship again to Canada.
Hello Erin. Sorry for the name error I was dictating.

comments.text: I don't suppose you can teach EUFY how to give information to their backers properly...

replies.text: I am not one to teach other companies, but I do hope they can catch up and solve their issues, from what I understand they sold more than anticipated and scaling such an ambitious product is hard.  I do hand it to them, early beta testers told me they recalled many hundreds of machines when they found an issue that happened after a theoretical many year life cycle. So it does seem they are striving for the best quality and just running into hiccups.  However more communication always helps.

comments.text: I saw orange accessory boxes for the alignment pieces in another video not on Kickstarter.

replies.text: Hello Todd, I see Joy replied, thank you Joy.  Did you find it?
I did, indeed, find it.  Thanks very much!  I will be printing them out well ahead of time.  Since I'm backer #1091, my deadline is April.  Should be enough time  😆
Super! let us know how they turn out!

comments.text: Where do I find my backer number?

replies.text: •	The backer number appears in the pledge confirmation email Kickstarter sends immediately after the pledge.
Thank you...It tells me how many there were before me and adds 1 to the total.  I'm under 1,000.  Early backer!  3:13pm PDT.
I’m glad I could help. I’m glad you’re well under the 1000.

comments.text: Calibration Sheets?  Just got my printer and haven't opened it or gotten ink.  What are these for?

replies.text: Hello Bryan, it’s best that you read the update on Kickstarter update page I give a full explanation of how to use them once you open your machine you’ll understand more thank you
Sorry for spelling your name wrong Brian. I was trying to answer questions while driving big mistake.

comments.text: Will the super early backers in the UK be part of the first 1000 shipment , or will they be after that coming straight from the factory ?, thanks

replies.text: Hello Shane, the first thousand kits ship at the same time from Florida to USA customers and from China to worldwide customers, if you were in the first thousand group, your products will be shipped at the same time

comments.text: I think this project is long overdue for an update!!!

replies.text: Sorry about that. I only recently realized that updates were posting everybody’s email frequently now I’m saving updates till the end of the day.

comments.text: 😂 ich glaube ich werde zuerst die Matten bekommen bevor der Drucker bei mir eintrifft.

replies.text: I do hope you get your machine as soon as possible, but we will be shipping on time

comments.text: Hello, I can't add n the calibration sheets they are not listed under the Add Ons. Is there something I am doing wrong? I got the doulble pack and wow what Ive seen so far its going to be a game changer. Thank you for this great addition to the printer.

replies.text: Hello Glenn  thanks for the nice comment.  You will be able to add add-ons when project concludes and kickstarter collects your pledge

comments.text: Quick question, will all the teirs come with atlease one alingment sheet? its not listed on the 99$ tier? dont you need atleast one sheet to align the orange jig to the printer? :)

replies.text: Hello Dorine, only the Deluxe kit comes with Calibration Sheets, you can always add after as Add-on, and you don't need them to align the ULTIM8 JIG to the printer, they are used for printhead set up and calibration, do see our Update about the use.
I did check your add ons but could only see the magnets atm. We dont actually have our printers yet in the UK so assuming we will get some from EufyMake directly when we open the box :D
You should be able to add things when kickstarter begins to collect pledges

comments.text: Well, I was supposed to have left Kickstarter for good, because I don't like FOMO marketing and risk-backing, but here I am. I don't feel like designing and printing out custom jigs, which overrides the dislike for Kickstarter. I wish you all the best for a smooth and successful campaign.

replies.text: Hello Eboni, thank you very much for backing us. I can assure you this one will bring back your confidence in a Kickstarter campaign! and you are going to love using the ULTIM8 JIG!

comments.text: I'm trying to add some add-ons but its not working

replies.text: Hello Jean Carlos, I am trying to resolve this with Kickstarter, but you can go ahead and back the project and add them on at the end of the campaign when you get your survey
I’m already a backer(341) so I’m still able to add the calibration sheet?
yes you will be able to!

comments.text: I see a flat silicon mat without any holes, is this also included? I didn't see it as an addon.

replies.text: You can use the rear side of the ULTIM8 JIG MATS as a flat silicone surface. If you are intending as surface protection for the desk, you can check out Wham Bam's high grade Slap Mats: www.whambamsystems.com/pages/slap-mat
Thanks for this info. I'm curious what more accessories there will coming for the E1. I'm really hyped. Can't wait to start.
thanks Jean Ricardo! not sure what others are coming yet, but we will announce them as soon as they are ready!

comments.text: If we backed at super early bird and addon some calibration sheets, will they hold up the shipping?

replies.text: they should not hold up shipping

comments.text: I’m in! Super Early Bird! I do wonder if I’ll receive the jig before the printer! LOL

replies.text: Happy for you and hope your E1 comes soon!
Im in the UK so in the same boat and maybe an even later boat :D ETA April here if im lucky!
Same here

comments.text: What is the calibration sheets? And do I need it?

replies.text: Hello Marshall, thanks for the great question, just posted to Updates for all to see.

comments.text: What time did this officially start?

replies.text: sorry officially it launches at 10 AM EST but was open at 6AM EST for our mailing list subscribers

comments.text: that went quickly :(

I just posted shipping estimates and information to the updates!

replies.text: Just checking... your update states all taxes included.  Would this also include import duties, or do you have a system arranged for this?  Import duties are the major sting in the tail for many KS campaigns...

Hello David, they should be inclusive of import duties with taxes pre-paid. Of course, we cannot help what happens on import end, but each shipment will come with invoice showing taxes and duties paid.

comments.text: So new to Kickstarter, how do I know which kit I will have or do I have a choice at a later date? Backer#37 BTW fantastic idea!

replies.text: you will need to choose a kit if you want the Super Early Bird or Early Bird discounts, Kickstarter allows you to change your pledge later at time of check out, but you may not have the options of the early pledge discounts. to know which kit is right for you, please study the listing for each and the story description.

replies.text: wonderful!

project.name: ARCH:The World's First ML‑Powered Wearable Walking Simulator
project.description: Boost Circulation│Walking Cycle™ Technology│Predictive ML Analytics│Lightweight & Wireless │ Designed for Stillness

creator.name: ARCH Technology
creator.biography:
ARCH is more than a product, it’s a health-conscious approach.
We believe the most effective way to protect health is by preventing disease before it begins. ARCH empowers individuals and communities by emphasizing the importance of movement, offering high-tech solutions to address one of today’s most urgent challenges: physical inactivity.

texte: *Introducing the ARCH V1 Carbon: a Kickstarter-exclusive edition crafted for those who demand performance, durability, and timeless design. This model features an ultralight yet incredibly strong case made from Carbon Fiber Reinforced Polymer (CFRP), built with a thermoset matrix for maximum resilience. The front panel is precision-machined from aerospace-grade 7075 T6 aluminum, combining structural integrity with refined aesthetics.
While most materials are stamped or molded, carbon fiber must be placed and cured by hand. That makes every ARCH V1 Carbon not just strong but personal.

ARCH represents a conscious approach to health. Preventing illness is more important and effective than treating it. By emphasizing the importance of movement, ARCH embraces a preventive approach against health challenges. It aims to spread this mindset from individuals to society and to develop high technology to strengthen public health.
ARCH can be comfortably used all day long thanks to its lightweight and wireless design. It is easily placed below the knee.
Designed for everyday use, ARCH aims to transform passive moments into opportunities for healthier living.

Truly adaptive.
ARCH doesn’t focus on where you are, it focuses on what your body needs. It isn’t tied to a place, a time, or a routine; whether at home, at the office, on a flight, during travel, or post-workout, it adapts to the signals your body gives. ARCH is designed to transform moments of stillness into personalized, active circulation support.
We developed The Walking Cycle™️ technology to recreate the natural muscle pump, aiming to promote positive effects on circulation.
With its specially designed belt and Nano technology, it stays breathable at all times and prevents sweating.

Its lightweight, wireless, and portable design makes it suitable for use in any setting. Whether you’re commuting, relaxing at home, or traveling, it helps you stay active. It adapts to your daily lifestyle and never holds you back.
It adjusts its intensity based on real-time data. Becomes more active when needed. Energy efficiency and user comfort are provided together for a continuous 12 hours.

Even the internal placement of the battery has been carefully designed; its position is optimized through thoughtful engineering approaches to ensure balanced weight distribution along the leg. Compliant with international shipping regulations.

This Walking Simulator with Walking Cycle™ technology is designed to simulate up to 60 steps per minute even while sitting still. By mimicking the natural rhythm of walking, it helps support healthy circulation during periods of inactivity.

* Our companion mobile app is still under development and not yet functional. The prototype you see in the video operates entirely independently from the app, showcasing the ARCH device’s core mechanical functionality with complete clarity. The device can be used in full capacity without the mobile app.

Developing the app is something our technical team can complete in a short timeframe. That’s why, at this stage, our full focus is on enhancing the device firmware, specifically its machine learning capabilities and predictive analytics features. We’ve already made significant progress in these areas and are approaching the final stages of our comprehensive testing process.
Transparency and open communication with our community are our top priorities. We’re confident the app will be ready well before final delivery, and we’ll keep you updated every step of the way.

The ARCH ML mobile app is being designed to be compatible with both iOS and Android. Planned features include data visualization, user-oriented insights, doctor sharing options, and over-the-air firmware updates. It is built with a feedback-driven development approach, with updates planned every three months based on real user input.

ARCH doesn’t just react it learns and evolves. Powered by machine learning (ML), it continuously analyzes your circulatory patterns and adapts itself to your individual needs to operate in the most effective way. The longer you use it, the smarter and more precise it becomes.

The device can operate independently without the app. However, sensor data is transmitted to the app in real time, enabling users to instantly monitor their circulatory metrics. This highlights that ARCH is not just a passive tracker, but a smart, dynamic system that personalizes itself to you.

After each session, the app will aim to provide feedback that helps make the experience more intuitive and personalized, which may include general observations on physical changes and estimated levels of circulatory support provided.
Negative pressure pulls the accumulated load in the legs inward, while positive pressure pushes it upward. This cycle contributes to supporting healthy circulation.
By aiming to support circulation, it seeks to contribute to the reduction of tissue swelling. Better oxygenation is intended to promote positive effects on overall tissue condition.
It also aims to help alleviate sensations of fatigue and swelling. Designed to provide supportive effects against circulatory discomforts.
45% of people in the U.S. live a sedentary lifestyle.

Such inactivity may gradually affect the body’s natural circulatory rhythm, often resulting in leg discomfort, swelling, and a sense of heaviness. When the muscle pump remains inactive, gravity may cause blood to collect in the lower limbs, leading to a disruption in overall circulation.
Even sitting for more than one hour can trigger these risks.
Circulation in the body isn’t powered by the heart alone. The calf muscles in the lower legs contract and relax with each step, helping push blood upward. This mechanism is called the muscle pump.

When walking, the muscle groups connected to the Achilles tendon function like a second heart, pumping blood upward against gravity with every step. When inactive for long periods, this pump stops working, circulation slows down, and symptoms like swelling and heaviness in the legs may occur.
Human bodies weren’t made for stillness.

For thousands of years, we moved to survive to hunt, to protect, to explore. For centuries, we lived through physical labor, using our bodies to build, carry, and create. But the last few decades introduced something evolution didn’t prepare us for: sitting. Our circulatory system wasn’t built for this new lifestyle.
Gravity works against us when we’re seated, and our natural “second heart” the calf muscle pump stays dormant.
How can we preserve an ancient biological system in a modern sedentary world?

We’ve developed a device that goes beyond tracking one that aims to proactively support the body against the negative effects of inactivity. To achieve this, we brought together experts from health sciences, biomedical engineering, and industrial design.

At ARCH, we believe innovation must serve well-being.
Every component from the pressure sensor to the adaptive pulse module has been intentionally designed.
Every line of code is programmed to respond in real time to your body’s needs.

Compared to traditional methods that support circulation only 1–2 times per minute, ARCH is a patented and innovative system designed to simulate up to 60 steps per minute even while sitting still. It creates a negative-positive pressure cycle across an 8 cm area of the lower leg and is engineered to synchronize with the body’s real-time circulatory rhythm, completing each cycle within 1–2 seconds.

This cycle is performed using high-tech robotic microactuators equipped with specialized sensors. First, three of the microactuators retract to create negative pressure, drawing the accumulated load in the legs toward the device. Then, all four microactuators apply positive pressure to push this load upward. Each cycle replicates the effect of a natural step, mimicking the muscle pump to help support healthy circulation. The system is designed to promote optimal blood flow and deliver consistent, responsive support, even during periods of inactivity.

ARCH is equipped with sensors for heart rate, tissue oxygenation, edema, and motion. Sensors capable of detecting heart rates between 30–220 bpm, SpO2 levels between 70%–100%, and tissue impedance for edema transmit data to microcontroller with ARM Cortex-M3 core. The device is designed to respond in real time to the body’s needs, adjusting its operation automatically based on the situation.

ARCH is equipped with sensitive sensors that continuously monitor pulse, tissue oxygenation, and edema data from the user. These sensors provide ultra-precise measurements, keeping the system actively operating at exceptional efficiency.

ARCH uses machine-learning-supported algorithms to analyze collected biometric data, aiming to detect potential circulatory changes before they become apparent. It also provides data sharing options for digital health records and professional consultation if requested. All data is kept private and shared only with the user’s explicit consent.

With its predictive AI-supported analytics, it aims to detect changes in body data in advance and take action before potential imbalances occur. Through regular use, it supports healthy circulatory function, helps reduce the risk of swelling, and aims to enhance overall quality of life. Its portable, lightweight, wireless, and mobile app-integrated design offers a uniquely seamless experience in the market.

Because programmable robotic microactuators capable of meeting ARCH’s precision and speed requirements hadn’t reached this level of development until now. ARCH became possible only as this technology matured.

The founders of ARCH brought together their 15 years of experience and strong background in vascular health, along with a deep commitment to preventive care. With a vision to address circulation challenges before they become critical, they set out to develop a solution rooted in early intervention and long-term well-being.

Developed by a multidisciplinary team of health tech specialists, engineers, and software developers, ARCH introduces a new category in life-style technology. Its proprietary “walking simulator,” powered by machine learning, actively analyzes user data to support circulation and predict potential risks enabling a smarter, more proactive approach to health.
Bigbang Startup Challenge 2025
There are many sources of inspiration in ARCH’s design journey, but its main inspiration came from the calf muscles where the device is worn its form is shaped by the anatomy of these muscles.

Each step moved us closer to impact.
Explore the key moments that shaped the ARCH journey.
ARCH represents a conscious approach to health grounded in the belief that the most effective solution is prevention. Rather than treating illness, ARCH aims to prevent disease before it arises by:

Emphasizing the importance of movement, and spreading preventive healthcare from individuals to society. 
The ultimate goal: strengthening public health at its core.
Thanks to ARCH’s preventive impact on circulatory disorders, it aims to help reduce overall healthcare spending.
By defining the concept of a “Walking Simulator”, ARCH aims to pioneer an entirely new product category.
Legacy Edition symbolizes your lasting impact on ARCH’s future.

*Introducing the ARCH V1 Carbon: a Kickstarter-exclusive edition crafted for those who demand performance, durability, and timeless design. This model features an ultralight yet incredibly strong case made from Carbon Fiber Reinforced Polymer (CFRP), built with a thermoset matrix for maximum resilience. The front panel is precision-machined from aerospace-grade 7075 T6 aluminum, combining structural integrity with refined aesthetics.
While most materials are stamped or molded, carbon fiber must be placed and cured by hand. That makes every ARCH V1 Carbon not just strong but personal.
Every ARCH V1 Carbon device includes five years of complimentary technical service (shipping excluded).
This edition is available only through Kickstarter and reflects the very essence of ARCH: engineering health-forward innovation with elite-grade materials.

As a Legacy Edition backer, you’ll gain access to The Founders’ Room, a series of private online events just for you. You’ll meet the founders, get a close look at our workspace, hear feedback from early users, and join a live Q&A session.
The events will take place after product deliveries are completed, with Legacy Edition units shipped first as a priority.
The ARCH Legacy Wall
As a Legacy Edition supporter, your name won’t just appear it will be permanently engraved on the ARCH Legacy Wall, our official tribute page dedicated to those who helped lay the foundation of ARCH.
This digital wall on our website is more than a list; it’s a symbol of gratitude, a living record of the community that helped bring ARCH to life.
Long after the campaign ends, your name will stand as a reminder: you were there when it all began.
At ARCH, we are confident that all shipments for this project will be fulfilled completely and responsibly. Keeping our promise to our backers is our highest priority.
All progress, timelines, and logistics updates will be shared transparently through Kickstarter.

To ensure flexibility and accuracy amid ongoing global shipping cost fluctuations, shipping fees will be charged after the campaign has ended, closer to the delivery date. Address details and shipping payments will be collected through our pledge manager, PledgeBox, via a post-campaign survey.
We offer worldwide shipping.

For key regions, products are shipped through regional fulfillment hubs to ensure predictable delivery and pricing. For all other countries, shipping fees shown are estimates and may vary based on destination, carrier, and local regulations. All shipments are sent under DAP terms. Local taxes, duties, or handling fees may apply and are the responsibility of the backer.
Estimated Prices
United States $10 – $15
Canada $20 – $25
European Union $15 – $20
United Kingdom $30 – $35
Turkey $5 – $10
Singapore $15 – $20
Australia $30 – $40
New Zealand $35 – $45
Middle East $25 – $35
Asia (Non-hub countries) $25 – $40
Latin America $30 – $45
Africa $35 – $50
Rest of World $25 – $55
Shipments to the US and EU will be fulfilled via regional fulfillment centers to help avoid unexpected delivery issues.
Shipments to the UK and Canada may be subject to local import taxes, VAT, or handling fees depending on regional regulations.

Shipping fees do not include VAT or other local taxes. Any applicable taxes or import charges are the responsibility of the backer. We recommend checking your country’s regulations in advance to avoid inconvenience.

Estimated delivery timelines will be confirmed after the campaign, once production and logistics are finalized. Throughout this process, we will continue to provide clear and timely updates to keep you informed every step of the way.

While developing technologies that serve human health, ARCH is committed to the principles of scientific accuracy, respect for individual rights, data security, and social responsibility. Every product we develop is designed with attention to individual safety and quality of life; it is offered to users only through scientifically validated, transparent, and verifiable systems. Personal health data is processed only with explicit consent, in a limited and purpose-specific manner; the rights of data owners to access, control, and delete their information are always reserved.

ARCH pledges to promote and sustain decision-making processes based on ethical values at all organizational levels. All development and implementation processes are conducted with consideration for societal impact; no commercial goal ever takes precedence over public health or ethical principles. Ensuring that our technology is accessible, trustworthy, and human-centered for everyone is the foundation of our corporate stance.
This project is featured on HugeBackers, a community of over 169,000+ Backers that has raised creators over $100MM to date.

gone.desc:
ARCH V1 Carbon a Kickstarter-exclusive edition built for those who value performance and timeless design. It features an ultralight, high-strength Carbon Fiber Reinforced Polymer (CFRP) case with a thermoset matrix for maximum durability. replies.text: ARCH is essentially a walking simulator, so the main situations where it wouldn’t be appropriate are the same situations where walking itself is contraindicated. If walking is considered safe for someone, ARCH is designed to be safe in that same general sense. The main additional exception relates to the built-in bioimpedance sensor: bioimpedance technology is generally not recommended for people with implanted electronic devices such as pacemakers. Outside of those cases, ARCH is intended to support normal circulation during everyday inactivity.

comments.text: Ce commentaire a été supprimé par Kickstarter. En savoir plus sur les directives applicables aux commentaires.

replies.text: Not exactly. The nervous system doesn’t interpret it as real walking in the full neurological sense, because actual walking involves complex motor commands from the brain and active muscle contraction. What we’re doing is different: we mechanically reproduce key elements of the walking cycle that are responsible for supporting circulation. This means we’re targeting the peripheral physiological effects of walking especially the circulatory dynamics rather than trying to replicate the brain’s motor patterns. In short, the goal isn’t to trick the nervous system into believing you’re walking, but to simulate the parts of walking that help keep blood flow active during inactivity.

comments.text: Ce commentaire a été supprimé par Kickstarter. En savoir plus sur les directives applicables aux commentaires.

replies.text: It’s much closer to everyday wellness. ARCH wasn’t designed as a rehabilitation device it’s built for normal daily life, specifically to support circulation during periods of inactivity like sitting or working for long hours. While some of the underlying principles overlap with ideas used in rehab (like improving circulation), our focus is preventive, everyday support rather than clinical rehabilitation.

comments.text: Ce commentaire a été supprimé par Kickstarter. En savoir plus sur les directives applicables aux commentaires.

replies.text: Muscle fatigue is typically addressed through recovery strategies that aim to increase circulation. The goal is to deliver more oxygen to the muscles and help clear metabolic by-products by improving blood flow. That’s why common recovery approaches include light active movement, compression, and other circulation-focused methods. Most solutions in this space focus only on recovery — improving circulation after fatigue has already occurred. Our perspective is different. With the technology we’re developing, we aim to support circulation strongly, but the key point is what happens before fatigue becomes the issue. Even when muscles aren’t tired, inactivity itself slows circulation. We focus on the importance of keeping this system active and supporting it during every period of inactivity.

replies.text: Hello Chris, I understand your question very well. ARCH is not a medical device. It is prohibited to feature medical devices on Kickstarter. Based on past experiences, getting a clinical study published in a peer reviewed journal often takes 1 2 years. And before that, the same physician must conduct a long term follow up of at least 1 2 years using the same ultrasound with the same focus group (at least 100 people), provided that all devices given to those 100 people are identical. I am pointing this out so you can estimate the 2 4 year delay it would cause both you and us if a clinical study were a requirement. Furthermore, a clinical study is not expected for a wellness device; the necessity for clinical studies applies only to medical devices. Our habit of conducting scientific studies stems entirely from our past experiences and scientific approach. Therefore, we have tests and reports created with a scientific approach within our own organization to find answers to questions such as how it can be better, what the real life impact is of what we propose in theory, and what the results of comparisons with traditional methods are. This is simply a matter of principle and habit. However, besides all this, if you examine recovery systems that have existed for more than 20 years, you can see the traditional methods of what we promise. You can find the opportunity to verify this approach to the muscle pump, which has existed for many years, through these examples.

project.name: KAI: AI Sales Intelligence for Global SaaS Growth
project.description: An AI-powered platform that helps SaaS teams sell globally with accurate, culturally aware communication

creator.name: Angelica Santos
creator.biography: Founder and CEO of KAI, an AI-powered sales communication platform for SaaS teams expanding globally. MBA graduate with 9+ years of international B2B sales experience, building practical AI tools that improve clarity, accuracy, and cross-cultural selling.

texte: KAI is an AI-powered sales communication platform for SaaS teams selling internationally.

It consists of two core products: an AI sales email widget that helps reps write accurate, culturally appropriate messages in real time, and a central CRM dashboard that gives founders and sales leaders visibility into how their teams communicate across markets.

As SaaS companies expand globally, deals are often lost not because of weak products, but because sales communication is technically accurate yet culturally misaligned. KAI helps teams sell globally without hiring local sales teams by embedding product knowledge and cultural intelligence directly into everyday sales workflows.
KAI is a B2B SaaS platform made up of two connected components:

1. An AI Sales Email Widget
Used directly inside email and CRM tools, the widget helps sales reps generate accurate, culturally adapted responses during live sales conversations. It stays aligned with fast-changing SaaS products and adjusts tone, structure, and framing by market.

2. A Sales Intelligence Dashboard
The dashboard gives founders and sales leaders oversight of international sales communication. It helps teams maintain message consistency, spot risks, and understand how communication differs across regions, all without manual review.
Together, these tools replace ad-hoc localisation, generic AI prompts, and expensive local hiring with a single, workflow-native platform.

KAI was born from firsthand experience. After nearly a decade in international B2B sales, we repeatedly saw good products fail in new markets, not because of demand, but because of miscommunication. Subtle cultural differences in tone, structure, and expectations can quietly kill deals.
Existing tools focus on productivity or analytics. None solve the real execution problem of how sales teams communicate internationally on a day-to-day basis. We built KAI to close that gap.
This Kickstarter campaign funds the completion and launch of KAI’s MVP, including:
This is about delivering a working, usable product, not just an idea.

KAI is already in development. We’re building it as a cloud-native, multi-tenant SaaS platform using proven AI infrastructure. Funding allows us to accelerate development, stabilise the beta, and onboard early users in a controlled, responsible way.
Backers won’t just get access, they’ll help shape how KAI evolves.
KAI is founded by an international B2B sales leader with an MBA from Cranfield School of Management, alongside an experienced AI product leader specialising in scalable, production-grade AI systems.
We’re building KAI as a long-term platform but this Kickstarter is about launching it right.
By backing KAI, you’re supporting:
If you believe SaaS teams should be able to sell globally without scaling headcount or losing trust, KAI is for you.

project.name: The SlicedPrint Pilot: Validating the Automatic Fabric
project.description: We developed an AI-driven automation system for 3D printing. Help us build the hardware pilot-rig and stress-test the software.

creator.name: Nico Pape
creator.biography: Hey, I’m Nico. I’m an IT guy at heart – I just love efficiency. What I don’t love? The insane markup on professional 3D prints. That’s exactly why I started SlicedPrint. I’m using code to automate an entire fleet of printers, effectively building a Micro-Factory from the ground up. My goal is simple: Industrial quality for everyone, without the heavy price tag.

texte: The Vision: Automating the Maker Spirit My name is Nico. I am an IT specialist and a maker. For years, I was frustrated by the gap between hobby printing and industrial manufacturing. So, I wrote a piece of software to bridge it.

I have developed a proprietary automation workflow that coordinates FDM printers to work as a unified swarm. The code is ready. The logic is sound. Now, I need to build the physical "body" to test the "brain".

What we are creating in this project This Kickstarter is not about starting a generic shop. It is a Pilot Run to validate the SlicedPrint automation software in a real-world scenario. We are building a specific array of 4 Anycubic Kobra S1 units, modified with our custom "ACME" auto-ejection system and connected to our control server.

Why we need you We need to run a "Stress Test". We need real files, real geometries, and real volume to feed the algorithm. By backing this project, you are not buying "store credit". You are funding the hardware setup and raw materials for this specific pilot phase. In exchange, you get to be part of the test run: You send us your STLs, and our system manufactures them to prove it works.
The Goal Once all "Beta Batches" from this campaign are printed and shipped, the pilot phase is complete, and the system is validated.
Thank you for the Support.
Best wishes to you
Sincerly Nico

project.name: Test Your World: Finally Know What You're Breathing
project.description: What's In Your Air? Your Filter Knows. Over 50% of homes have mold but only 5% test. Affordable testing with clear actionable results.

creator.name: Matthew DeWolfe
creator.biography: Founder & CEO of BRS Lab Services. Former US Marine. Running dual-licensed microbial testing labs in the US and Canada. Built Test Your World to give regular people access to the same professional air quality testing we provide hospitals and schools.

titre: Test Your World: Finally Know What You're Breathing
🩹 AirPatch: Stick it. Wait. Mail it. Done.
✂️ FilterCut: For the Hands-On Homeowner
📍 SwabCheck: For the Spot You're Suspicious About
🎯 We Test 5× More Than Anyone Else
texte: "I wonder what's in my air." Maybe it was when the seasons changed. Maybe you moved into a new place and something just felt off. Maybe you're just curious about the environment inside your home.

You thought about getting your air tested. Then you Googled it. Confusing options. Expensive equipment. Science experiments growing mold in dishes around your house. So you didn't do it. Most people don't.
We get it. That's why we made it ridiculously simple.
According to the EPA:
🏚️ 50% of homes show signs of water damage that could lead to mold 🍄 60%+ of homes tested have at least one indoor mold problem 🤷 Yet less than 5% of homes ever get their air tested

Here's the thing most people don't realize: Your HVAC filter has been collecting everything floating around your home for months. Mold spores. Pollen. Pet dander. Dust. Fibers. Particles from outside. It's basically a diary of everything your family has been breathing.We just read it for you.

Don't worry if you can't cut your filter, just use the air patch! (instructions included) AirPatch and FilterCut samples go to the same accredited laboratory and receive the same detailed mold identification and spore count analysis. The difference is in how we calculate your results: AirPatch uses a controlled 7-day sampling window with continuous airflow, giving us precise data about your air quality during that period. FilterCut analyzes months of accumulated particles, giving us a longer-term picture—though with slightly more estimation since we're working backward from your filter's history. Either way, you get a clear, actionable report about what's in your air.
Not everyone has easy access to their HVAC filter. Maybe you rent. Maybe your system is in a weird spot. Maybe you just don't want to mess with it.
That's why we created AirPatch — a simple 4"×4" sampling patch that works anywhere air moves.
1️⃣ We send you an AirPatch with a prepaid return envelope
2️⃣ Stick it wherever you want to test — your options are endless
3️⃣ Wait 7 days while it collects what's floating around
4️⃣ Peel it off, seal it up, and mail it back
5️⃣ Get your results in 5-7 days
That's it. No cutting filters. No special equipment. No guesswork.

Unlike instant "snapshot" tests that only capture what's in the air at that exact moment, AirPatch collects data over a full week. That means you get a real picture of your air — not just a lucky (or unlucky) 5-minute sample.

Anyone who wants maximum flexibility. Renters who can't access HVAC systems. Parents who want to check the nursery. Skeptics who want to know if their air purifier is earning its keep. People who built a DIY filter and want proof it works.
One patch. Endless possibilities.

Got a filter that's been collecting dust for a month or more? Perfect. That's not just dirt — it's data. Your HVAC filter has been quietly capturing everything floating through your home: mold spores, pollen, pet dander, dust, fibers, particles from outside.
We send you heavy-duty shears and gloves. You cut a 4"×4" sample, send it back, and we tell you what your home's been breathing the whole time.
1️⃣ We send you a FilterCut kit with shears, gloves, and prepaid return envelope
2️⃣ Pull your used HVAC filter (30+ days old is ideal)
3️⃣ Cut a 4"×4" sample from the center
4️⃣ Seal it up and mail it back
5️⃣ Get your results in 5-7 days
✅ Shears (cuts through wire mesh)
✅ One 4"×4" AirPatch sampling patch
✅ Nitrile gloves (handle safely)
✅ Sample bag
✅ Simple instructions
✅ Prepaid return envelope
✅ Full lab analysis (182 categories)
✅ Plain-English report with your results

Your HVAC system circulates air from every room in your house — living room, bedrooms, basement, kitchen — all passing through one filter. A filter that's been in place for 2-6 months has captured a complete picture of what your family has been breathing. Not a 5-minute snapshot. Months of accumulated data in one sample.

Homeowners comfortable using tools. People who already have a used filter ready to go. Anyone who likes the idea of using what they've got and doesn't mind a little hands-on work. DIYers who'd rather cut a filter than wait for a patch to collect.
One filter. Months of data. Complete picture.
Spot Check Any Surface

You've seen it. That corner in the basement. The ceiling above the shower. The spot under the sink that got wet last year. The windowsill that always seems dusty. You've wondered about it. Now you can find out.
We send you a professional-grade swab. You wipe the surface you're curious about, seal it up, and mail it back. Simple.
1️⃣ We send you a SwabCheck kit with swabs and prepaid return envelope
2️⃣ Swab the surface you're curious about
3️⃣ Seal it in the provided container
4️⃣ Mail it back
5️⃣ Get your results in 5-7 days
No guessing. No wondering. Just answers about that specific spot.
✅ Professional-grade sampling swab
✅ Sealed container
✅ Simple instructions
✅ Prepaid return envelope
✅ Full lab analysis
✅ Plain-English report with your results

Filter tests and AirPatch tell you what's floating in your air. SwabCheck tells you what's growing on a specific surface. If you've got a spot that worries you — something you can see or smell — this is the fastest way to get answers about that exact location.
People with a specific concern. A spot that got wet. A stain that appeared. A corner that smells musty. A surface you've been wondering about. Stop guessing and find out what's actually there.
One swab. One surface. Clear answers.

Would you trust a doctor who only looked at 20% of your X-ray? That's what most air quality labs do. They use a method from the 1960s called the "traverse" — an analyst looks at a quarter of your sample and extrapolates the rest. We do it differently. Our digital scanner captures 100% of your sample — 1,300 to 1,600 high-resolution images stitched together. AI analyzes every spore, every particle. Nothing missed. Nothing estimated.

We ask a few quick questions — home size, filter age, filter type — and our patent-pending calculations do the rest. We factor in how much air your system actually processes, how efficient your filter is at catching particles, and how long it's been collecting. The result? Actual spore concentrations. An integrated API allows us to compare the data to EPA outdoor air quality for your zip code. Real data. Real context. Real answers. No guessing. No extrapolation. Just facts

Most home air test kits check for 36 things. 🍄 Mold & Fungal Spores — 90+ types (including black mold). 🌿 Ascospores — 40+ types. 🍂 Basidiospores — 25+ types. 🌸 Pollen — 5 types 🏠 Dust & Fibers — Insulation, carpet, carbon, soil. 🐕 Biological — Pet dander, dust mites, skin cells. 📏 Particle Sizes — From deep lung to nose/throat More categories = more answers = fewer surprises.
Petri Dish Kits ($20-$50)

🧫 You set out dishes. Wait for mold to grow. Pay extra per dish for analysis. ❌ Only tests 5-15 types (we test 182) ❌ You're growing mold in your home on purpose. ❌ Results change based on where you put them. ❌ Still doesn't tell you if it's a problem.
DIY Spore Trap Pump Kits ($199-$299)

🔌  Legitimate professional tools, but... Should be in the professional’s hands. ❌ You're buying expensive equipment ❌ Only captures what's in the air at that exact moment (5-10 minutes) ❌ Need to test each room separately ❌ Results change minute-to-minute
Test Your World— A Better Way
✅ No equipment to buy — we send everything you need, including prepaid return shipping
✅ Tests 182 categories — mold, pollen, dust, fibers, dander, and more
✅ Captures real data over time — days or months, not a 5-minute snapshot
✅ Works with what you have — or use our AirPatch if you can't access your filter
✅ Flexible options — test your whole home, a single room, or a specific surface
✅ Professional lab analysis
👨‍🔬 Who We Are

We're BRS Lab Services — a real laboratory with real scientists. We serve hospitals, schools, commercial buildings, and agricultural operations across the US and Canada. We built Test Your World because everyone deserves a simple starting point. You don't need to spend thousands on professional inspectors. You don't need to become an air quality expert. You just need to start somewhere. Something is better than nothing. And knowing is better than wondering. Your air matters. Your health matters. This is the easy first step.  It's professional laboratory analysis made simple enough for anyone to use.

For years, we've provided air quality testing for hospitals, schools, and commercial buildings. Professional-grade analysis. Detailed reports. Real answers. But regular people? They were stuck with petri dishes and guesswork. That didn't sit right with us.
What Your Support Funds:
✅ Consumer-friendly kits — no confusing equipment, no science degree required
✅ Plain-English reports — results that actually make sense
✅ A simplified process — designed for real people, not lab techs
✅ Kickstarter-exclusive pricing — the best deal we'll ever offer
✅ Platform upgrades — so we can serve thousands of homes, not just hundreds
You're not just buying a test. You're helping us prove that everyone deserves to know what they're breathing — not just those who can afford $500 inspections.
🖐️  $1 — High Five — Thanks + updates
📖  $5 — Curious One — Thanks + updates and Digital air quality guide
🎯 $29 —  Swab test (Save $3)
⚡  $39 — Early Bird Filter — 1 Whole Home test, LIMITED TO 100! (Save $30)
✅  $49 — Standard Filter Snapshot — 1 Whole Home test (Save $20)
🔄  $79 — Two Seasons — 2 Whole Home tests (Save $59)
📅  $215 — Yearly Plan — 4 Filters + 2 Swabs (Save $125)
⭐ $399 — Founding Member —10 Filter tests /5 Swab tests (only 50).
🤝 $625 — Partner Pack — 25 Filter tests   (LIMITED TO 50 PROFESSIONALS)
🙏 The Ask

You spend about 90% of your life indoors. Most of that is at home. Half of all homes have potential mold issues. Less than 5% ever get tested. You've wondered what you're breathing. Everyone has. Now you can actually find out.  No hassle. No expensive equipment. No growing mold in your kitchen. Just answers.You're not just buying a test. You're helping us prove that everyone deserves to know what they're breathing — not just those who can afford Expensive inspections.

project.name: CRE Valuation Pro
project.description: Professional-grade commercial real estate underwriting, valuation, and deal analysis—built for real investors.

creator.name: Robert Johnson
creator.biography: Passionate entrepreneur building brands from the beach up. App creator, and real estate investor with a vision for impact and growth.

texte: Why We’re Raising Funds
Commercial real estate underwriting is still dominated by spreadsheets.

Most investors, brokers, and operators rely on fragile Excel models that are hard to audit, easy to break, and nearly impossible to standardize across deals and teams. Small changes can cause hidden errors. Sharing models creates version chaos. And institutional-level analysis is often locked behind expensive, closed systems.
CRE Valuation Pro was created to solve this problem.

This project began as a practical tool to replace my own spreadsheets with a cleaner, more transparent way to analyze real commercial real estate deals. Over time, it evolved into a web-based platform designed to model cash flow, returns, and valuation scenarios across multiple asset classes in a consistent, repeatable way.

CRE Valuation Pro is an actively developed platform currently in its final pre-launch phase. The core functionality is in place and usable today, and this campaign is designed to support a strong and well-executed public launch.
We’re raising funds to take CRE Valuation Pro from a working product into a more complete, stable, and accessible platform for the broader commercial real estate community.
What We’re Building
CRE Valuation Pro is a cloud-based underwriting and valuation platform for commercial real estate that is preparing for its full public launch.
It is designed to help users:
Analyze income-producing properties using clear, structured assumptions
Model cash flow, financing, and exit scenarios
Evaluate deals across common asset classes such as multifamily, office, retail, industrial, hospitality, and specialty assets
Replace spreadsheet-based workflows with a centralized, auditable system
This is not an investment fund, advisory service, or promise of financial outcomes. It is a software tool that helps users organize, analyze, and understand deal assumptions more clearly.
What the $20,000 Will Be Used For
The funds raised through this Kickstarter will be used to support final launch preparation and platform refinement.
Specifically, the budget will be allocated toward:

Core product development
Improving stability, calculations, and workflows across asset classes

User experience and interface refinement
Making the platform easier to understand, faster to use, and more intuitive for first-time users

Infrastructure and hosting costs
Ensuring reliable access, data persistence, and performance

Documentation and onboarding content
Creating guides and examples so backers can use the platform effectively

Limited contractor support
Assisting with frontend polish and testing where needed
The funding goal is intentionally modest. It reflects what is realistically needed to complete these improvements and support the platform’s public launch.
Why This Matters to Me
I care about this project because I’ve lived the problem.

Commercial real estate analysis is too important to be left to broken formulas, hidden cells, and outdated templates. Good underwriting should be transparent, repeatable, and easy to understand — whether you’re reviewing your own deal or sharing it with partners.

CRE Valuation Pro is about raising the baseline for how deals are evaluated, without requiring institutional budgets or closed systems. This project exists to make professional-grade analysis more accessible and more honest.
How We Plan to Make It Happen
The platform already exists and is actively being developed.
This Kickstarter campaign supports the final phase of launch readiness, including:
Finalizing features
Improving reliability
Preparing infrastructure for broader access
Gathering feedback from early supporters and users
Development will continue during and after the campaign. Backers will receive access based on their reward tier as the platform enters its public release, along with updates as improvements are made.
The scope of this project is intentionally controlled. No stretch promises, no speculative features, and no dependency on outside funding.
Not all backers are expected to be users of the platform; some may simply wish to support the project and its goals.
Thank You
Backing this project means supporting a practical tool for commercial real estate analysis and helping move the industry away from fragile, spreadsheet-driven workflows.
Thank you for taking the time to read, support, and share this project.
Founders Wall Recognition
The Founders Wall is a dedicated digital space within the CRE Valuation Pro platform recognizing early supporters who helped make the project possible.
Depending on reward tier, supporters may be recognized by name or company logo. This recognition is honorary in nature and does not constitute advertising, endorsement, or solicitation.

project.name: Your Message, Our Drone, One Mission
project.description: Support the launch of the SM-300 Cargo VTOL — a next-generation heavy-lift drone that carries your name into the sky.

creator.name: Victor Olkhovskiy
creator.biography: Engineer and commercial pilot. Graduated from the Institute of Artificial Intelligence (Ukraine, 2001). Experience in neural networks, predictive analytics, databases, Python & TensorFlow. Trained at Lufthansa Flight Training, frozen ATPL.

titre: 🧭 Who we are ✈️ What we’re building 💡 How this project began 🌍 Reducing Emissions and Fuel Consumption 🧩 Our plan & schedule 💰 Budget overview ✈️ A shared dream that takes flight
texte:
We are a small, international team of engineers, designers, and pilots united by a single goal — to make vertical flight simpler, faster, and more efficient.
Our group has already built and tested multiple drone prototypes, working together with partners in Germany, Lithuania, USA, Ukaraine, Poland and one person from Canada.
We’ve spent the past few years developing components such as transmissions, swashplates, control systems, and lightweight airframes, all leading to the creation of the SM-300 Cargo VTOL — our most advanced model yet.

The SM-300 is a hybrid vertical take-off and landing (VTOL) cargo drone capable of carrying up to 150 kg of payload and flying at speeds of up to 400 km/h with endurance of up to 5 hours.
It combines the versatility of a helicopter with the efficiency of a fixed-wing aircraft, opening new possibilities for logistics, rescue operations, and autonomous missions.

Our prototype — the one you see on this page — is real and operational, already assembled and currently undergoing system integration tests.
With your support, we plan to complete the final stage of testing and first full-scale flight.

The Flight Project started with a simple but bold idea — to rethink how vertical flight can be achieved efficiently.
In 2021, we built our first prototype — a twin-rotor drone based on the Chinook helicopter principle. It was our first step toward understanding the balance between lifting power and mechanical efficiency.

During 2022–2023, we met with potential customers and aviation partners to better understand their real-world needs.
It became clear that the market doesn’t just need a heavy-lift drone — it needs an aircraft with low operating costs, long endurance, and higher speed than traditional helicopters.

This insight led us to a completely new approach:
We moved from a twin-rotor concept to a convertible VTOL design with a rotating fuselage, capable of both vertical lift and efficient horizontal flight.
To achieve this, we developed:
These innovations form the foundation of the SM-300 Cargo VTOL, a next-generation hybrid aircraft designed to perform real missions in the near future — not as a concept, but as a working machine.
The SM-300 prototype is now ~90% ready for flight, and this campaign will help us launch and document its first full-scale test flights.

One of the key goals of the SM-300 Cargo VTOL is to significantly reduce CO₂ emissions compared to conventional helicopters used for cargo transport and logistics.
By combining vertical takeoff capability with fixed-wing aerodynamic efficiency, the SM-300 consumes less fuel and can perform missions at a fraction of the operating cost.

By using a lightweight airframe, optimized aerodynamics, and high-efficiency engines, the SM-300 can achieve up to 70% lower CO₂ emissions compared to light and medium helicopters performing similar missions.
In practical terms, that means lower fuel costs, lower noise, and a real contribution to cleaner skies — all while maintaining speed and mission flexibility.

We are now entering the final and most critical phase of the Flight Project — preparing the SM-300 Cargo VTOL for its first series of integrated tests and flight demonstrations.
All major assemblies are complete, and 2025–2026 will be dedicated to systems integration, ground testing, and full flight validation.
🔧 Q4 2025 – Final Integration and Ground Systems Testing
🧪 Q1 2026 – First Flight Campaign (Helicopter Mode)
⚙️ Q2 2026 – Performance Tuning and Endurance Flights
🚀 Q3 2026 – Transition, Cruise & Public Presentation

Each milestone will be documented and shared through exclusive backer updates, photos, and videos.
When the SM-300 lifts off, every name and message on the drone will literally take flight with us.

Every euro raised through Kickstarter will go directly toward completing and testing the SM-300 Cargo VTOL prototype.
Our team already built the full-scale aircraft and covered the majority of its production costs internally.
Now, your support will help us finish the final stage — turning a completed prototype into a flying, proven machine.
Here’s how the funds will be used:
We’ve already covered more than 70% of the total development costs ourselves.

Every expense directly supports testing and validation.
We’re using our existing facilities, in-house fabrication tools, and university partnerships to minimize costs and maximize real progress.
Backers will receive detailed updates with photos and videos from each phase, showing exactly where the support goes.

The SM-300 Cargo VTOL has a total surface area of 13.2 square meters, including its active winglets.
We’re inviting you to become part of that surface — to help lift our dream into the sky.
We’re offering 10 square meters of the drone’s surface to our supporters — every message, every logo, every name that will fly with us represents a piece of that shared vision.

Our team is self-funding the entire development — from materials to testing — but in every project like this, funding is the lifeblood.
Your support will help us move faster, reduce delays, and complete the first flight of a real, working machine that was built from passion and persistence.

project.name: TrackiTmaps: AI-Powered Companion
project.description: Revolutionize your hunts with AI that predicts prime animal locations based on real-time data. Great for beginners, or the busy hunters

creator.name: Aaron Brown
creator.biography: A man with a dream

texte: Imagine you're a first-time hunter stepping into the wild for the very first time. The excitement is there, but so is the uncertainty—where do you even start? Or maybe you're an experienced hunter exploring a new area, like moving from the flatlands to Montana's rugged mountains, and you have no local knowledge to rely on. Worse yet, life gets in the way: work, family, or just the short off-season window means you don't have weeks to scout terrain, track patterns, or wait out weather changes.

Traditional hunting relies on trial and error, gut instinct, and time-intensive prep. For many, this leads to frustrating blank days, wasted trips, and missed opportunities. In a world where outdoor adventures should be rewarding and sustainable, these barriers keep too many people from enjoying the thrill of the hunt responsibly.

That's where TrackiTmaps comes in. We're building an innovative mobile app that uses advanced AI to predict optimal hunting locations for specific animals, analyzing real-time factors like geographical location, elevation, time of day, current and upcoming weather, season, typical animal behavior, rutting status, human pressure, and population density. No more guesswork—TrackiTmaps identifies primary and secondary spots, giving you precise, data-driven insights to enhance your experience.

Whether you're a newbie learning the ropes, scouting unfamiliar land, or squeezing in a quick hunt between commitments, TrackiTmaps empowers you to hunt smarter. It's not about replacing your skills; it's about amplifying them with technology, so you spend less time searching and more time connecting with nature.
Key Features:

We've already built high-fidelity prototypes and are nearing beta with our dev team. Your support will polish the app, expand AI datasets, and launch it to hunters everywhere. Join us in making hunting more inclusive and efficient!
TrackiTmaps uses AI technology to predict optimal hunting locations, and we're committed to transparency per Kickstarter's guidelines.
We're aiming for $16,792 to bring TrackiTmaps to life. This includes built-in buffers for Kickstarter's 5% fee and payment processing 5%, netting us about $15,000. Here's the realistic breakdown:
If we overfund, stretch goals include new features like AR overlays or community forums. Every dollar counts—thanks for helping us hit the trail!

Hi, I'm Aaron B. from Missoula, Montana—a dedicated family man, passionate hunter, and seasoned designer who's spent years exploring the backcountry. My family is everything to me; they inspire my drive to create tools that make outdoor adventures more accessible, allowing more time for what truly matters—sharing those experiences with loved ones. Frustrated by the barriers facing new hunters, those in unfamiliar terrain, or anyone juggling busy schedules, I dreamed up TrackiTmaps to blend cutting-edge tech with the timeless tradition of hunting.

With over 14 years in design, I've built verticals from the ground up (0-1), leading teams to launch innovative products that solve real-world problems. My huge passion for hunting—whether tracking elk in the Bitterroot Valley or teaching my kids about wildlife—fuels this project. TrackiTmaps bridges the gap between my design expertise and outdoor love, using AI to predict prime spots and streamline scouting, so hunters like us can focus on the thrill rather than the hassle. With a solid background in outdoor adventures and a dedicated dev team, we're turning this vision into reality. Follow me on LinkedIn (www.linkedin.com/in/aaronbrown316) for updates, behind-the-scenes insights, and hunting stories!
